This is a hybrid role, based in G-Research’s office in Dallas.

G-Research is Europe’s leading quantitative finance research firm. We hire the brightest minds in the world to tackle some of the biggest questions in finance. We pair this expertise with machine learning, big data, and some of the most advanced technology available to predict movements in financial markets.

Opened in 2022, the Dallas office is a key infrastructure hub where we work on the latest technologies in a cutting-edge environment.

The Role

We are seeking a Junior Compute Operations Analyst to join our Compute Infrastructure Engineering team, as we continue to grow our Engineering and Infrastructure Hub in Dallas.

Our Infrastructure Engineering teams manage a complex on-premises cloud platform, which runs 24/7 across multiple time zones. That platform is comprised of thousands of servers, deployed in multi-MW data centers across Europe and the US, in order to run parallelised Research simulations.

As a Junior Compute Operations Analyst, you will support the testing and validating of new hardware, before deploying globally at scale.

Heavily automated pipelines will be critical to provisioning and break-fix however just as critical is keen oversight and daily engagement with external vendors and onsite data centre staff.

This role requires a talented individual who is familiar with our hardware and its use, is capable of multi-tasking and working with upstream engineers to analyse issues and solve new problems.

Key responsibilities of the role include:

Supporting with triaging an inbound queue of requests, queries and logged issues
Working on larger projects, focusing on new hardware rollouts and server migrations
Using Jira and Confluence to detail changes made and update system documentation
Infrequent weekend working, supporting maintenance and upgrades

A typical day will start with a check-in with the team, where ongoing work is discussed, and the handover of any activities agreed. Through the UK’s afternoon you will share the operational workload then, as the UK staff roll off, take full responsibility for monitoring and handling problems observed or reported, escalating locally and to the UK if needed.

You will be encouraged to undertake training and with both career development and mobility across Compute teams available, you can look forward to personal growth from Analyst to Engineer during your career with G-Research.

Who are we looking for?

The ideal candidate will have the following skills and experience:

Highly organised and motivated, with a positive can-do attitude
A strong technical and methodical approach to any given task
A confident and effective communicator over a variety of mediums across multiple teams, as well as with third party vendors and partners
Demonstrate a responsible attitude whilst working on a live estate which hosts valuable research and workloads
An eagerness to learn and develop within the role

Why should you apply?

Market-leading compensation plus annual discretionary bonus
Informal dress code and excellent work/life balance
Excellent paid time off allowance
Sick days, military leave, and family and medical leave
Generous 401(k) plan
12-weeks’ fully paid parental leave

Employee Assistance and Wellness programs

Boeing Global Services (BGS) is looking for a Senior Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team in Plano, TX.

This role will help business leaders to make smarter talent decisions by leveraging advanced data analytics, user-centric design technology and proven methodologies to create reporting solutions, dashboards, and automate metrics across the digital strategy and experience (eCommerce) functions.

The ability to turn manual data processing into automated processing is critical. In addition, you will partner with internal customers, asking the right questions to understand requirement details and ensure accurate reporting. Success within this role hinges on the establishing strong working relationships with stakeholders, understanding existing data, and developing solutions that will enhance visibility of key performance indicators (KPIs).

The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of statistical and predictive modeling concepts, machine-learning approaches, clustering and classification techniques, and recommendation and optimization algorithms. They will also have a strong business intuition and clear expertise in analyses; the ability to describe analytic processes including when and why specific approaches are favored.

Position Responsibilities:

Leads in designing complex Business Intelligence information models, dashboards, metrics and reports utilizing standard technologies and methodologies that meet business objectives
Assesses current technology for best fit
Combines programming, best practices, and business expertise to deliver efficient and scalable business intelligence solutions to improve productivity and business outcomes.
Distills large datasets into effective visualizations for executive reporting through data-analytics/visualization applications and languages (SQL, Python/R, and Tableau)
Develops multiple dashboards for interactive metrics
Leads data exploration within datasets to develop metrics supporting leadership decision making
Partners with multi-functional stakeholders across the business (analytics, information technology, execution, customer success and finance) to help define requirements, extract and compile data, develop optimized performance reporting, and drive business insight
Discovers new opportunities and solutions for problems by looking beyond current practices and using innovative thinking
Defines, designs, plans and manages projects
Controls and delivers project deliverables, project accounting and appraisal, and optimizes the contribution of the people involved
Works independently as well as collaboratively with team members to complete requirements from stakeholders

This position is hybrid. This means that the selected candidate will be required to perform some work onsite at one of the listed location options. This is at the hiring team’s discretion and could potentially change in the future.

Employer will not sponsor applicants for employment visa status.

5+ years of experience performing statistical analysis or using predictive modeling
5+ years of experience in database management, programming, statistical modeling and/or machine learning (SQL, R, Python, Tableau, etc.)
5+ years of experience in ETL (extract-transform-load)
5+ years of experience building intuitive and useful data visualizations that drive business decisions

Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):

Experience collaborating across organizational boundaries and delivering an integrated final product
Excellent interpersonal, written, and presentation skills, high-impact communication style

Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 9 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience (e.g. PhD+4 years' related work experience, Master+7 years' related work experience, 13 years' related work experience, etc.).

DSI Systems Inc., an authorized AT&T Representative partner, has an immediate career opportunity motivated individual to fill one of our key roles as a Business Analyst.
Are you passionate about weaving insights from data into compelling narratives? Do you have a knack for transforming raw data into actionable stories that drive business success? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as a Business Analyst.

As the Business Analyst, you will collaborate cross-functionally with multiple teams to collect data and provide insights to support decision-making. You will identify patterns and trends looking for opportunities to optimize our business. To succeed in this role, you must excel at implementing initiatives and making recommendations for improvements based on data analysis.

*You will be asked to complete a data visualization exercise as a part of the hiring process*

About DSI

DSI is a family-owned company that has been in business since 1984. We provide enhanced value that delivers results for our clients and partners, through sales management, marketing assistance, hardware logistic solutions, immersive training, engineering expertise, and proprietary software solutions.

We believe that relationships are the most important part of our business. Whether it’s mobility, broadband, video, commercial, residential, L&I, MDU, or all; we are a one-stop solution to help sales partners uncover growth opportunities.
Our commitment to excellence drives us to harness the power of data and insights to make informed decisions and achieve remarkable outcomes. As a Business Analyst, you'll play a crucial role in translating data into meaningful stories that guide our business initiatives and fuel our growth.

Join forces cross-functionally with teams including marketing, operations, and finance to gather data and insights to support decision-making
Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities within the data to inform strategic planning and business optimization
Continuously monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of implemented initiatives, making recommendations for improvements based on data analysis
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and visualization
Other duties as assigned

Requirements

Bachelor's degree in Business, Analytics, Data Science, or a related field highly preferred
Proven experience of 3 years in business analysis, data analysis, or a related role
Strong analytical mindset and the ability to derive insights from complex data sets

Excellent storytelling and communication skills, with the ability to present complex data in a clear and concise manner
Strong project management skills and the ability to handle multiple tasks and deadlines
Knowledge of Domo is a plus but not required
Attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy in all aspects of work
Self-motivated and able to work both independently and collaboratively in a team environment

Overview:

Morgan Advanced Materials is a business rich in history and innovation. Founded in the UK in 1856, we have grown into a global organisation with 70 sites in 18 countries. Our model to serve our customers where they need us has led to a diversified product range using our unparalleled expertise in ceramic and carbon materials, which we exploit to solve difficult problems for our customers across a diverse range of markets.


We are a purpose driven organisation. Our purpose is to use advanced materials to make the world more sustainable and to improve the quality of life. We deliver on that purpose through the products that we make, and the way that we make them.


We help our customers push the limits of their processes and products to meet the demanding requirements they face, from higher process temperatures to higher product performance to increasing miniaturisation.

Key Figures: Revenue £1,112m (2022), ~8,500 employees, manufacturing in 30+ countries, and a global customer portfolio. A UK PLC with head office located in Windsor, Berkshire UK. Listed on London Stock Exchange; Member of the FTSE 250 Index.

Morgan IT is on a mission to enable and drive the Morgan goals by being a valuable business partner to all Global Business Units and Functions by:

Extracting Maximum Business Value from IT
Driving disruptive innovation

Serves as liaison to business and IT teams to understand business requirements and create and implement solutions as well as understanding root causes of current issues.

Documents and provides training for newly implemented systems and/or processes using Click Learn
Resolving incidents/issues, with root cause analysis and fix where appropriate, for D365 applications.
Applying functional and technical understanding of D365 to develop new functionality and integrations/interfaces with other systems as required, to support business growth.
Ensuring all aspects of the D365 development lifecycle are completed successfully, incorporating ISV solutions.
Assuring quality of releases (fixes/upgrades/enhancements etc) into production, through thorough testing and first-class environment management.
Ensuring vendor relationships remain transparent and with clearly understood outcomes
Supports Business Information Managers, Project Managers and Solution Architects in writing program / project proposals
Work with business end users to ensure the project meets business needs
Assumes ownership of the process, system, and expands skill base.
Interacts frequently with business process owners.
Conduct unit testing for project deliverables and facilitate user acceptance testing
Engage in efforts to establish scope and business case for new programs and initiatives.
Collaborate with team members to collect and analyse data

Horace Mann was founded in 1945 by two Springfield, Illinois, teachers who saw a need for quality, affordable auto insurance for teachers. Since then, we've broadened our mission to helping all educators protect what they have today and prepare for a successful tomorrow. And with our broadened mission has come corporate growth: We serve more than 4,100 school districts nationwide, we're publicly traded on the New York Stock Exchange (symbol: HMN) and we have more than $12 billion in assets.

We're motivated by the fact that educators take care of our children's future, and we believe they deserve someone to look after theirs. We help educators identify their financial goals and develop plans to achieve them. This includes insurance to protect what they have today and financial products to help them prepare for their future. Our tailored offerings include special rates and benefits for educators.

Why finance at Stryker?

Are you looking for a profitable and growing company with a great culture and reputation? Stryker was recently named one of the Best Workplace in the WORLD by Fortune! Who We Want

Data translators. Highly effective communicators who can transform data findings into recommendations to compose reports and executive level presentations.

Detail-oriented process improvers. Critical thinkers who naturally see opportunities to develop and optimize work processes – finding ways to simplify, standardize and automate.

Plug and play. Ability to operate in an ambiguous environment with constantly changing priorities – can prioritize, arrange, and focus on what matters and importantly, follow through

What You Will Do

As the Lead Analyst, you will support and lead (certain areas) management within the Global Inventory COE for all business areas (O&S, MSNT, Europe, international or GQO). Your primary role will be supporting the reporting structure of inventory which includes having an understanding of information need and report creations, the flow of information through the different ERP’s and other reporting/information systems, advanced analytics reporting, variance analysis reporting, and forecasting (reporting). Additionally, you will provide support for all stakeholder management, in leading all inventory related business support reporting, like month end cycles, including all Flash call reporting support, Balance Sheet reviews reporting, Cash Flow reporting, projections/budget cycles reporting, and any business initiatives related to optimizing inventory reporting, supporting transitions of accounting or inventory work reporting, or system implementations. You will not manage any direct reports.

Business Support reporting:

Leading to inform the manager and directors for identifying and defining all reporting needs to precisely and effectively report on metrices, KPI’s, variances and progress for Global Inventory COE

Reporting could entail consolidated overviews for the divisions, Business review slides, flash comment files, PowerBi, Metrics, KPI’s, Balance reviews, cash flow reviews, projections, budgets, regular balances and trends overviews across divisions, progress reports, updating databases and translate needs into report, etc.

Leading the manager and director(s) on the distribution of reports within the organization.

Leading for making the reports accurate, timely and relevant (reconciled).

Analyze and forecast financial, economic and other data to provide accurate and timely information for strategic and operational decisisions.

Support on possible ad hoc analysis and reports

Leading the production of periodic reports

As Lead Analyst you execute many of the same activities as the manager for certain topics, divisions

Develop

Support in development and maintain dashboard and report documentation

Support in developing automated tools and visualizations to provide real-time insights to business data

Support in developing governance process with notifications and guidance to developers and leaders

Assist in simplifying current way of working for sharing information in a more efficient way

Evaluate and quantify value of new features and functionality to support on development

Leading on process improvements and scalable solutions

Leverage industry research and analysis

Leverage reporting templates

Month end reporting:

Driving the monthly closing reporting leading to the comments on actuals and where possible any deviations towards projections/budget with Divisional Finance, Operations, Supply Chain and Global Finance Service Centers (GFS) teams

Communication/relationships:

Communicate timely value added insights to stakeholders/managers

Proactively communicate changes in business trends, local business decisions or other issues that may have a financial impact and are accounting related

Informing and aligning with other departments within Stryker who are also working on reporting including Artificial Intelligence, predictive procedures and other methodologies

Assist in prioritizing IT requests reporting request

Conduct and document complex financial analysis projects

Develop analysis of economic indicators in order to prepare forecasts and analyze the company's short, medium, and long term position; Prepare in-depth evaluations of plans and identify new methods of analysis and presentation for inventory purpose

Attend knowledge and training sessions for reporting requirements as they evolve

Support in building change management plans for reporting

Planning/analyze:

Lead the planning process in reporting with the internal Inventory COE team for the divisions on preparing forecast models, consolidations, and coordination of projection calls where applicable

Provide quality data into business projections and budget processes

Advice team with regards to patterns and relationships in the data

Analyze system data proactively to identify bottleneck, trends and compliance risks.

Compliance:

Support where needed/applicable for Internal and External Audits (mainly SOX related)

Support in accuracy and consistency of data base information and formatting

Support in achieving accuracy and meeting pre determined deadlines

Support in standard reporting pack is relevant, accurate, reliable and timely

Other:

Support in process improvements (use of BOTS/RPA/Alterix/Others)

Participate in inventory reporting project related items and actively deliver input, such as, further integrations, transitions, and system implementations

Support in ad-hoc questions related to inventory business support

What You Need

Bachelor’s degree in accounting/finance or equivalent is required (Master’s preferred)

4+ years experience in managing complex reporting environments, preferably within inventory and/or other complex accounting functions in global organizations

Fluent in English

Other languages such as Spanish/Polish/Dutch are nice to have

Excellent working knowledge & understanding of systems, programming, SQL, reporting tools, PowerBi, Excel

The Lead level will also typically: possess well developed knowledge and skills to interpret financial information on costs, prices, expenses and revenues and make recommendations to senior management

Should have the ability to see the ‘big picture’ and yet able to resolve day to day issues if required

Oracle/SAP/MFG/JDE experience is a nice to have.

$73,100 - $152,400 salary plus bonus eligible + benefits. Actual minimum and maximum may vary based on location. Individual pay is based on skills, experience, and other relevant factors.

The Brink’s name is a promise to respect the trust we’ve earned in over 150 years in business. Job Title

IT Business Systems Solutions Manager

Job Description

The Brink’s Company (NYSE:BCO) is a leading global provider of cash and valuables management, digital retail solutions, and ATM managed services. Our customers include financial institutions, retailers, government agencies, mints, jewelers and other commercial operations. Our network of operations in 52 countries serves customers in more than 100 countries.

At Brink’s we believe that diverse teams drive success, and as such we foster an inclusive culture that values people with diverse backgrounds, ideas and perspectives. We build a sense of belonging so all employees feel respected, safe and valued, and we provide equal opportunity to participate and grow.

We are currently looking for a IT Business Systems Solutions Manager.

The IT Business Systems Solutions Manager is responsible for planning and managing business development processes and implementing IT business solutions, including post implementation support, technology enhancements required to support Brink’s Capital strategic priorities. This role will be assigned with managing business relationships, translating the business needs into the technical requirements, and ensure the development, testing and implementation comply with the methodologies and policies set by Brink’s Global Technology Shared Services, including IT Security and Risk & Compliance.

Major Responsibilities:

Manage end-to-end business solution delivery projects, including work breakdown structure, project planning, implementation, and communication.

Serve as the primary point of IT contact and collaborate closely with US counterparts, Brink’s Capital business to understand needs and requirements to existing and modern technology platforms. Provide guidance and recommendations.

Execute tasks as required to support the delivery of projects and initiatives, ensuring deliverables align with priorities.

Maintain, support, and upgrade existing business systems and applications. Identify and propose opportunities for improvement, to minimize risk and maximize operational efficiencies, and align with Brink’s Capital strategic priorities. Ensure Management is informed of material changes to scope and/or design that would impact the timeline and resource requirements.

Oversee compliance with relevant regulations (e.g., SOX) and identify areas for improvement

Actively participate in lean and process improvement activities, driving efficiency and effectiveness in our operations.

Architect innovative solutions and challenge existing processes to identify opportunities for improvement.

Manage technical engagement with external partners, as required, collaborating to produce designs that meet the Global and country business and technology requirements.

Maintain a detailed understanding of industry standards and technology platforms, identifying areas for personal development, to maximize potential and expand in the role and career within Brink’s. Foster strategic thinking within the team and contribute to the creation of long-term plans and goals.

Frequent travel

Minimum work experience requirements:

10-15 years of direct experience implementing and supporting enterprise level systems

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, etc.)

Excellent customer service and interpersonal skills.

Application Delivery Process-Knowledge of major tasks, deliverables, formal methodologies, and disciplines for delivering new or enhanced applications.

Ability to clearly gather client requirements and manage expectations.

Budgeting-Knowledge of specific policies and practices for planning and administration of budget.

Relationship Management-Ability to establish and build healthy working relations and partnerships with clients, vendors, and peers.

Ability to communicate complex information in an easy-to-understand way.

Demonstrates initiative, independence, and accountability.

Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and mathematical skills.

Dedication to detail and must have process improvement skill set.

Excellent organizational and time management skills

Desired work experience:

15+ years (Audit both Public & Private Industry)

Master's degree

Previous Banking/Financial Industry experience

Preferably Big Four or Consulting experience

Technical or Specialized Skills Required:

Proven experience in IT leadership and project management, preferably in a collaborative and interdependent environment.

Strong understanding of architecting solutions and evaluating existing systems for potential improvements.

Strategic mindset and the ability to contribute to the development of long-term plans.

Hands-on approach and the ability to work independently and take ownership of tasks.

Exceptional written and oral communication skills and able to effectively interact with all staff levels and executive management using suitable interpersonal styles and techniques.

Ability to absorb and impact information and work within standard operating procedures.

Able to apply analytical / critical thinking and business acumen; understand broader business environment.

Business analysis skills and the ability to comprehend complex business processes.

Familiarity with compliance regulations (e.g., SOX) and the ability to oversee compliance efforts.

Manager, Product Management - Human Resources

In HR we are focused on building intuitive experiences for Capital One associates. Our product managers partner with cross functional teams of product, tech, design and data to define, design and build technology solutions that engage and serve thousands of associates daily.

We believe our portfolio of businesses and investments in growth and transformation will result in a company with the scale, brand, capabilities, talent, and values to succeed as the digital revolution transforms our society and our industry.

Do you dream of well-designed and intuitive products and customer experiences? Do you want to be the one who introduces change to help tens of millions of customers make smarter financial choices? Do you want to change the way people manage their money? If you answered yes to all of these questions, then product management at Capital One may be a fit for you

In this role, you’ll be expected to demonstrate proficiency in four key areas

Human Centered

You’ll define clear and actionable problem statements to help teams deliver results while displaying a comprehensive understanding of iterative software delivery, capable of thin-slice MVP grooming

You’ll leverage customer insights to influence priorities and roadmap feature development while advocating for and driving alignment between stakeholders in the development of acceptance criteria

You’ll obsess over UX/UI patterns and seek to create world class, omni-channel experiences

Business Focused

You’ll own and prioritize the near-term product roadmap to deliver on business outcomes, quickly identifying points of leverage in complex problems or systems, and utilizing data effectively to define success metrics and measurable outcomes

You’ll utilize balanced judgment in decisions about risks of both actions taken and not taken while innovating on ways to iterate faster in a well-managed way for the immediate team

Technology Driven

You’ll understand and leverage technology and end-state architecture vision to partner with technology team to drive comprehensive design decisions out of white space technical problems

You’ll share business strategy and roadmap with Tech partners to establish context while also leading and facilitating agile ceremonies alongside Tech Lead

You’ll deliver value by creating reusable, extensible and resilient capabilities and proactively identify opportunities when key metrics on security, resilience and performance are not performing

Integrated Problem Solving

Develop and champion a bold vision that drives meaningful outcomes by embracing the art of the possible

Build frameworks for complex decision making that enable effective debate and accelerate getting to the right answer

Transformational Leadership

You’ll develop and communicate a 6-month vision to senior stakeholders and partner teams with accurate details and transparency on risks and impediments, and proactively build relationships with those outside of your immediate team resulting in horizontal influence

You’ll Contribute to team culture and recruiting by leading activities to attract and retain top talent and mentoring and developing junior product associates

We want you if you are:

Intellectually Curious. You ask why, you explore, you're not afraid to blurt out your crazy idea or follow an email chain for weeks to find someone with an answer. Comfortable with ambiguity, a hunger to learn and a seeker of new challenges.

Communicator & Influencer. You can communicate complex ideas clearly regardless of your audience. Our team knows their priorities and why they’re doing what they’re doing. You always can rally associates to work with you.

Do-er. You’re biased toward action, you try things and sometimes you fail. You can get around roadblocks and stay focused on your goals. You’re well organized, able to multitask and able to prioritize your work.

Passionate & Customer Focus. You care about growing others and bringing them together around what’s possible. You get a thrill from the journey of building and shipping products, and you have a desire and ability to connect with our external or internal customers to fully understand their needs.

Learner. You have an appetite to learn new things or new technologies all while exhibiting humbleness when the time comes to ask for help.

Team Player. You enjoy working with diverse people and driving the team toward a common goal. You have the ability to put the team before yourself and establish long-lasting relationships.

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree or military experience

At least 3 year of product management experience or at least 3 year of experience in product design, agile delivery, business analysis, data science, or software engineering

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or Engineering

MBA or Master’s degree

2+ years of experience in Agile product management

Who We Are

Verily is a subsidiary of Alphabet that is using a data-driven approach to change the way people manage their health and the way healthcare is delivered. Launched from Google X in 2015, our purpose is to bring the promise of precision health to everyone, every day. We are focused on generating and activating data from a variety of sources, including clinical, social, behavioral and the real world, to arrive at the best solutions for a person based on a comprehensive view of the evidence. Our unique expertise and capabilities in technology, data science and healthcare enable the entire healthcare ecosystem to drive better health outcomes.

Description

As a Senior IT Business Analyst, you will partner with engineering resources and Verily internal business clients to design, develop, and maintain Verily’s broad range of systems and tools. You will manage the customer side of complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your excellent collaboration and communication skills. You will develop a deep understanding of the business requirements and priorities with Verily stakeholders and act as their advocate through the entire IT project lifecycle, assuring our technology projects are optimally aligned to those business needs. This includes helping clients define their needs, gathering/documenting requirements and user stories, providing technical advisory and consulting, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders, designing and implementing new processes, and supporting clients through Verily-facing & internally-facing rollouts. You will help strategically prioritize technical needs into a comprehensive project pipeline.

You need to be equally comfortable describing analyses and recommendations to customers and executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers. You have a passion for excellent customer service and thrive in a fast-paced, change-oriented business environment that requires collaboration with a global team. You must be an independent worker with the ability to understand multiple business lines and systems down to small details while still keeping the big picture in focus.

With your technical expertise, you build and integrate business applications and influence the design of features that improve the reliability of our applications and systems. You also define the scope of technical projects and manage execution. You work closely with technical teams to implement scalable, reusable solutions.

Responsibilities

Partner with business group(s) to understand and anticipate in-depth business requirements, priorities, and processes; be an advocate in conversations with technical partners and negotiate best outcomes balancing both specific business needs and broader organizational priorities.
Partner with internal and external technology and business teams to translate business needs into technical terms, including business cases, business requirements, functional requirements, user journeys, and business process flow charts.
Work with engineering team to maintain and coordinate communication with business stakeholders throughout each project.
Support testing cycles (UAT, regression, system) and/or Training/Training Materials.
Think holistically and work cross-functionally to design and improve processes and tools, work with both highly technical and non-technical disciplines to ensure that program inputs and requirements are translated to achieve the desired results.

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in business or technology, or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of experience in business analysis, technology development, or a related field.
Experience in Salesforce (SFDC) CRM (Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Service Cloud voice and Marketing Cloud) with end to end implementation experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

Familiarity with Agile or other development methodologies and experience in operating as part of a product/project team.
Working knowledge of database and system architecture concepts & functionality.
Excellent interpersonal skills, with a track record of building meaningful relationships and cross-functional connections.
Experience with Quote to cash and Contact to service business processes is a plus.
Experience with healthcare & life sciences, human resources, compliance & legal, supply chain, or manufacturing is a plus.
Knowledge of GDPR, HIPAA and related regulations would be a plus.

The Senior Business Analysis Manager delivers big insights and helps leaders throughout the business to make critical strategic and operational decisions and shape the long-term vision of T-Mobile. They will work with Agile delivery teams linking between business stakeholders, SMEs and the technical delivery team to translate business needs into technical deliverables. In this role, the Senior Business Analysis Manager works to define requirements and acceptance criteria, develop features, break down user stories, and coordinate user acceptance testing and business validation.They build customer-centric recommendations advised by analysis, good business insight and partner with the business to drive improvements through creativity, and effective communication.

They lead collaborative efforts with various teams including marketing, product and platform teams on complex modeling and analysis requests. responsible for defining and refining user stories and prioritizing the Agile Team backlog to streamline execution of product (program) priorities while maintaining conceptual and technical integrity of features for the team.

Job Responsibilities:

Interact with various teams across the T-Mobile to provide insights, analysis and recommendations that deliver data-driven, optimized experiences. This includes delivery of solutions through Agile workstreams.
Partner with business, internal/external stakeholders and leadership to understand current customer experiences, identify areas of opportunity, and work with internal consultants as they build and manage product vision and near-term roadmap. Work with developers to ensure appropriate scenarios are considered in delivery.
Elicit and evaluate information gathered from various sources, reconcile requirement conflicts, and extract true needs to distinguish solution ideas from presented user requests.
Represent business in the sequencing and delivery of technical capabilities.
Construct executive-level presentations and present sophisticated findings in clear, concise and decision-impacting manner. Possess the ability to influence leadership through fact-based analysis.
Manage personal work-plan to deliver on assigned tasks, deliverables, and schedule commitments; provides information and status to stakeholders and Agile delivery teams.

Education:

About us:

We are Deoleo. The Olive Oil Company

For centuries, our olive oil has been a staple of kitchens around the globe. Armed with knowledge and passion, we are focused on producing quality olive oil and leading our industry into a more sustainable future.

Deoleo is the world’s largest olive oil company with world-leading brands such as Carbonell, Bertolli, and Carapelli. Producing our oil in Spain and Italy; and distributing our brands from Australia to Alaska. We´re a multinational company with offices in many locations, headquartered in Madrid, Spain.

Our mission is to nurture healthier futures by making Mediterranean goodness available to all.

Our ambition is to be the undisputed leader of the olive oil industry.

Without compromising traditional flavors, the company strives to offer premium-quality products in line with today’s lifestyles. All of Deoleo’s brands meet and exceed the extensive, strict quality requirements of the International Olive Council (IOC), and the European Union (EU). Beyond olive oil, Deoleo products include premium vinegars and the finest table olives available.

What are we looking for?

We are looking for an ambitious and talented profile to join our Commercial Department as Sales Analyst (Onsite) Located in Dallas.

MISSION

The Sales Analyst role aims to bolster and assist regional Sales teams by generating insightful reports that support sales initiatives. This position involves offering key insights into sales trends across essential items and categories. Additionally, the role entails providing cross-functional support in collaboration with Marketing, Finance, and Operations.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:

Conduct comprehensive sales and market data analysis for both internal and external stakeholders in a dynamic environment.

Develop and assist in the creation of presentation decks for customer meetings.
Develop and refine category strategies and tactics in collaboration with Marketing to build customer partnerships that deliver volume and profit goals.
Create promotional analysis to support Regional Business Managers' promotional decisions.
Ensure timely entry of baselines and promotions into our forecasting software.
Act as a technical resource for the business, proficiently handling reporting tools such as Power BI and Excel Power Query.

Education

BS/BA degree in a business discipline or equivalent experience

Experience

1-2 years of experience in Sales, Category Management, or Planning within a CPG organization.
Proven ability to work with diverse data sources and strong analytical skills.
Experience with syndicated data (IRI, Nielsen, Spins) is a plus.
Highly skilled in a commercial mindset and understanding of marketing and sales principles.
Familiarity with data analysis and forecasting methods.

Competencies

Effective written and verbal communication skills.
Process-oriented, fact-based, and a sense of urgency.
Quick learner with a proactive approach to applying new technologies.
Strong analytical skills with a solution-oriented mindset.
Cross-cultural awareness and ability to collaborate with diverse cultures.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel (DAX, Power Query (M)) and PowerPoint.
Advanced skills in Power BI or Tableau preferred.
SQL and Python knowledge is a plus.
Fluent in spoken and written English. Spanish is a plus.

Job Title: External Reporting – Business Analyst - Senior Associate
Job Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION


As a Product Delivery Senior Associate on the External Reporting team you will be responsible for analyzing large sets of loan level data, evaluating and translating reporting instructions into sound and quality data, improving analytical review process, maintaining documentations on change control procedures. This position is primarily responsible for gathering, interpreting, and managing reporting requirements for external regulatory institutions (FDIC, FRB, OCC, etc.). This is a hands-on role with a great potential for career growth. We are looking for an individual with unique combination of strong technical (SQL) and interpersonal skills to drive the continuous data improvement. This role will work collaboratively with both internal team members and a wide range of partners from Home Lending Business, Technology, MIS and risk.

Job Responsibilities

Deep dive analysis of the data to ensure accuracy of reporting
Comfortable analyzing large data sets and conducting root cause analysis to understand and remediate reporting anomalies
Responsible for detailed documentation of Requirements/Requirement interpretation
Conduct data research to triage issues, identify root cause and recommend solutions to fix data defects
Work with other teams (IT, CCB Data Management & Risk etc.) to identify data issues and improve data quality for CCAR files and to effectively update logic during system conversions / decommissions as well as new acquisitions
Preparation of various reporting metrics for inclusion in presentations to Steering Committee and Management

Required qualifications, capabilities and skills

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, MIS, Finance, Accounting, Mathematics or related area
3+ years of Mortgage/Banking/finance analytical support experience
Strong SQL skills
Experience with delivering solutions through agile methodologies and new technologies
Advanced analytical and quantitative skills
Strong working knowledge of MS Excel and advanced data manipulation functions (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP, ODBC, VBA)
Direct experience with Home Lending servicing system (MSP) to perform loan level review to determine RCA to assist in the remediation of Reporting discrepancies

Preferred qualifications, capabilities and skills

Exposure to Python, Tableau and Alteryx

Required soft skills

Strong oral and written communication skills
Strong organizational and multi-tasking skills are critical
Works well collaboratively and independently in an ever-changing business environment

For this particular role, we are unable to sponsor any type of work visa including but not limited to H1B, H4 – EAD, OPT, TN, or L visas.

Candidates must be able to physically work in our Columbus, OH or Plano, TX offices 3 days a week and remotely from home 2 days per week. The specific schedule will be determined by direct management.

JOB SUMMARY

Uses advanced knowledge of business intelligence and analytical tools to summarize data in a meaningful and presentable format. Utilizes technical skills to schedule reports and to produce user requested data templates/reports for user self-service reporting. Validates newly developed reports/processes against detail level data during the development cycle. Provides written and/or verbal analysis of data to customers.

DEGREE OF SUPERVISION:

Works under minimal supervision but confers with Level 4 on difficult or unusual requests.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Include the following. Others may be assigned.

Demonstrate baseline working knowledge of level appropriate applications and tools

Use appropriate terminology
Participate as a team member in collaborate environment
Contribute to completion of department/company goals and objectives
Clearly communicate information both to internal and external customers

Hybrid-In office/remote

Greystone is a private national commercial real estate finance company with an established reputation as a leader in multifamily and healthcare finance, with over $16 billion in loan originations in 2022. Greystone also ranks nationally as a top affordable housing, seniors housing, and small balance loan lender. A highly philanthropic company, Greystone donates more than half of its profits to charity each year.

Greystone's Special Servicing business is looking for an IT Business Analyst to join the team. The IT Business Analyst will be responsible for analyzing current commercial real estate surveillance, special servicing, and underwriting software. This role will also be responsible for facilitating the documentation of business requirements, and collaboratively designing a solution for workflow, usability, and component and data integration. This role will work closely with stakeholders across the business line to ensure the IT systems meet their needs and expectations. This is a contract position for 6 months that, with exceptional performance, will likely be extended.

Primary Duties and Responsibilities:

Gather and document business requirements from internal clients.
Translate business requirements into functional specifications and technical designs.
Conduct system testing and user acceptance testing to ensure quality and functionality.
Provide training and support to end-users on IT systems and applications.
Quickly understand existing applications and architecture.

Experience, Skills, and Abilities Required:

At least 5 years of experience as an IT Business Analyst in the commercial real estate industry is strongly preferred.
Knowledge of commercial real estate processes, terminology, and regulations.
Experience with other commercial real estate software, such as Situs, Real Insight, Trepp, Yardi, Argus, or CoStar, is strongly preferred.
Proficiency in Word Excel, Visio, PowerPoint, or other comparable tools for data analysis and presentation.
Excellent communication, collaboration, problem-solving, and analytical skills.
Be a self-starter with the ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced environment.

At Greystone, we believe that finding creative solutions for our clients comes from the collaboration of people with diverse backgrounds and perspectives. We strive to build an inclusive work environment that celebrates differences and empowers all individuals with opportunities to channel their entrepreneurial spirit. Greystone is an EEO employer.

Job Title: Senior Associate, Cyber Security Operations Center (CSOC) Fusion Analyst
Job Description:
Center 3 (19075), United States of America, McLean, Virginia

Senior Associate, Cyber Security Operations Center (CSOC) Fusion Analyst

The Cyber Security Operation Center Fusion team synthesizes multi-source security alerting, intrusion investigations, cyber intelligence, and business information into actionable analysis. The Fusion team provides this time-sensitive analysis to empower fellow CSOC operators defending the network and to empower leadership to make informed decisions confronting cyber threats. The associate in this role acts as a Cyber Security Operation Center aggregator, collecting and compiling internal information to communicate “So what does this mean to Capital One?” They accomplish this by proactively identifying threats to Capital One, supporting CSOC operations with contextualized tactical intelligence, driving cross-team initiatives to improve detection and security, conducting internal threat landscape analysis, and finding innovative new ways to automate analysis. The associate in this role will also mentor and train associates to execute fusion analysis responsibilities.

General Responsibilities:

Support day-to-day cybersecurity threat detection and incident response operations through indicator pivoting, campaign analysis, and tactical intelligence

Identify and enhance processes where automation has the potential to improve efficiencies, provide actionable data, and facilitate collaboration across CSOC

Leverage Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) or Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools to identify threat patterns, enrich investigations, and build automation-supported workflows

Deconstruct multi-source reporting into actionable intelligence including Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures TTPs data objects, campaign analysis, and threat patterns.

Regularly analyze malware reports to track adversary behaviors and support the construction of a TTP repository

Develop expertise on the Capital One threat landscape using internal data, threat trends, and operational metrics to clearly communicate the Capital One threat landscape to senior executives, to include the Chief Information Security Officer and Chief Information Officer.

Proactively build and maintain relationships with partner teams, including but not limited to Cyber Intelligence, Red Team, Insider Threat, and Hunt teams.

Conduct time-sensitive analysis during cyber investigations, including active threat hunting, malware analysis, and campaign enrichment

Routinely identify gaps in detection and collaborate with teams across the Cyber organization to mitigate risk, including blocking of malicious indicators, tuning vendor signatures, and instrumenting custom detection rules

Support the tactical intelligence-to-detection pipeline, to include malware reverse engineering, TTP analysis, and association mapping in a TIP (threat intelligence platform) for future pivoting

Attend conferences and briefings to stay current on threats against both COF and the Financial Services sector

Mentor other CSOC analysts in project execution and tactical upskilling; conduct brown bag lunches to teach specialized skill sets

Basic Qualifications:

High School Diploma, GED or Equivalent Certification

At least 2 years of experience in cyber security or information technology

At least 2 years of experience working in a Security Operations Center (SOC)

At least 1 year of experience analyzing and tracking Advanced Persistent Threats (APT) groups

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree

3+ years of experience in a cloud environment (Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform or Microsoft Azure)

3+ years of experience conducting fusion intelligence analysis

3+ years of experience in written and verbal briefings

3+ years of experience with cyber threat intelligence analysis and tactical analysts

3+ years of experience with curating Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIPs) and integration with Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) or Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools

3+ years of experience utilizing the MITRE ATT&CK framework, Diamond Model, or Cyber Kill Chain

3+ year of malware analysis (static or dynamic) and Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTP) analysis

This position will act as a facilitation/liaison point of contact between multiple operational areas throughout the products lifecycle by providing the structure, tools, and materials needed for the team to continuously innovate and deliver. Additionally, this role will participate in the creation and analysis of data, metrics and information used to manage and measure progress and business results. They will work closely with product leaders and their teams to formulate and communicate our product vision, strategy, framing, and positioning.




Primary Responsibilities

Manage small to medium projects from requirement identification to delivery, monitoring, and closure with minimal supervision
Regularly achieve consensus between teams and individuals, with a focus on simplicity
Identify and improve processes and operations to solve business problems
Participate in and lead sessions with product teams during the product development lifecycle to understand requirements, drivers, and business goals
Develop reports needed for the business and leadership to analyze impacts of changes to products, status of deployments, or other key metrics
Analyze and present complex ideas and data using various presentation methods and tools, providing conclusions and recommendations to communicate to target audiences most effectively
Identify opportunities for business process improvement, cost savings, and efficiencies; create and implement plans for improvement



Qualifications


Education

Bachelor’s degree, preferred.

Experience

5+ years of experience in international organizations within product, project management, marketing, or communications areas, preferably in the financial services industry.
3+ years of experience managing projects and processes.
3+ years of experience in reporting and data analysis preferred.

Essential Skills

Exceptional business and technical writing, editing, and proofreading skills
Strong analytical and reporting skills
Consistent attention to detail and eye for presenting information and data
Initiative, responsiveness, follow through, and time management skills
Knowledge of marketing and communication principles
Able to apply knowledge and skills to a wide range of standard and non-standard situations
Strong project management and organizational skills with the ability to multi-task, prioritize, and change course as required
Excellent interpersonal skills; comfortable working with multiple levels of the organization
Ability to work in changing environments, focusing on impromptu high urgency requests

Highly adaptable; ability to contribute to a successful team environment

This individual will interface with internal customers to act as a functional and technical liaison for the end user group community. The Business Analyst will be responsible for implementing, documenting, and monitoring business processes and associated workflow automation and applications.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Include the following. Others may be assigned.

Gather operational and workflow requirements to document, implement and monitor workflow processes. Identification of root cause(s) of workflow/process incident management.
Creation of designed and approved processes, enhance the automation of the technical workflows, and provide monitoring/stabilization of current business processes
Identify critical process opportunities for enhancement and propose tangible solutions to avoid repeatable errors.
Document detailed technical design for workflow automation, end user documentation and job aids.
Complete special projects and provide project support as requested by senior leadership.

Independent, logical thinker with ability to perform detailed data analysis

Job Title: Marketing Technology - Asset Manager & Business Analyst
Job Description:
About AT&T

At AT&T we’re redefining the future of connectivity. At our core is a passion to serve our customers with products and services that create connections, improve lives and allow millions to share the stories and experiences that matter. Our Corporate teams are fueled by innovation and a desire to connect the world in meaningful ways. Join our team and bring your bold ideas, supporting and transforming our business across areas like marketing, finance and more.

About the Marketing & Growth Organization

The Marketing & Growth Organization (MGO) is AT&T’s marketing engine, responsible for driving sustainable growth by deeply understanding and championing our customers, captivating them with compelling products, services and experiences; and building a culturally relevant and beloved brand. We pride ourselves in continuously striving to embody expertise, simplicity and inspiration in everything we do.

MGO is committed to building out next-generation marketing capabilities that will broaden our skills, deepen our expertise, and better align all AT&T’s marketing and communication resources.

About the Role

In this highly visible role, you will work across Marketing organizations, internal partners, and external agencies to manage creative asset utilization within the digital asset management (DAM) platform and capability enhancements that drive MROI (marketing return on investment). This role will drive tool adoption across the enterprise that enables our best-in-class marketing processes. Specifically, this role entails the creation of data management, quality assurance, compliance/risk management, and reporting strategies; the development of capability roadmaps, execution of those capabilities, with ongoing tracking and optimization across all marketing activities. You will act as the data/asset analytics conduit across DAM operations, using an agile lens, to identify optimization opportunities across Next Gen Marketing programs, and design seamless integration across workflows and platforms. This role operates in an agile and greenfield environment requiring diverse marketing background in operations, product ownership, and IT. May require considerable working knowledge of other major areas in technology, automation, and Gen AI. Considered an expert within the discipline.

You will be responsible for:

60%: Provides data governance, compliance, and risk management analysis across DAM utilization and engagement. Designs, implements, and optimizes solutions.
20%: Maintains user access and application management.
20%: Manages cloud infrastructure, asset cleansing, metadata tagging, and reusability metrics.

Core Competencies:

Experience in holistic marketing across multiple brands at large companies
Expertise in marketing technology/operations strategy and plan development, execution, and optimization
Management of large-scale teams and projects, including cross-functional collaboration
Executive presence to inspire confidence with internal and external constituents
Collaborative; willing to roll up their sleeves with the team and get close to the details
Change agent and motivator able to achieve alignment to a shared vision
Highly organized and accountable
Strategic and operational; able to think through strategic challenges and build ground-up solutions
Excellent problem solving skills and a keen attention to detail
Proficient MarTech experience with DAM software implementations (i.e. Bynder, Aprimo, Adobe, Uptempo, etc.)

Education & Experience:

Typically requires a Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or any other IT related field
Experience: Typically requires 5+ years of experience in similar area of responsibility (marketing operations, software product ownership, martech, advertising, digital strategy, or marketing role within a consultancy, agency, or marketing-driven organization).

A career with us, a global leader in communications and technology, comes with big rewards. As part of our team, you’ll lead transformation surrounded by trailblazing industry leaders like you. You’ll be empowered to go above and beyond – making a difference through company-sponsored initiatives or connecting and networking through one of our many employee groups. And regardless of where you’re at in your career trajectory, you’ll be rewarded by the impact that comes with making a difference in the lives of millions. With AT&T, you’ll be a part of something greater, do incredible things and be rewarded with a chance to change the world.

Our Marketing Technology - Asset Manager & Business Analyst earn between $116,700 - $175,100. Not to mention all the other amazing rewards that working at AT&T offers. Individual starting salary within this range may depend on geography, experience, expertise, and education/training.




Joining our team comes with amazing perks and benefits:

Medical/Dental/Vision coverage
401(k) plan
Tuition reimbursement program
Paid Time Off and Holidays (based on date of hire, at least 23 days of vacation each year and 9 company-designated holidays)
Paid Parental Leave
Paid Caregiver Leave
Additional sick leave beyond what state and local law require may be available but is unprotected
Adoption Reimbursement · Disability Benefits (short term and long term)
Life and Accidental Death Insurance
Supplemental benefit programs: critical illness/accident hospital indemnity/group legal
Employee Assistance Programs (EAP)
Extensive employee wellness programs
Employee discounts up to 50% off on eligible AT&T mobility plans and accessories, AT&T internet (and fiber where available) and AT&T phone

Overview:
Veritex Community Bank is looking for an experienced Business/Systems Analyst to partner with PMO and Veritex business partners across Commercial & Consumer Lending, Credit Cards, Special Assets, Credit, and Treasury. The Business/Systems Analyst will serve as a liaison between Veritex team members, Technology, and 3rd party vendors as they implement process improvements and operational efficiencies across the bank.

In this role, the Business/Systems Analyst will be asked to analyze data and processes, problem solve, document project related information (project charter, business requirements, process workflows, test cases, etc.). Project related responsibilities include but are not limited to discovery, issue tracking, change management, testing, and additional needs as they arise in support of project efforts.


To succeed in this role, applicants should be a strong team player, have excellent time management, and communication skills. Although there will be independent work, this role focuses on collaboration with internal and external partners to deliver results on deadlines. The Business/Systems Analyst will support projects from concept to delivery and post-implementation.
Responsibilities:
Transform business requests into actionable deliverables (project charter, business requirements, process maps, costs/benefits, etc.)
Conduct stakeholder interviews and requirement sessions to capture and refine business requirements and targeted analysis.
Plan, schedule and facilitate meetings with business owners & SMEs
Record & distribute detailed meeting minutes
Track and monitor risks, issues, actions, and decisions
Obtain, analyze, and synthesize information from multiple business users to help distinguish request from needs
Become a product and/or, process subject matter expert
Develop and execute test plans and scripts, lead testing such as user acceptance and system integration
Act as liaison between business and technical members of the project, if needed
Ensure adherence to internal practices and standards resulting in consistent development and implementation of project components
Provide training and support to end users
Qualifications:
Job Skills and Qualifications:
Proven ability to build rapport and maintain relationships with internal partners at all levels within the organization
Ability to work in a fast paced, deadline driven environment
Highly organized and detail-oriented
Outstanding organizational and effective time management skills
Superior problem solving, analytical, and critical thinking skills required
5+ years of business/systems analyst experience required across one or more of the following project types: Business Process Reengineering, Strategy Transformation, Vendor Integration, SDLC projects
Proven work experience as a Business Analyst or Consultant from top tier management consulting, or similar role
Approaches work in a flexible, solution focused manner and is able to collaborate effectively with team members
Self-starter who can work independently with minimal supervision
Experience in data analysis, and general project management methods
Experience developing, leading, and executing test plans and scripts, including both user acceptance and system integration testing
An ability to prepare and interpret data, flowcharts, schedules and step-by-step action plans
Strong client-facing skills
Proficient use of MS Word, MS PowerPoint, MS Excel, MS Outlook, MS SharePoint and MS Visio
Hands-on experience with project management tools (e.g. Smartsheet, Visio, MS Project)
B.S. in Business Administration or related field
Assists in researching process and/or technical related incidents and issues, including conducting detailed root cause analysis to avoid further impacts and decrease the risk of recurring issues
Strong sense of urgency and ownership when resolving issues

Truth in Texas Banking. That’s what we’re about. Founded in 2010, we are one of the ten largest banks headquartered in the state of Texas. We believe our team members are the key to our success and we pride ourselves in hiring the highest quality people, placing emphasis on safety, ethics, integrity and respect. We are an ESOP-owned company with a customer-first focus. We realize the decisions we make about investments and operating practices ultimately affect the lives of our co-workers, families and business partners. And like those who went before us, every one of us takes that responsibility seriously.

Simply stated, Briggs team members strive to do the right thing by exceeding the expectations of each other, our customers and our community.

POSITION PURPOSE:
The Business Solutions Project Analyst is responsible for ensuring the successful planning, execution, and delivery of applications, data, reporting, and system integration projects within the Briggs Industrial Solutions organization. This position is responsible for gathering and analyzing project requirements, assessing project feasibility, coordinating, supporting and completing project activities, and monitoring progress to achieve project objectives. The Business Solutions Project Analyst collaborates with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, consultants, and project business owners to maintain project timelines, budgets, and quality standards. Ensures all Briggs Industrial Solutions standards are adhered to and executed consistent with company direction.

PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:
1. Conduct thorough analysis of project requirements, objectives, and scope to understand project needs and constraints. Work closely with stakeholders to identify project goals and success criteria
2. Assess the feasibility of proposed Information Technology (IT) projects and provide recommendations to improve project viability
3. Collaborate with project managers to develop comprehensive project plans, including timelines, milestones, resource allocation, and budget estimates
4. Facilitate communication and coordination between project team members, monitor progress and track project deliverables
5. Complete project tasks as assigned by the project manager or team lead, to include tasks related to research, data analysis, documentation, and testing
6. Proactively learn and understand the organization’s IT applications, data architecture, and integration ecosystem and provide valuable insights and effective project analysis
7. Identify potential risks and issues that may impact project success and proactively develop risk mitigation strategies and contingency plans to address challenges
8. Maintain accurate project documentation, including project plans, status reports, meeting minutes, and relevant project artifacts and prepare regular status updates for stakeholders and management
9. Collaborate with the quality assurance team to ensure that project deliverables meet established quality standards and comply with organizational policies and procedures
10. Support change management efforts related to IT projects, ensuring smooth transitions and user adoption
11. Conduct post-implementation reviews to evaluate project outcomes, identify lessons learned, and provide insights for future improvements
12. Enhance established company and department standards and best practices
13. Perform other related duties as assigned

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS

Basic Knowledge and Competencies:

Excellent project management skills
Strong understanding of IT concepts and systems, enabling effective communication with technical teams
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Excellent multi-tasking and prioritizing skills
Ability to adapt to changing project requirements, timelines, and priorities
Proficient in Power Query and Power BI
Proficient understanding of Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Systems, to include Microsoft Dynamics AX and Netsuite
Proficient in Microsoft SQL Server
Proficient in Microsoft Office tools (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook); advance proficiency in Excel
Previous Experience/Education:

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience required
2+ years of prior experience in project analysis or project management, preferably within the IT domain
Certification in project management (e.g., PMP, PRINCE2) preferred
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Working conditions are normal for an office environment

Job Title: Global EDD Operations Analyst - Hybrid (Irving, TX)
Job Description:
Do you want your voice heard and your actions to count?

Discover your opportunity with Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group (MUFG), the 7th largest financial group in the world. Across the globe, we’re 160,000 colleagues, striving to make a difference for every client, organization, and community we serve. We stand for our values, building long-term relationships, serving society, and fostering shared and sustainable growth for a better world.

With a vision to be the world’s most trusted financial group, it’s part of our culture to put people first, listen to new and diverse ideas and collaborate toward greater innovation, speed and agility. This means investing in talent, technologies, and tools that empower you to own your career.

Join MUFG, where being inspired is expected and making a meaningful impact is rewarded.

This is a hybrid position. The selected colleague will work at an MUFG office or client sites up to four days per week and work remotely the remaining day(s). A member of our Talent Acquisition team will provide more details.

The Enhanced Due Diligence (“EDD”) Operations Analyst will be responsible for performing EDD on Financial Institution (“FFI”) clients, for examples Foreign Banks, Foreign Financial Institutions, Broker-Dealers, Money Service Businesses (“MSBs”), Third-Party Payment Processors (“TPPPs”) etc. The Analyst will be responsible for reviewing a variety of cases of varying complexity, requiring a level of experience needed to effectively assess client’s profile, its AML program, transactions, and customer relationships, and provide holistic assessment of the potential financial crime risks.

Major Responsibilities:

The analyst will review and ensure that EDD documentation is appropriate.
Review and assess information about the FFIs’ AML programs, for example by using the Wolfsberg CBDDQ responses
Review transactional data and identify any potential red flags/inconsistencies within a given timeframe
Conduct screening in accordance with Bank policy and escalate true hits to Adverse Findings.
Identify red flags and escalate accordingly using sound judgement
Synthesize information from multiple data sources into a clear evaluation and recommended actions
Prepare detailed and concise client narratives
Generates a list of Proposed Questions for AML Advisory in preparation for the customer site visit/call
Performs additional due diligence based on the outcome of the Site Visits/Calls as needed
In addition to maintaining daily operations, ad-hoc projects will be assigned regularly

Qualifications:

3 to 5 years’ experience in AML/BSA Compliance & KYC preferably within the financial services industry with experience conducting EDD on foreign financial institutions.
Experience reviewing comprehensive documents inclusive of complex ownership structures and Wolfsberg Questionnaires (CBDDQ, FCCQ and AML programs of FI clients.
Strong working knowledge of AML/BSA/OFAC laws and regulations relative to money laundering and terrorist financing and the ability to apply this knowledge in assessing transaction activity and customer profiles.
Excellent organizational, communication (with a focus on writing), interpersonal, and analytical skills, are required. Must be able to multi-task, adapt well to changing priorities, and effectively prioritize workflow to meet critical deadlines.
Critical thinking and problem-solving skills a must.
Ability to work in a fast-paced, demanding environment and must work well under pressure.
The ability and willingness to work both independently and in a team environment is required.
Maintains effective working relationships with key business partners.
Familiarity with Actimize and other financial crime, risk and compliance applications is a plus.
Effective Internet and research skills and usage of third party tools.
Strong proficiency in Microsoft Excel.
Bachelor’s Degree and CAMS certification preferred or equivalent work experience.

The typical base pay range for this role is between $65k-$75k depending on job-related knowledge, skills, experience and location. This role may also be eligible for certain discretionary performance-based bonus and/or incentive compensation. Additionally, our Total Rewards program provides colleagues with a competitive benefits package (in accordance with the eligibility requirements and respective terms of each) that includes comprehensive health and wellness benefits, retirement plans, educational assistance and training programs, income replacement for qualified employees with disabilities, paid maternity and parental bonding leave, and paid vacation, sick days, and holidays. Are you an experienced, passionate pioneer in technology, a solutions builder, a roll-up-your-sleeves technologist who wants a daily collaborative environment, think-tank feel and share new ideas with your colleagues - without the extensive demands of travel? If so, consider an opportunity with our US Delivery Center we are breaking the mold of a typical Delivery Center.

Our US Delivery Centers have been growing since 2014 with significant, continued growth on the horizon. Interested? Read more about our opportunity below:

The Team
The HR Transformation team is a core component of our Human Capital practice; the work we do supports the five major issues our clients are facing. We collaborate with our clients to develop leading global HR strategies and support organizations in achieving excellence through implementing solutions that transform how they organize, develop capabilities, deploy leading technology, and deliver a leading employee experience.
Keeping the employee in mind, all our services cater to improving an organization's productivity through their human capital asset. The client issues we work with range from the need for a comprehensive HR strategy, to determining the need for new and enabling technologies, to streamlining HR operations and transforming the way HR is delivered.

How you'll grow

At Deloitte, our professional development plan focuses on helping people at every level of their career to identify and use their strengths to do their best work every day. From entry-level employees to senior leaders, we believe there's always room to learn. We offer opportunities to help sharpen skills in addition to hands-on experience in the global, fast-changing business world. From on-the-job learning experiences to formal development programs, our professionals have a variety of opportunities to continue to grow throughout their career.

Work you'll do/Responsibilities
As a ServiceNow Business Analyst for our HR Transformation team, you will utilize your knowledge and experience of ServiceNow to support Deloitte's Human Capital Consulting ServiceNow team. In this role you will be responsible for:

Working closely with the client's business function to design and implement a target state process
General support, administration, and maintenance of ServiceNow platform and associated applications
Assess existing artifacts, documentation, and data to baseline client performance against best practices
Oversee business process assessment, target state design, and road map activities
Conduct design and discovery sessions with clients, gather business requirements, and translate into user stories for development team
ServiceNow configuration, integrations, and business rule creation
Coordinate and provide guidance to the development team
Create test cases and contribute in-unit testing and integrated unit testing
Conduct demos of out-of-the-box capabilities and new functionalities of ServiceNow Platform
Work closely with project team to support ServiceNow implementation
Provide technical oversight and ensure the design is accurately translated into a functional solution
Design and oversee integration of ServiceNow with third party system and automate business processes
Monitor health, usage, and overall compliance of ServiceNow and its applications
Negotiate what is expected to be configured out-of-the box or customized
Enable the adoption of new processes, procedures, and tool

Qualifications Required

2+ years of ServiceNow experience in an enterprise environment
Strong understanding of ServiceNow Platform capabilities
Experience with out-of-the-box client scripts, update set creation, and deployment process
Experience and understanding of Agile methodologies
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, a similar technical discipline, or comparable experience
Must be technically savvy and possess strong experience configuring ServiceNow
Familiar with Service Oriented architecture and web service integration (SOAP, WSDL, REST)
Experience conducting design and discovery sessions with clients, gathering requirements, and translating into user stories for development team
Hands on experience in ServiceNow configurations, flow designers, integrations, and business rule creation
Experience working with ATF
Experience in ServiceNow reporting & dashboards
Travel up to 10% annually
A current government security clearance, or the ability to hold a clearance is required
No Sponsorship: be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future

Preferred

ServiceNow System Administrator / Developer certification
ITIL V3 Foundation Certification
