Bring your heart to CVS Health. Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand — with heart at its center — our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver.

Our Heart At Work Behaviors™ support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable.

Position Summary

The Clinical Client Operations - Analyst will be responsible for analyzing Client's specialty benefit requests and inputting data into RxClaim to maintain specialty benefits (pricing, co-pays, grace fills, etc.) and building of new Specialty benefits for clients. The Analyst's duties will emphasize data analysis and review of client documentation to determine client intent for their specialty benefit. Analysis will be completed using RxClaim and analytical tools (i.e. MS Excel and MS Access) in support of specialty builds and maintenance. Other duties will include RxClaim query, data analysis, manual updates to RxClaim, testing changes using EZ- Test and macros and reviewing test claims for accuracy. The Analyst will also use SalesForce to track work and monitor TAT. The Analyst will confirm client intent when necessary and ensure complete client documentation is included with all request.


Required Qualifications
1 year prior work experience in Microsoft applications, RxClaim Coding, RxClaim Query/EZ Query

Preferred Qualifications
SalesForce.com Experience
Certified Pharmacy Technician Experience

Education High School Diploma or GED required
Bachelor Degree preferred

Pay Range

The typical pay range for this role is:

$40,600.00 - $83,400.00

This pay range represents the base hourly rate or base annual full-time salary for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual base salary offer will depend on a variety of factors including experience, education, geography and other relevant factors. This position is eligible for a CVS Health bonus, commission or short-term incentive program in addition to the base pay range listed above.

In addition to your compensation, enjoy the rewards of an organization that puts our heart into caring for our colleagues and our communities. The Company offers a full range of medical, dental, and vision benefits. Eligible employees may enroll in the Company’s 401(k) retirement savings plan, and an Employee Stock Purchase Plan is also available for eligible employees. The Company provides a fully-paid term life insurance plan to eligible employees, and short-term and long term disability benefits. CVS Health also offers numerous well-being programs, education assistance, free development courses, a CVS store discount, and discount programs with participating partners. As for time off, Company employees enjoy Paid Time Off (“PTO”) or vacation pay, as well as paid holidays throughout the calendar year. Number of paid holidays, sick time and other time off are provided consistent with relevant state law and Company policies.

For more detailed information on available benefits, please visit jobs.CVSHealth.com/benefits

Job Title: Client Services and Sales Solutions | Analyst | Dallas
Job Description:
MORE ABOUT THIS SKILLSET

Executing trades. Answering client questions—on accounts, portfolios and records. Delivering world-class services to our clients and customers.

Our client and customer services and sales support teams across the firm embody a can-do attitude with a special talent for trouble-shooting and problem solving.

If you apply to this skillset, you will be considered for multiple roles across the firm that require this skillset. Please note business and function examples below are representative of opportunities common for this skill-set. The list is not exhaustive, and availability of open roles is determined based on business.

BUSINESSES AND JOB FUNCTIONS

Asset Management Bringing together traditional and alternative investments, we provide clients around the world with a dedicated partnership and focus on long-term performance. As the firm’s primary investment area, we provide investment and advisory services for some of the world’s leading pension plans, sovereign wealth funds, insurance companies, endowments, foundations, financial advisors and individuals, for which we oversee more than $2 trillion in assets under supervision. Working in a culture that values integrity and transparency, you will be part of a diverse team that is passionate about our craft, our clients, and building sustainable success. We are:

Investors , spanning traditional and alternative markets offering products and services
Advisors , understanding our clients’ priorities and poised to help provide investment advice and strategies that make sense for their portfolio
Thought Leaders , providing timely insights across macro and secular themes to help inform our clients’ investment decisions
Innovators , using our suite of digital solutions to help our clients address complex challenges and meet their financial goals

FICC and Equities We make markets in and clear client transactions on major stock, options and futures exchanges worldwide. Through our global sales force, we maintain relationships with our clients, receiving orders and distributing investment research, trading ideas, market information and analysis.

Operations is at the core of Goldman Sachs. For every trade agreed, every new product launched or market entered, every transaction completed, it is Operations that enables business to flow. The Operations business partners with all areas of the firm to deliver banking, sales and trading and asset management capabilities to clients around the world. Alongside this vital service delivery role, Operations provides essential risk management and control, preserving and enhancing the firm’s assets and its reputation. Operations span all product lines and markets.

Wealth Management Operations We are responsible for front-to-back operational support to the Goldman Sachs Asset Management, Private Wealth Management and Ayco businesses in service, delivery, and processing functions across the trade and client lifecycle.
Investment Banking Operations We are responsible for all operational functions for Investment Banking. We support all product flows and provide effective control for the firm’s Investment Banking strategy.
FICC and Equities Operations We provide client onboarding support, post-trade transaction services and post-trade portfolio services for FICC and Equities. Our Client Coverage Group manages key client relationships to enhance the client experience front to back. We support the FICC and Equities businesses to develop and deliver new products, services and markets.
Treasury Services We provide payment processing, liquidity, cash management and bank relationship management services for our institutional, retail, and corporate clients as well as firmwide flows.

BASIC QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree
0-3 years of prior work experience in a relevant field.
Proficient to advanced skills with MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, Outlook)
Highly organized with exceptional attention to detail and follow-through
Strong ability to manage multiple projects with competing deadlines
Team player with positive attitude and strong work ethic
Strong communication skills (written and verbal)
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Ability to adapt quickly to a variety of industries and businesses
Ability to self-direct, analyze and evaluate and form independent judgments
Ability to effectively interact and build relationships with senior management and global stakeholders
Commercially savvy with ability to exercise discretion with respect to highly confidential/sensitive information
Integrity, ethical standards and sound judgment

ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS

At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.

We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.

We’re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html

© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2021. All rights reserved.

JOB DESCRIPTION


The Agile Enablement Lead plays a pivotal role in driving the Corporate Technology agility transformation. This position uniquely combines the analytical skills of a business analyst, the persuasive and clear communication of a corporate communications specialist, and the innovative approach of a marketer. A key aspect of this role will be the ability to use effective communication strategies to drive organization-wide change. The successful candidate will be comfortable communicating at all levels of the organization, adept at managing change, and able to bring thought leadership to the table.

Responsibilities:

Lead and influence the business agility transformation within the organization, using effective communication strategies to promote and drive change.
Evaluate current business operations using strong business analysis skills, identify opportunities for improvement, and implement changes as needed.
Develop and implement communication strategies that inform, engage, and motivate employees and other stakeholders throughout the agility transformation process.
Craft clear, compelling messages about our agility transformation for various audiences, including leadership, employees, and external stakeholders.
Apply a marketing mindset to operational issues, finding creative ways to promote and embed agility within the organization.
Contribute to the development and delivery of training materials and workshops to build agility capability within the organization.
Work collaboratively with various departments to facilitate the transition to more agile ways of working.
Monitor and evaluate the impact of agility initiatives, communicating progress and results effectively to all stakeholders.

Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in business, marketing, communications, or related field.
Minimum 3-5 years of experience in business operations, marketing, communications, or a related role.
Experience driving agile transformations or implementing agile principles in a business setting.
Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret business data.
Exceptional communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively lead change management initiatives and explain complex concepts to diverse audiences.
Innovative mindset with a track record of driving change and influencing organizational culture.
Ability to work collaboratively with a variety of teams and stakeholders.
ABOUT US

JPMorgan Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world’s most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, commercial banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.

We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents and perspectives that they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. We are an equal opportunity employer and place a high value on diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of any protected attribute, including race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital or veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. In accordance with applicable law, we make reasonable accommodations for applicants’ and employees’ religious practices and beliefs, as well as any mental health or physical disability needs. (If you are a US or Canadian applicant with a disability and wish to request an accommodation to complete the application process, please contact us by calling the Accessibility Line (US and Canada Only) 1-866-777-4690 and indicate the specifics of the assistance needed.)

We offer a competitive total rewards package including base salary determined based on the role, experience, skill set, and location. For those in eligible roles, we offer discretionary incentive compensation which may be awarded in recognition of firm performance and individual achievements and contributions. We also offer a range of benefits and programs to meet employee needs, based on eligibility. These benefits include comprehensive health care coverage, on-site health and wellness centers, a retirement savings plan, backup childcare, tuition reimbursement, mental health support, financial coaching and more. Additional details about total compensation and benefits will be provided during the hiring process.

JPMorgan Chase is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Veterans

The Position
Job Title
Systems Analyst II
Job Description
SUMMARY
The Channel Systems Analyst will evaluate business requirements for multi-platform technology and digital applications, assist in the delivery of new or modified systems enhancements and integration solutions, and provide application support to those systems and solutions. This position will collaborate with stakeholders and serve as the intermediary for the lines of business, most areas of IT, and digital banking partners. Mentors junior-level analysts and ensures compliance with company policies and procedures. Communicate with Bank department managers and senior leadership to promote efficient and approved workflow.
MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES (ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS)
Manages vendor relationships and holds vendors accountable to their deliverables
Understands vendor roadmaps, manages relationships, feedback and escalations
Participate in UX planning for improving existing processes and building new features and functionalities.
Building and maintaining the team backlog that is prioritized based on the business value and other key business drivers
Partner with other business leaders to develop stories through an Agile process and is ultimately accountable for signing off and accepting the story has met the expected requirements
Independently leverages Digital or Technology research, business and market intelligence, and data-driven insights to identify opportunities, propose solutions, and improve performance
Provide second and/or third level support for daily maintenance and support of applications including system administration and resolution of issues.
Assists in maintaining and enforcing IT policies. Documents standard operating procedures, workflows and systems.
Document results of activities using the appropriate processes in accordance with the Bank’s documentation and project methodology standards.
Participate in the analysis and evaluation of current business and system processes, interfaces and workflow.
Excellent trouble shooting skills, familiarity with test tools, and a drive to quickly fix issues
ADDITIONAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Adherence to all First United Policies and Procedures
Complete all required compliance exams on an annual basis
Travel up to 10% of the time, possible
Performs other duties as assigned
EMPLOYEE SPECIFICATIONS
In order to perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems or related discipline from an accredited four-year college or university or 7 years of related experience in lieu of a degree
Seven (7) years Digital/Technology Product Management experience, to include experience in innovation, user experience, process engineering, analytics, and/or research/testing OR an advanced degree and 6 years of experience.
Four (4) or more years of business analyst support with a major digital banking system acting as liaison between the business units, technical staff and/or system provider.
Three (3) years’ experience working in an Agile environment preferred
Certified Scrum Product Owner preferred
Comprehensive knowledge of Technology/Digital products and emerging technology platforms
Robotic Process Automation Experience Preferred
Proven track record to effectively develop, influence, present and communicate highly complex business, digital, or technology concepts to cross-functional teams, non-technical users and senior leadership.
Strong attention to detail, deadlines with a focus on effective communication to peers and senior leaders
Physical Demands
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle or feel; reach with hands and arms; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee is frequently required to stand, climb or balance, talk and hear. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, color vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.
Work Environment
The characteristics of the work environment described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Job Title: Sr Business Systems Analyst I - CDS
Job Description:
Summary

Description

About Us:
Companion Data Services provides leading IT solutions and managed services. We operate multiple geographically disperse data centers, including two of the nation’s largest healthcare data centers – both rated among the top five percent of data centers worldwide by MIPS.
With three U.S. locations and decades of experience in government, commercial and education markets, our innovative solutions and reliable services allow clients to focus on core business and improve outcomes.
Our data centers host applications process billions of transactions, supporting state, federal and commercial business.
Position Purpose:
Defines customer needs in technical and business contexts. Ensure the proposed technical and business solutions meet the customer's objectives for the work effort. Provide guidance with planning and prioritization of business analysis activities in support of large project and support efforts.
This position will be responsible for:
Supporting the FFS Workload B contract production support team by ensuring that the Fiscal Intermediary Shared System (FISS) and Multi Carrier System (MCS) applications hosted by CDS are up and available to the users by their required SLA time, reviewing request from the Medicare Administrative Contractors (MAC)s, CMS and the Shared System Maintainer (SSM), scheduling customer checkouts, data purges and testing. Analyzing the impact to customers reporting issues and escalating issue by priority, establishing, and driving resolution bridge lines. Completing morning task and reports, validating completion of customer request.
This is an on-site position in any of the Celerian group locations in Dallas, TX, Columbia, SC, or Nashville, TN.
What You'll Do:
Elicit and document user requirements to meet a business objective. Identify and validate requirements and organize the information into a logical document using business analysis models that is understood by the customer and Information Systems.
Respond to questions and ensure understanding of why the business solution was chosen. Guide both technical and customer departments in the development of the systems
Ensure the accurate deployment of solutions through review of problem logs, assisting with test plans and test matrices, and other analysis activities
Validate the business need for solutions to business problems and process improvements.
Facilitate the transfer of knowledge about the "big picture" direction of the business units to others who support them.
Provide input on the business direction for system changes.
Mentor less experienced business systems analysts.
To Qualify For This Position, You'll Need:
Required Education:
Bachelor's degree
OR 4 years job related work experience
OR Associate's and 2 years job related work experience

Required Work Experience:
6 years of IT business analysis experience.

Required Skills and Abilities:
Demonstrated expertise in the concepts of the supported business unit.
Demonstrated knowledge of standard industry practices and procedures for the business unit.
Able to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical audiences, including the ability to express complex technical and business concepts to all management levels, peers, and the business units.
Able to influence and negotiate solutions to business problems.
Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills.
Understands how IT affects an organization and is able to link it to business processes.
Excellent analytical and conceptual skills.
Able to read and comment on test plans and test matrices, project plans, and scope and design documents.
Has a conceptual understanding of project management techniques.
We Prefer That You Have:
IT Mainframe business analysis experience
5 years of Medicare claims experience
3 years of FISS/MCS applications experience

Preferred Software and Other Tools:
Visio, MS Project or similar software, data mining using DB2, SQL, and/or other tools.

Preferred Licenses and Certificates:
Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP), HIPAA, LOMA
What We Can Do For You:
Our comprehensive benefits package includes:
401(k) retirement savings plan with company match
Subsidized health plans and free vision coverage
Life insurance
Paid annual leave - the longer you work here, the more you earn
Ten paid holidays
On-site cafeterias and fitness centers in major locations
Wellness programs and a healthy lifestyle premium discount
Tuition assistance
Service recognition
What to Expect Next:
After submitting your application, our recruiting team members will review your resume to ensure you meet the qualifications. This may include a brief telephone interview or email communication with our recruiter to verify resume specifics and salary requirements. Management will be conducting interviews with those candidates who qualify with prioritization given to those candidates who demonstrate the preferred qualifications.

We participate in E-Verify and comply with the Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Job Description:
Responsibilities: Interface and liaison with business to define requirements, expertise in business architecture / solutions in ERM

Required Skills: 7+ years of overall relevant industry / domain experience in Risk Regulatory Reporting Banking

Nice to have skills: Industry knowledge of products / solutions in the field Risk Regulatory Reporting
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Ability to collaborate and manage senior stakeholders

About Virtusa

Teamwork, quality of life, professional and personal development: values that Virtusa is proud to embody. When you join us, you join a team of 36,000 people globally that cares about your growth — one that seeks to provide you with exciting projects, opportunities and work with state of the art technologies throughout your career with us.

Great minds, great potential: it all comes together at Virtusa. We value collaboration and the team environment of our company, and seek to provide great minds with a dynamic place to nurture new ideas and foster excellence.

Summary:

As a valuable member of the Petmate Insights Team, the Category Analyst will report directly to the Senior Category Manager who reports to the Sr. Manager of the Insights Team. The Category Analyst will work cross-functionally with Sales, Marketing, and Product Development Teams.


POS Reporting:

Serves as the main contact for all Point-of-Sale related requests
Owns, collects, and maintains the Point-of-Sale reporting and KrunchBox tool
Prepares weekly macro Point-of-Sale summary to the organization on product performance
Analyzes and reports on contributing factors to product performance (AUR, In stock, Store Count, Color, Size, etc.)
Proactively makes product or promotional recommendations to the internal sales and marketing teams based on Point-of-Sale deep dive analysis
Ongoing ad hoc Point-of-Sale Reporting requests from marketing and sales teams


Category Management:

Provides value-added category insights and channel analysis for retail partners and internal teams in an extremely fast paced environment
Works collaboratively within Insights Team to develop a comprehensive look at the consumer, categories, and opportunities
Assists in the preparation of reports and presentations, including charts and graphs, and presents recommendations for action plans to management, including but not limited to up-to-date analysis of current sales, inventory, and trends
Performs ad-hoc reporting for customers, presentations, and organization
Leverages analytical insights to develop actionable selling stories
Utilizes internal and external data, including Point-of-Sale, to uncover opportunities and provide analytical recommendations
Compile key findings from online customer reviews and share insights and recommendations with organization
Retail Store Walks
Monitor integrity of planogram and provide improvement strategies
Investigate competitive pressures in store
Assess promotional execution
Compile/maintain competitive pricing information
Support category manager in the development of space planning projects such as planograms using JDA Space Planning software


Qualifications:




Strong Microsoft Office skills (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, and Excel)
Advanced/Expert MS Excel skills are critical including ability to manage large data sets
VBA | PL/SQL | SQL | Power BI experience a plus
Background working with databases (e.g. Microsoft Access or Oracle Developer) a plus
Background working with space planning software a plus (JDA, Blue Yonder)
Strong analytical skills/intellectually curious
Effective interpersonal and relationship skills, internally with cross-functional team members and externally with customers (cooperative, collaborative, etc.)
Excellent communication skills verbal, written, and presentation
Self-starter able to work efficiently and independently
Team Player


Education and/or Experience:




Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Marketing, Merchandising, or other related field
1 - 3 years relevant experience including experience in the CPG, Retail, or Merchandising industry
1 - 2 years analytic experience, preferably in category management/CPG


Language Skills:

Must be able to read, right and verbally communicate in English to all levels of the organization.


Mathematical Skills:

Must be able to analyze numbers, larges amounts of data and provide insights and trends on what data is showing.


Computer Skills:

Advanced/Exert in MS Excel. Strong Microsoft Office skills


Physical Demands:

Ability to sit for long periods of time in front of a computer screen in an office environment. A moderate tolerance of loud noises if needed to go out into the production facility.

M Financial Group is a community of leaders comprising the best and brightest minds in our industry. By combining individuals’ expertise and skill, M Financial Group has become a powerful force committed to advancing the interests of our industry, communities, and clients for over 40 years. M’s solutions are rooted in the diverse expertise of our team, our collaborative approach to innovation and our comprehensive support.

We embrace a progressive, dynamic mindset for every role. M Financial Group provides a professional community that actively supports individuals with diverse backgrounds and perspectives who come together to build and support best-in-class solutions. If you’re looking to be a part of a high performing, collaborative, and dedicated team, M Financial Group is in search of our next Investment Operations Analyst II to join our team.

The Investment Operations Analyst provides comprehensive knowledge and expertise for M Securities’ Investment Operations offerings and business lines to further exceptional customer service to Member Firms. This includes providing practice management support to Member Firms, conducting analysis and reporting on the Investment Advisory and Brokerage platform, and working with internal and external parties. This position resolves escalated servicing requests received by the Investment Operations team and assists with the training of Investment Operations specialists. This position contributes to the oversight of partner relationships, including Pershing, Charles Schwab, and Envestnet and research of additional offerings and relationships.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Member Firm and Internal Support

Collaborate with other teams and business units to continually improve and enhance investment offerings to Member Firms
Consult and train Member Firms and Advisors on choosing Investment Advisory program, custodian, Envestnet, and investment management related tools
Assist with transitions of Member Firms and representatives joining and exiting M Securities
Communicate with heavy users of the investment advisory platform to discuss user experience, areas of challenges and opportunities for growth
Create and execute exception monitoring with custodian partners and Envestnet to perform quality control on team tasks and identify items requiring escalation
Handle Tier 2 escalations with custodians and vendor partners, working towards swift resolution and advocating for Member Firms and their clients
Serve as Tier 2 support for Investment Operations team, including research and resolution of elevated issues and complex requests
Create and update Investment Operations related desktop procedures and training resources for internal and Member Firm use
Support projects and responsibilities of the Operations, Risk, Compliance, and Supervisory teams by serving as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) of the Investment Operations team
Provide internal and external support for troubleshooting and resolving issues with Investment Operations related systems

Custodians and Vendor Partners

Ability to contribute to strong relationships with custodians and other vendor partners
Serve as a liaison between M Securities and Pershing, Pershing Advisor Solutions, Charles Schwab, and Envestnet to identify and recommend areas for improvement and opportunities to expand offerings to Member Firms
Participate in periodic relationship discussions and contribute to resulting action items
Respond to questions from custodians and vendor partners in a timely manner
Contribute to education and training efforts related to custodians and vendor offerings
Manage user entitlements for custodian and vendor platforms
Contribute to the identification and implementation of additional program and software solutions for both internal and Member Firm use
Contribute to custodian and vendor training resources for Member Firms

Additional Responsibilities

Contribute to monitoring, servicing, and transfer of house accounts
Collaborate with Wealth Solutions teams to identify areas for process improvement, and operational efficiencies, and assist with solution implementation
Additional duties and projects as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s Degree preferred
2-4 years progressively responsible, directly-related work experience
Thorough understanding of M Securities policies, procedures, and processes
Self-motivated and detail-oriented
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Proactive communicator, understanding when to update various parties on status of work, problems, changes, and other relevant information
Well-developed computer skills, including databases and advanced Excel skills
Knowledge of FINRA and SEC regulations
Demonstrated ability to prioritize work on multiple projects with different deadlines
Ability to work effectively, both independently and as a member of a team
Proactive with a demonstrated commitment to collaboration and achieving team goals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills

JOB CONDITIONS AND ENVIRONMENT

In-Office work in the Dallas, TX office
Normal office environment/desk assignment
Extensive use of PC’s, computer terminal, display, keyboard, and mouse
Extensive hands-on work with documents, spreadsheets, and other written documents
Infrequent Travel <5%

COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS

Salary will be commensurate with relevant experience, knowledge, and skills.
You will also be eligible for an annual incentive plan bonus.

M Financial offers a comprehensive benefits package, including:

Medical/Vision Insurance
Dental Insurance
Short-Term and Long-Term Disability Insurance
Life Insurance
Modern Health (Mental Health Therapy and Coaching)
Empathy (Bereavement Support)
Employee Assistance Program
Life Insurance
FSA (Health and Dependent Care)
HSA (for qualified medical plan)
Long-Term Care Insurance
401(k) Match
Tuition Assistance

Job Title: Senior Financial Analyst, Academic & Business Operations
Job Description:
Why UT Southwestern?

With over 75 years of excellence in Dallas-Fort Worth, Texas, UT Southwestern is committed to excellence, innovation, teamwork, and compassion. At UT Southwestern, we invest in you with opportunities for career growth and development that align with your future goals and help to provide security for you and your family. Our highly competitive benefits package offers healthcare, PTO and paid holidays, on-site childcare, wage, merit increases and so much more that are all available on the day you start work. UT Southwestern is honored to be a Veteran Friendly work environment that is home to approximately 800 veterans. We value your integrity, dedication, and the commitment you’ve made to our country. We’re proud to support your next mission. Ranked by Forbes as one of the Top 10 National Employers, we invite you to be a part of the UT Southwestern team where you’ll discover teamwork, professionalism, and consistent opportunities for growth.
Job Summary

UT Southwestern Medical Center is hiring for Senior Financial Analyst, Academic & Business Operations

Academic & Business Operations is actively seeking a highly motivated and career-minded individual to join our Operations team as a Senior Financial Analyst with Healthcare experience. In this exciting position, you will be responsible for a range of activities, including institutional compensation and productivity analysis, multiple system development and reporting initiatives, and a vast array of complex ad-hoc analyses required of the office/role. You will liaison with a range of academic leadership position, and be challenged to prepare complex deliverables at an executive level.

This role offers a hybrid work arrangement, combining the benefit of both remote and in-office work environment (two(2) days in office, (3) days remote, subject to change).

Experience and Education

Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, or other related field and four (4) years progressively responsible experience in finance and/or accounting with experience in planning, forecasting, and financial analysis.
Job Duties

Completes variety of complex monthly financial management reports and reviews all reports for errors and inconsistencies; analyzes variations in forecasts and actual performance; determines reasons for variance; develops recommendations for improvement; completes written summaries of financial data.
Prepares and/or supervises preparation of monthly financial reports, schedules for annual financial reports, and reports to various government agencies, ensuring conformance of such reports with applicable procedures and regulations of University of Texas System and Federal and State agencies.
Identifies areas of poor performance, presents findings, and makes recommendations to upper management.
Prepares financial models and conducts financial analyses.
May maintain controls for policies and procedures for financial system; develops and maintains delegation of authority of various procedures, such as check requests, refunds, invoice approval, bad debt write-offs, etc.
Completes more complex special projects as requested.
**Other Duties: Performs other duties as assigned.

To learn more about the benefits UT Southwestern offers, visit https://www.utsouthwestern.edu/employees/hr-resources/

This position is security-sensitive and subject to Texas Education Code §51.215, which authorizes UT Southwestern to obtain criminal history record information. UT Southwestern Medical Center is committed to an educational and working environment that provides equal opportunity to all members of the University community. As an equal opportunity employer, UT Southwestern prohibits unlawful discrimination, including discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, disability, genetic information, citizenship status, or veteran status.

Bring your heart to CVS Health. Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand — with heart at its center — our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver.

Our Heart At Work Behaviors™ support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable.

Position Summary

This role is responsible for supporting the development of a vision, roadmap and solution for enterprise Pharmacy Benefit Management products that achieve outcomes and deliver value.
It requires strong relationship management and influencing skills and the ability to partner cross-functionally with key stakeholders to deliver on commitments.
Participate in product discovery activities, deeply understanding the business, the consumers, the market and working with the team to innovate, test and deliver value.
Supports product strategy for the entire life cycle management of a technology/digital product, including purpose, definition, design, planning, development, prototyping and testing. Applies design thinking techniques (e.g., user journeys, wire-framing, prototyping) in order to define product features; develops the roadmap based on effort sizing and overall value to the business.
Facilitates the capturing of consumer and business needs through the creation of user/technology stories for the engineering team to deliver business value
Evaluate current product state to identify opportunities through customer needs, product analysis, digital data and stakeholder conversations.
Provide product demos to inform and gain adoption.
Keep a close pulse on the voice of the customer, identify insights and propose solutions to address problems and maximize latest opportunities.


Required Qualifications

3+ years Product Management, Product Owner or Business Analysis experience, owning enterprise-scale products/capabilities

3+ years in healthcare and/or insurance

High technology and data acumen

Experience problem solving and consulting within complex environments

Experience facilitating cross-functional teams’ efforts

Clear and concise oral and written communication skills and strong interpersonal skills

Experience working in an agile environment and leading decentralized teams

Ability to make informed decisions in a high-pressure environment

Must be passionate about contributing to an organization focused on continuously improving consumer experiences

Ability to travel up to 4-6x per year


Preferred Qualifications

Agile Certification e.g. SAFe® 5 APM or equivalent

Experience in Pharmacy Benefits Management

Relevant Master’s degree

1+ years of mentoring and coaching colleagues


Education

Bachelors Degree or Relevant Experience

Will accept 2 years experience per 1 year college plus required years of product management experience

Pay Range

The typical pay range for this role is:

$90,000.00 - $180,000.00

This pay range represents the base hourly rate or base annual full-time salary for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual base salary offer will depend on a variety of factors including experience, education, geography and other relevant factors. This position is eligible for a CVS Health bonus, commission or short-term incentive program in addition to the base pay range listed above.

In addition to your compensation, enjoy the rewards of an organization that puts our heart into caring for our colleagues and our communities. The Company offers a full range of medical, dental, and vision benefits. Eligible employees may enroll in the Company’s 401(k) retirement savings plan, and an Employee Stock Purchase Plan is also available for eligible employees. The Company provides a fully-paid term life insurance plan to eligible employees, and short-term and long term disability benefits. CVS Health also offers numerous well-being programs, education assistance, free development courses, a CVS store discount, and discount programs with participating partners. As for time off, Company employees enjoy Paid Time Off (“PTO”) or vacation pay, as well as paid holidays throughout the calendar year. Number of paid holidays, sick time and other time off are provided consistent with relevant state law and Company policies.

For more detailed information on available benefits, please visit jobs.CVSHealth.com/benefits

Job Title: IMI CIB - Business Analyst Financial Sponsors Group - New York Branch
Job Description:
Intesa Sanpaolo is the banking group leader in Italy. Assisting more than 14,6 milion of retail customers through a network of 5360 branches, it significantly supports the development of Companies and gives an important sustain to the country's growth. The Group has a selected retail banking presence in Central and Eastern Europe, the Middle East and North Africa, with approximately 1,000 branches and 7.2 million customers in 12 countries. Intesa Sanpaolo is also present in 25 countries in support of its corporate customers’ cross-border business. It is looking for new qualified profiles who want to face demanding and challenging career path with the following requirements:

Scope and Purpose

In support of the Global Relationship Manager (GRM) Financial Sponsors International, the Business Analyst will:

Support the GRM in all tasks related to developing new and expanding existing relationships with Private Equity clients
Perform due diligence on PE clients, fund structures, acquisition targets, industries, and other relevant information as required
Prepare PE and company profiles and pitches
Support in the identification of business opportunities and cross-selling of Intesa Sanpaolo’s financial products and services
Accompany and support the GRM in meeting with clients, in negotiating and structuring transactions
Manage multiple transactions/projects and communicate effectively with deal team members on status and prioritization
Coordinate between and establish strong working partnerships and routines with key internal partners including Leveraged Finance, Fund Finance, Syndication, Debt Capital Markets, Credit, Risk, Industry Verticals, KYC and Legal
Support the preparation of credit applications for LBO and fund finance deals, portfolio summaries and reviews
Perform specific administrative and operative activities related to customer onboarding and management
Demonstrate knowledge of relevant credit policies and procedures and accurately identify policy exceptions
Ensure the Branch’s KYC (Know Your Customers) and CDD (Customers Due Diligence) procedures and directives are adhered to.

The salary range for this job offer would be $ 85,000 - $ 110,000

Required Experience

Ideally 2- 3 years of work experience in a Leveraged Finance, Sponsor Coverage or Capital Markets role
Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, Word and PowerPoint)
Experience with Bloomberg, SEC filings, rating agency reports, and equity research reports is a plus.

Competencies Required

Good understanding of Leveraged Buyout (“LBO”) transactions and Private Equity (“PE”) fund structures
Knowledge of the Syndicated Loan Market
Strong quantitative and analytical skills, with the ability to understand and analyze syndicated deal structures and loan documentation
Familiarity with commercial, corporate and investment banking products
Resourceful self-starter, with willingness to learn, superior attention to detail, professional demeanour, and ability to work effectively on multiple projects
Teamwork attitude, with ability to interact and build healthy working relations in a culturally diverse environment
Excellent communication skills
Fluency in English

Required Qualifications, Skills and Knowledge

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or Business Administration, with an emphasis on Corporate Finance, Financial Accounting or Economics

We are a profitable company and offer competitive compensation and benefits while also providing an opportunity for new team members to take ownership in a small-company environment.

Ally and Your Career
Ally Financial only succeeds when its people do - and that’s more than some cliché people put on job postings. We live this stuff! We see our people as, well, people - with interests, families, friends, dreams, and causes that are all important to them. Our focus is on the health and safety of our teammates as well as work-life balance and diversity and inclusion. From generous benefits to a variety of employee resource groups, we strive to build paths that encourage employees to stretch themselves professionally. We want to help you grow, develop, and learn new things. You’re constantly evolving, so shouldn’t your opportunities be, too?
The Opportunity
As a part of the Passthrough Lender Management team, the Analytics Analyst is responsible for portfolio risk management and identifying growth and profit opportunities. Provide support on stages of database implementation and/or database related deployments. Individual will have the ability to work independently and to resolve complex database issues and work with development teams to tune SQL queries with emphasis on troubleshooting performance and non-performance related issues either independently or in conjunction with other teams including proactive monitoring of the databases, manage backup/recovery functions and ability to develop data requirements and configure database parameters accordingly. In addition, the position may include completing due diligence / financial analysis on comprehensive and administrative reviews associated with lenders, management of third-party vendors, and projects as assigned. Responsibilities include passthrough lender interface / service, monitoring of company lending portfolio with concentration on areas of risk mitigation. Requires critical analysis and frequent contact with passthrough lender personnel, matrix partners, outside stakeholders, and vendors. Considered analytical or procedural experts representing a unit or team on cross-function process or project deliverables.
The Work Itself
• Provide analytical and data support in the design and review of strategy tests and current operations.

Analyze monthly operating results and monthly variances; identify problems and research potential recommendations for corrective actions.
Perform portfolio analytics, special projects, drill -down analysis and other duties as needed.
Apply sound control processes into daily/weekly/monthly processes to effectively identify, assess and manage risk.
Maintain code logic to pull, sanitize, aggregate, conform, and produce operational and portfolio-level reports accurately.
Collaboratively work with matrix & vendor partners to ensure alignment with strategic imperatives.
Perform special analytics projects and other duties as assigned.
Interface with various stakeholders within asset performance, credit risk, finance and strategy and analytics organizations to provide timely and accurate analysis.
Able to deliver accurate results within expected deadlines.


The Skills You Bring
Bachelor’s degree preferred; BS or BA in Finance, Economics, Accounting, Information Technology or related field.
3+ years' experience in similar or equivalent position preferred.
Experience and knowledge of consumer financing industry (e.g. auto, card, mortgage etc.).
Demonstrate a solid understanding of data mining and analytical techniques.
Candidate should possess outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills.
Minimum 2 years of practical experience working with large datasets with SAS and/or SQL knowledge.
Quick learner and has demonstrated ability to initiate, develop and execute small to medium scale projects.
Work well within a team of analysts and collaborate with individuals with technical and non-technical backgrounds.
Candidate must have strong attention to detail.

Document existing and new business workflows with applicable metrics and measures

Primary Purpose
The individual in the Business Intelligence Specialist role is a project leader, recognizing timelines and priorities, and organizing the work efforts of both small initiatives and departmental improvements. The BI Specialist may be entrusted with resources and personnel to complete objectives without supervision. In general, the BI Specialist has reached a level of mastery across multiple disciplines in the data management field which allows the ability to see big picture consequences to make tactical decisions. The BI Specialist generally has a strong interest or specific advanced knowledge of a complex concept or tool that is critical for the department, and often serves as the top-level technical expert in one of more highly specialized areas of systems analysis and reporting. The BI Specialist is expected to have strong time and project management skills, to have advanced speaking and communications skills, and to have the ability to think outside the box when designing solutions to both customer and departmental challenges. The BI Specialist proactively identifies areas of improvement within their scope of knowledge. The BI Specialist has attained a level of advanced knowledge or training to work independently not only on tasks assigned by supervisors, but also on problems outside the scope of daily work activities.


Minimum Specifications


Education
Must have a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field.
Masters preferred.


Experience
Must have six years of experience using Business Intelligence (BI) tools, including Crystal reporting, WEBi reporting and dashboards.
Must have six years of SQL (Structured Query Language) server-based SQL coding or Oracle PL-SQL (Procedural Language/Structured Query Language) experience.
Must have a minimum of two years as a subject matter expert in a single reporting or data discipline.
Prefer previous experience within a healthcare organization.
Prefer previous experience with an Electronic Medical Record (EMR) application such as Eclipsys, Epic, Clarity, or Epic within a healthcare organization.


Equivalent Education and/or Experience
May have an equivalent combination of education and experience to substitute for both the education and the experience requirements.


Certification/Registration/Licensure
Prefer related certification(s) in Epic and/or Clarity.
Prefer related certification(s) in SAP data reporting.
Prefer related certification(s) in Cisco data management.
Prefer Category I Project Management Professional (PMP) certification by the Project Management Institute (other project management training considered).


Skills or Special Abilities
Must have an expert level knowledge of SQL (Structured Query Language) / Oracle relational and multi-dimensional database structures, schemas, stored procedures, views, and queries.
Must be able to build and run SQL queries, Crystal reports, and use other reporting tools.
Must have an expert level knowledge of Reporting and Analytics.
Must have expert level knowledge regarding EMR, word processing, database, and spreadsheet software.
Must have an expert level knowledge of commonly used programming concepts, practices, and procedures within the Information Technology field.
Must have advanced knowledge of critical tools and concepts and can explain these concepts to others on the team.
Must have strong analytic and computer skills in addition to an extensive knowledge of database management and data analysis.
Must be able to develop system specifications and decision flows, in the form of flow charts or equivalent techniques, from written business requirements.
Must have experience with data modeling, warehouse design and virtual universe structures.
Must be able to demonstrate critical thinking skills, about system issues.
Must demonstrate an understanding of patient data and the use of this data in a healthcare environment, as applicable.
Must be able to accept verbal and/or written problems or direction from senior staff and business users and demonstrate an ability to prepare specifications that reflect provided information (with coaching from senior personnel).
Must have exceptional planning skills with a results-oriented record of achievement and the ability to set goals, meet deadlines, and evaluate results particularly regarding significant changes within an organization and with respect to the organization’s relationship with the community or marketplace.
Must have a high level of attention to detail, can manage multiple projects at once, and be able to demonstrate excellent analytical, organization and prioritization skills.
Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills to interact effectively with customers, team members and IT management.
Must be a quick learner. Good analytical and problem-solving skills.
Must be able to work in a team environment and have strong interpersonal skills.
Must be able to demonstrate excellent time management skills and management reporting skills.
Must be able to demonstrate excellent discernment and assessment in professional decision-making.
Must be an independent worker and self-starter, having the ability to provide internal motivation and drive.
Must set high standards of performance for self.


Responsibilities
Performs root cause analysis or configuration overview for clinical leadership and succinctly and accurately relay findings or information as well as recommendations to leadership as needed.
Proactively identifies areas for improvement in applications and develop solutions for those problems outside of leadership-assigned projects or tasks.
Serve as a mentor for senior and intermediate analysts, providing them feedback on protocols, procedures, and other processes in place at Parkland.
Organizes the work effort for large initiatives (such as Meaningful Use, New Parkland Hospital, Epic Upgrade, 1115 Waiver, etc.) and ensures that timelines are met and that projects are implemented successfully.
Leads the design, development, and implementation of complex customer analytic solutions by applying an expert level understanding of Business Intelligence best practices
Applies an expert knowledge and understanding in systems and data analysis to conduct in-depth evaluation of source system data and processes. Uses industry standard data modeling and reporting tools to generate richly documented, creatively designed data models, reports, and other content as requested by leadership.
Facilitates communication and problem resolution with physicians & staff in both inpatient and outpatient settings.
Documents each step of development to ensure adequate communication within the team and customers.
Actively provides prompt responses to customer problems and inquiries. Makes the customer’s experience the priority in all operations.
Resolves ITSM incidents and requests independently within SLA timelines. Takes ownership and resolves complicated/code intensive incidents and requests.
Performs upgrades and/or routine maintenance for the report writing team.
Mentors and trains other team members by introducing them to new technologies, methods, and learning resources.
Handles conflict between team members, utilizing diplomacy, without allowing personal feelings to influence or impact the outcome negatively.
Models’ behavior for team members by following all department procedures (Weekly Status Reports, Customer Delivery, Customer Communications, Request Creation, etc.)

Identifies ways to improve work processes and improve customer satisfaction. Makes recommendations to supervisor, implements, and monitors results as appropriate in support of the overall goals of the department and Parkland.
Stays abreast of the latest developments, advancements, and trends in the field by attending seminars/workshops, reading professional journals, actively participating in professional organizations, and/or maintaining certification or licensure. Integrates knowledge gained into current work practices.
Maintains knowledge of applicable rules, regulations, policies, laws, and guidelines that impact the area. Description: JLL is seeking an Insurance Analyst for its Escrow Operations group. This individual will be responsible for ensuring all loans are compliant with the applicable Lender’s insurance requirements. The Analyst will work individually and with all levels of staff and must interact effectively with internal and external parties. The Analyst must demonstrate organization, an analytical orientation and possess the initiative to work in an independent and reliable manner.

Essential Functions:
Review new loan and insurance documents to ensure proper setup in the servicing system and complete a thorough insurance review (certificates of insurance, appraisal, flood determinations, property condition reports, etc.)
Obtain insurance renewal information, invoices and/or paid receipts and policies from agents, borrowers, and management companies within specified timeframes, for an assigned group of loans
Ensure insurance coverage is in place for all assigned loans per Lender guidelines.
Process insurance premium invoices in the loan servicing system and contact borrowers to collect shortages, as needed
Analyze insurance renewal information to ensure compliance with investor insurance requirements, including complete policy review
Prepare insurance waivers for non-compliant insurance issues and submit for management and/or Lender approval
Monitor insurance compliance for life of loan, including insurance reviews for properties with mid-term policy changes or changes resulting from an ownership or management transfer
Monitor and update various reports and certifications utilized by lenders and leadership to analyze portfolio risk
Communicate escrow issues and coordinate resolution with servicing staff
Perform duties and responsibilities in accordance with applicable laws, regulations, and JREC policies and procedures
Other duties as assigned

Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Outlook, SharePoint, OneNote)
Strong time management skills and ability to operate under demanding deadlines
Excellent interpersonal, communication, problem-solving and organization skills
Ability to multitask and work on several transactions simultaneously
Ability to recognize and analyze risk
Willingness and ability to learn new technology
Excellent attention to detail
Ability to audit own work
Ability to work independently, unsupervised, and as a team player
Ability to travel as needed

Required Experience: Undergraduate degree in Real Estate, Finance, Accounting, or Business preferred, or, equivalent work experience in Insurance, Commercial Mortgage Banking, or Loan Servicing. Experience with Precision LM loan servicing software is a plus.

ERP Programmer Analyst

Department: Information Technologies
FLSA Status: Exempt

Summary:

Documenting solution designs and technical requirements for the implementation and support of ERP Systems and Custom applications. Ability to quickly understand client business expectations, transform the required features into technical specifications, and track system deliverables to ensure the quality level is attained. This position requires a results-driven team player attitude with strong business acumen and interpersonal skills, robust data analysis and logical abilities, time management skills, experience with formal requirements traceability, and knowledge of IT SDLC methods and ITIL best practices.

Agile development practices and experience in a Scrum/Agile framework desirable.

Job Requirements:

· Serve as techno-functional IT team member, responsible for defining, and documenting technical and business requirements, design, and development for ERP Systems that include INFOR SyteLine v8, CSI 10 and NetSuite.

· Strong Analysis skills and responsibility for ensuring specifications are complete, comprehensive, technically feasible, in alignment with system capabilities, conform with IT and regulatory standards, and follow consistent documentation practices.

· Good domain knowledge and experience with Financials, Supply Chain, Order Management and Manufacturing.

· Ability to provide Super User and End User training.

· Mentor and train junior team members.

· Assists in the preparation and execution of use-case tests, formal testing scripts and oversees approval for user acceptance plans.

· Manages and tracks status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; updates and refines, as necessary.

· Communicates changes, enhancements, and modifications of agreed requirements– verbally and in written form to business and IT sponsors, and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood.

· As technical liaison confirms project scoping for IT solutions; communicates effectively to identify options, explain issues, recommend solutions, manage risks, and reduce escalations during project design and delivery.

· Provides incident resolution oversight, including first time-right, root cause analysis, and corrective actions.

· Work performed in the office in a light industrial setting; exposure to manufacturing environments and working on the shop floor with users.

· May require about 10% travel to other PlayPower office and plant locations as required.

· Other duties as required.

Qualifications and Technical Skills:

Minimum of 5 years of experience with ERP Systems. Experience with INFOR SyteLine 8, 9, CSI10 and NetSuite preferred. The ideal candidate would have worked with multiple ERPs including the above and have prior experience with full ERP life-cycle implementations. Expertise in a manufacturing environment and strong knowledge of the modules for Financial Management, Supply Chain Management and Purchasing, Sales Management, Estimating Customer Orders, Shipping, Receiving, Inventory Management, Planning and Scheduling processes to serve as internal ERP consultant and Subject Matter Expert.

· Minimum of 5 years’ hands-on experience in business analysis, programming, development, or support role with SQL Server environments.

· Deep expertise with T-SQL, stored procedures, SQL Queries, SSRS is needed and experience with XML, HTML, VB .NET and C# .NET programming would be a plus.

· Strong understanding of underlying ERP schema, tables and database level entity-relationship models with ability to create, understand, and run SQL ad-hoc query scripts and reports.

· Experience managing formal requirements matrix and documenting comprehensive technical specifications.

· Expertise in testing validation methods with use-case development and defect tracking (JIRA and Agile experience preferred).

· Prior experience working with standard IT SDLC processes, ITIL best practices, Agile development/delivery and working with geographically distributed teams.

· Consultative and analytical skills with effective solution design, technical planning, and problem-solving abilities.

· Fluent with technical processes and nomenclature, and disciplined approach to reporting/tracking key metrics.

· Experienced with code reuse and source code version control techniques.

Analyzes problems and designs process improvement solutions.

Summarizes analysis to report on key improvement opportunities to use for future state solution design.

Creates process maps, SOPs, and other solutions design documentation.
Creates metrics to track benefits of improvement implementations.
Performs change management activities including developing and delivering training and communications to support transition of improvement project changes.

Runs meetings with project teams to communicate deadlines and identify issues and risks.
Maintains and communicates project plan progress, issues, and risks.
Reports status and escalates issues to leadership.
This is not a work from home opportunity.

We are seeking a Sr. Business Analyst for our Operations Analytics and Loss Mitigation Strategy team. This is a key role with significant and broad responsibilities and will be a member of a 3-4 person team with substantial opportunity for future growth within the company in concert with driving business expansion. As a team-member responsible for developing recovery strategies that balance growth, risk and profitability, you will be a key thought leader on all collections strategies and decisions and have significant input into all loss mitigation decisions and delinquency performance. You will work closely with operations, Branch managers, and internal/external partners to collaborate on broader strategic initiatives and shape the direction and growth of the overall business in a collaborative dynamic team environment. Come and be a part of our success story! Job responsibilities are as follows:




Continuously challenge and enhance loss mitigation strategies and scorecards through analysis of customer behavior data and sophisticated statistical and financial modeling.
Maintain a rigorous performance monitoring framework and management dashboards to highlight performance trends and areas of opportunity.
Develop best-in-class loss mitigation products that provide our consumers solutions while minimizing portfolio risk.
Establish a robust test and learn environment for continual loss mitigation and collections strategy improvement.
Build and maintain a robust economic framework that will serve as the foundation for business decision-making.
Ensure loss mitigation policy remains compliant with all applicable laws and regulations.
Maintain transparent communication and trust with all key stakeholders.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in a STEM major is required, advanced degree is preferred.
2-4 years of experience as an analyst in lending originations or loss mitigation.
Experience with statistical modeling and forecasting, portfolio P&L simulation, vintage profitability tracking and marginal expansion strategies.
Familiarity with loss mitigation and collections strategies, loss forecasting, and/or collections KPI’s
1+ years of experience with SQL and/or Python querying required.
Strong communication and presentation skills, leadership skills, a high level of initiative, intellectual curiosity and creativity
A robust understanding of the consumer lending business that includes the various facets of a specialty lending operation.
Familiarity with conducting monthly loan-level and segment-level delinquency forecasts.

Position Summary

The Director of Business Intelligence is a key member of the technology leadership team and serves as the Company’s analytics thought leader. This leader will develop, plan, and implement a technology strategy that delivers optimal returns on investment in coordination with the organization’s goals and core values with a focus on a “customer service” orientation.

Areas of responsibility include strategic leadership, team management, technical leadership around data management / ETL processes, end user reporting and analytics needs as well as project prioritization and management.

The Director will bring a track record of success in setting the strategic data and analytics direction in a multi-unit, franchised enterprise by driving innovation and building a competitive advantage based on strategic information.

The role is located in Addison, TX and this role requires the ability to be present in the office at least three days per week.




Key objectives

Lead the Business Intelligence team through data integration, storage, reporting, analytics, monitoring and compliance phases
Guide information strategy for customer, finance, marketing and other key data areas
Build and maintain Franchisee relationships; Earn respect of franchisees and cultivate strong relationships; navigate challenging situations with professionalism and confidence
Offer creative and practical solutions; Utilize creativity and innovation in problem solving and applying appropriate methodologies relevant to the complexity of the challenge
Understand future opportunities; Closely monitor changes with data technologies and identify ways the company can improve and implement plans to achieve these objectives
Maintain a high performing team; Continually assess and lead a talented, flexible, high performing BI function that has a high sense of urgency, is customer oriented, is responsive, and communicates effectively and manage the organization with a lean, ‘player / coach’ approach

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES & DESIRED OUTCOMES




Serve as the thought leader, business partner and team mentor for the full data & analytics lifecycle

Collaborate with leadership to identify opportunities for leveraging data to gain a competitive advantage
Develop and execute the business intelligence strategy aligned with the organization's goals and objectives
Lead and manage BI team members, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous improvement
Provide mentorship, coaching, and professional development opportunities to team members
Own BI‐related budgeting, planning and procurement, including developing business case justifications and cost/benefit analyses for spending and initiatives
Oversee data integration processes, ensuring the extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) of data from various sources to maintain a reliable data infrastructure
Ensure data pipelines are efficient, scalable, and maintain data integrity while optimizing priorities, delivery speed and related value-based spend
Ensure that data and analytics practices comply with relevant data protection and privacy regulations and security standards and protocols
Own and drive support processes around data / BI platforms, with an eye towards continuous improvement



IDEAL EXPERIENCE

Experience as BI/Analytics Director at a high growth company with a proven track record of high impact

Track-record of building and leading highly effective BI teams with a customer service and partnering mindset
Experience building strong stakeholder relationships across departments
Depth of experience selecting and implementing suitable technology for efficient data loading, governance and reporting capabilities required
Experience in building at a metrics-driven company (especially Private Equity owned) is ideal



PERSONAL CHARACTERISTICS

Driving Results

Organized, urgent, and accountable: gets stuff done
Highly analytical mind-set; ROI and data-driven decision maker; has strong problem-solving and conceptual skills with the ability to quickly analyze and synthesize to support informed decision-making
Sets continually higher goals that are ambitious but realistic for self and team, geared to organizational objectives

Collaborating and Influencing

Presents effectively and persuasively with composure, building trust and credibility with various audiences
Excellent project management skills with the ability to balance multiple priorities and key stakeholders
Ability to work across the organization to get buy-in from the whole team on important initiatives and holds people accountable for results

Leading People

Collaborates and openly debates with the team to manage projects, solve problems, discuss challenging issues or learn more about critical issues as a group
Periodically reviews team progress against plans, focuses attention beyond the project to the full year and beyond



QUALIFICATIONS

15+ years of experience as BI/Analytics leader at growth companies with a proven track record of high impact
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field
Strategic thinking and the ability to align BI initiatives with business objectives
Strong communication and presentation skills, with a focus on understanding and communicating the company’s core business
Strong leadership and management skills with the ability to motivate and guide a diverse team
Proficiency in BI tools such as Redshift, Snowflake, Tableau, QlikView, QuickSight or similar platforms
Solid understanding of data modeling, data warehousing, and ETL processes
Experience in data visualization and statistical analysis
Knowledge of relevant data protection regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) and data security best practices
