Job Title: Technical Business Analyst (Full Time) - Sugar Land or Dallas
Job Description:
POSITION PURPOSE

Will work with the Business Intelligence team focused on providing solutions to complex business problems through the configuration, integration, testing and support of our software applications. This role requires project management experience and a strong technical background. This Business Analyst serves as a liaison between the business community and the IT organization to provide technical solutions to meet user needs. It requires a blend of analytical skills as well as extensive user interaction and great interpersonal skills.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND BASIC DUTIES

Analyzes business partner's operations to understand their strengths and weaknesses to determine opportunities to automate processes and functions
Assists in the business process redesign and documentation as needed for new technology
Translates high-level business requirements into functional specifications for the BI team and manages changes to such specifications
Update, implement and maintain procedures
Perform some User Acceptance Testing
Assist in the definition of project scope and success criteria
Prepares business cases including cost/benefit analysis for proposed processes
Develops reports and documents for existing business processes and business rules
Adheres to IT policies and procedures and industry accepted practice
Conducts post implementation review and document goal attainment

QUALIFICATIONS
Education/Certification: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information systems or equivalent. Project management certification a plus.

Required Knowledge

Experience in business analysis in an Agile environment.
Experience with agile work organizations tools (Azure DevOps, Basecamp).
Have a solid understanding of software development life cycles.
Strong technical background allowing to provide credible leadership to the BI
team and accurately evaluate complex project risks and issues.
A solid understanding of how APIs and databases function at a high level.
Experience creating functional requirements and use cases.
Experience implementing technology applications.
Excellent organizational and analytical skills are essential.

Experience Required

7+ years of experience as a Business Analyst
3+ years managing and/or leading IT project implementations
3-5 years of experience in financial/banking industry a plus

Skills/Abilities

Must be flexible and willing to adapt to changes and can establish and maintain effective working relationships with staff and other departments/agencies.
Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
Excellent documentation skills.
Must be willing to work after-hours
Must work well in a team environment
Must be able to interface with users and vendors
Must have sense of urgency and ownership to support financial applications, with architectural and system component knowledge preferred
Proficiency in interpersonal communication, presentation, problem solving and analytical skills
Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously with attention to detail and accuracy.
Must be a self-starter that is driven to understand and complete tasks within the guidelines and timeframes assigned.

Hours: Monday - Friday 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM.
40 hours per week

Overview:
Who we are

Imagine working in a place where continuous improvement and innovation is celebrated and rewarded; where fast-paced, high-impact teams come together to positively drive results for one of the largest & most iconic brands in the world.


As the only rapidly growing retailer, you may know us as your friendly neighborhood store. You probably know our familiar name, have seen our pervasive logo, and have tried our highly sought-after products, such as Slurpee® and Big Bite®. “Brain Freeze” is a 7-Eleven registered trademark for our 53-year old Slurpee® and with over 77,000 stores globally (more than any other retailer or food service provider), we sell over 14 million a month.


But there’s a lot more to our story and much more left to be written. We are transforming our business, ensuring we are customer obsessed and digitally enabled to seamlessly link our brick and mortar stores with digital products and services.




At 7-Eleven the entrepreneurial spirit is in our DNA and has been ever since our inception 90+ years ago. It’s what drove us to invent the convenience industry in 1927 by envisioning how a simple ice dock could provide household staples such as milk and eggs to better serve the needs of our customers.




Today we are redefining convenience and the customer experience in big ways...we are fundamentally changing our culture and we want talented, innovative, customer obsessed, and entrepreneurial people like you to come make history with us.


How we lead

At 7-Eleven we are guided by our Leadership Principles.




Be Customer Obsessed
Be Courageous with Your Point of View
Challenge the Status Quo
Act Like an Entrepreneur
Have an “It Can Be Done” Attitude
Do the Right Thing
Be Accountable

Each principle has a defined set of behaviors which help guide the 7-Eleven team to Serve Customers and Support Stores.


About This Opportunity
Responsibilities:

7Drive is 7-Eleven’s delivery division and we’re on a mission to bring on-demand delivery to cities and towns throughout the United States. We serve our communities by connecting our network of gig-economy drivers to restaurants, retailers, and grocers.


Responsibilities
Responsible for developing the pricing strategy and product strategy for 7NOW Marketplace.
Perform day to day analysis of 7NOW Marketplace pricing to determine overall effectiveness of various strategies and plan.
Prepare necessary financial modeling to determine pricing opportunities at a national and regional and promotional level.
Provide Product team data-driven insights and analysis to support ongoing sales and profitability growth.
Support analysis for delivery promotional activity on an ongoing basis by merchant
Evaluate competitive information to continually align pricing strategies within the marketplace.
Assess the impact of promotions on 7NOW Marketplace and present recommendations.
Manage the delivery P&L to ensure we drive profitability and operate within budget constraints.
Design frameworks for the team to develop A|B testing framework.
Synthesize data and analysis (e.g., A/B testing) to generate actionable insights to solve complex problems.
Conduct deep dive analysis to identify profitability optimization opportunities, apply problem solving methodology to drive sustainable improvements.
Apply existing and new solutions in creative ways to address complex issues and problems.
Build out advanced analytical capabilities and define analytical priorities.
Ability to independently analyze data, generate relevant insights, present to diverse audience, and convey sophisticated findings in a clear and impactful way. Ability to develop frameworks and train the teams do the same.
People Management: Coaching and mentoring analysts with a goal of developing and retaining high performing talent.
Qualifications:
Bachelors/4 Year Degree.
5+ years’ experience in pricing, financial and business analysis.
3+ years’ experience with data analytics programming in Javascript, Python SQL or equivalent.
1+ year experience in managing teams.
Experience in building models to predict financial impact of decisions.
Demonstrated proficiency in SQL and noSQL query syntax, data cleansing and data transformation.
Experience with data analytics tools such as PowerBI, Alteryx, SAS or equivalent.
Project management skills.
Ability to work in a team environment.

Description

Brado is looking for an inquisitive BI Analyst who will support our product, sales, leadership and marketing teams with insights gained from analyzing data. Do you have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large digital data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes? If you answered yes, we want to meet you!

Ideal Candidate
The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimization and using models to test the effectiveness of different courses of action.

They must have strong experience using a variety of data mining/data analysis methods, using a variety of data tools, building and implementing models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations. They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-based insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams.

Requirements
3+ Years of Python Experience
Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages: Python, SQL, etc.
Experience of Platforms: Google Cloud, AWS, Azure, Databricks, etc.
Experience using statistical computer languages (SQL, Python, etc.) to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets.
Experience working with and creating data architectures.
The expertise to architect, develop and troubleshoot large production-grade distributed systems on GCP and select the appropriate tools to tackle business problems at the correct scale.
Experienced working with cloud data storage, data warehousing/data lake architecture, ELT/ ETL, and reporting/ analytic frameworks technologies, such as BigQuery, Dataflow, Looker Studio, and Tableau.
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.
A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.
Bachelor’s degree in Computer science, Mathematics, or Statistics. Relevant master’s degree strongly preferred.
Benefits
Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
Retirement Plan (401k, IRA)
Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
Family Leave (Maternity, Paternity)
Short Term & Long Term Disability
Training & Development
Work From Home

Our best-in-class products are just the start as we lay the groundwork for the future of digital banking and payments. We hope you’ll join us. We can’t do it without you.

Let’s take a closer look at the role of a Director of Financial Planning & Analysis to determine if this opportunity is right for you!
The Director of Financial Planning and Analysis is responsible for directing all company financial planning and analysis functions, transforming operational data into insights for senior management in support of short and long-term financial goals. The Director of FP&A will be responsible for preparing and providing timely and relevant financial analysis, key performance indicators (KPIs), business plans, and working models to identify opportunities and gaps needed to make informed business decisions. Success in this role will be achieved through effective cross-functional business partnerships with senior leadership and providing strategic finance support and thought leadership in support of company goals, strategy, and objectives. This role reports to the Senior Vice President of Finance, Accounting & Compliance.
Here’s more of what you will do… (OK, not all in one day!)
A Director of Financial Planning and Analysis can be expected to perform the following tasks in this role as a routine part of their job:
Conducts in-depth, insightful, and timely financial analysis, including variance analysis, profitability assessments, and scenario modeling.
Identifies trends, risks, and opportunities within the financial data and provides actionable insights to senior management.
Develops key performance indicators (KPIs) and financial metrics to monitor and drive the company's financial performance.
Develops, generates, and delivers reports and dashboards in support of day-to-day operations and strategic decision making.
Leads development of dashboards in support of monitoring and tracking financial performance; Levels: market, enterprise, hometown, business unit, portfolio, supplier, channel, and customer segment.
Understands reporting needs of customers and business units through cross-functional collaboration.
Creates effective strategies to collect internal and external relevant data, analyze information, conduct research, and implement analytics solutions to drive business performance.
Communicates analytic results to business using static and dynamic graphic displays of data, written reports, and presentations.
Leads development of monthly, quarterly, annual, and long-range volume forecasts and business plans (i.e., development and compilation, process, timeline, and presentation).
Guides the exploration of statistical and predictive analysis techniques in the development of forecasting models for use in business plans.
Ensures regular evaluation of selected forecasting models for accuracy (error).
Fosters strategic partnership development of FP&A team with Brand Management leaders to help guide strategic portfolio profitability decisions.
Supports the Project Management Office (PMO) by tracking, analyzing, and providing financial information and insight for strategic initiatives and projects.
Manages collaborative development of optimal portfolio pricing strategies by customer channel and portfolio line of business.
Collaborates with Brand Management team on price strategies through use of market price point data, price sensitivities, price indexes and price elasticity models.
Identifies pricing opportunities through insights that will drive growth within customer segments and portfolios.
Guides development of competitive market intelligence analysis to partner with Brand Management and Sales teams in delivering fact-based selling stories for high value customer sales calls.
Owns key relationships with syndicated data consultants, ensuring competitive market data needs of the organization are met and routinely evaluated for effectiveness.
Partners with CIO and technology leadership team to develop and execute company data governance and data management strategies.
Ensures data accuracy, integrity and consistency in all reports and analyses.
Drives continuous improvement in financial processes and tools, reporting methodologies, and analysis techniques.
Implements best practices and leverages emerging technologies to improve processes.
Builds cross-functional working relationships and provides financial reporting, guidance and leadership to all areas of the organization (i.e., Sales, Brand, Operations, and other Shared Service departments).
Motivates and provides positive leadership to FP&A team. Mentors, coaches, supports and provides guidance to FP&A team members in their roles, career path and professional development.
Fosters an optimistic culture of excellence, collaboration, continuous improvement, and continued learning.
Provides opportunities and guidance that enables the transfer of learning into effective practice for team members.
This list is not all inclusive of other tasks and subtasks that may be necessary in performing this role, but rather an overview of the role’s primary work tasks.
Here’s what you must have to be considered for this role…
Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or related field
Ten+ Years Progressively Responsible Experience in Financial Planning, Accounting, or Business Analysis with at least three years leading annual forecasting process
Experience using Analytical Software in Predictive and Statistical Applications; Advanced Technical Expertise; Financial Systems/Applications; Database Querying
Highly proficient/Expert level in Microsoft Excel and data visualization tools (Microsoft Power BI)
Strong Communication, Presentation and Relationship Building Skills (both up and down in the organization)
Strong leadership skills and experience mentoring a developing a high-performance team
Here’s what we hope you have…
MBA or CPA designation
Five+ Years Experience Leading and Developing Analyst Teams
Experience Implementing and/or Using SQL, Python, R, Alteryx or Other Statistical Analysis or Programming Software
Workday Financials Experience (including Prism and Accounting Center)

We are EssilorLuxottica, a global leader in the design, manufacture and distribution of ophthalmic lenses, frames and sunglasses. The Company brings together the complementary expertise of two industry pioneers, one in advanced lens technologies and the other in the craftsmanship of iconic eyewear, to create a vertically integrated business that is uniquely positioned to address the world’s evolving vision needs and the global demand of a growing eyewear industry.


With over 180,000 dedicated employees in 150 countries driving our iconic brands, our people are creative, entrepreneurial and celebrated for their unique perspectives and individuality. Committed to vision, we enable people to “see more and be more” thanks to our innovative designs and lens technologies, exceptional quality and cutting-edge processing methods. Every day we impact the lives of millions by changing the way people see the world.


Our unique business model and relentless pursuit of operational excellence ensures that consumers everywhere have access to products. Balancing speed, efficiency and proximity, the Company manages a global supply chain with cutting-edge technology, based on centralization for frames and on a capillary network for lens finishing and prescription laboratories. Greasing the wheels behind the scenes, our people in Operations are the backbone of our Company.
GENERAL FUNCTION
Work as part of a team responsible for systems support and improvements that will increase profitability, efficiency and flexibility of the ELOA lab network. Work with the Lab Team Leaders within Regions to create an environment of trust where systems, developments and enhancements are adopted and integrated into current working practices, and where systems and technologies are fully utilized. Provide systems support, know-how, and technical expertise to support Lab goals and imperatives and maximize system improvement opportunities.


MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Work to achieve subject matter expert level in:
Optifacts LMS & other lab applications deployed
Systems reporting capabilities


Support Lab Team Leaders within Regions to meet Operational Excellence objectives defined below through the utilization of current systems and the deployment of systems improvements and new functionalities:
Service – Turn-time, Service Level, & Late Jobs
Quality – Breakage & Redo’s
Unit Cost – Finishing, Coating, Transportation


Continuous Improvement
Ensure a well maintained and robust environment that meets current and future business needs by identifying areas of opportunity for Continuous Improvement.
Preparation of functional requirements that will deliver Lab defined enhancements to meet business needs
Define and capture the metrics to measure the impact and success of these improvements


Project Support
Gather user requirements needed for new systems evaluation.
Participate in the definition, evaluation, development, and deployment of new systems solutions to ELOA Lab network.
Process mapping to identify potential impact and risk areas.


BASIC QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s Degree in computer science, Information Systems, Business Administration or related field
Dedication to improving the performance of EOA Labs through effective information delivery
Knowledge of the Lens Rx business (Recommended)
Solid data mining skills
Business Intelligence experience in data collection, management, and metrics deployment
Outstanding verbal, written, and communication skills in both business and IS environments


Employee pay is determined by multiple factors, including geography, experience, qualifications, skills and local minimum wage requirements. In addition, you may also be offered a competitive bonus and/or commission plan, which complements a first-class total rewards package Benefits/Incentive Information including health benefits, PTO, 401K, paid family leave, tuition reimbursement, and eyewear discounts.

Bring your heart to CVS Health. Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand — with heart at its center — our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver.

Our Heart At Work Behaviors™ support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable.

Position Summary

This role is responsible for supporting the development of a vision, roadmap and solution for enterprise Pharmacy Benefit Management products that achieve outcomes and deliver value.
It requires strong relationship management and influencing skills and the ability to partner cross-functionally with key stakeholders to deliver on commitments.
Participate in product discovery activities, deeply understanding the business, the consumers, the market and working with the team to innovate, test and deliver value.
Supports product strategy for the entire life cycle management of a technology/digital product, including purpose, definition, design, planning, development, prototyping and testing. Applies design thinking techniques (e.g., user journeys, wire-framing, prototyping) in order to define product features; develops the roadmap based on effort sizing and overall value to the business.
Facilitates the capturing of consumer and business needs through the creation of user/technology stories for the engineering team to deliver business value
Evaluate current product state to identify opportunities through customer needs, product analysis, digital data and stakeholder conversations.
Able to understand Federal, Medicare, State, Managed Care and Medicaid regulations and translate in functional requirements.
Work with multiple business areas, understand their needs that meet the end-user needs.
Demonstrate knowledge in various domains like NCPDP, UM Utilization, Pricing, Rebate, Coordination of Benefits, Accumulation, Employer Group Employer Plan, DUR, EDI, HIPAA, ICD-10 etc.
Provide product demos to inform and gain adoption.
Keep a close pulse on the voice of the customer, identify insights and propose solutions to address problems and maximize latest opportunities.
Work with SQL, querying database tables, writing complex queries, and generating reports.
Write and execute functional, end-user Acceptance test cases, creating system level documentation, and managing defects

Required Qualifications

5+ years Product Management, Product Owner or Business Analysis experience, owning enterprise-scale products/capabilities

Job Title: MBA Rotational Program - Associate Business Analyst
Job Description:
MBA Rotational Program - Associate Business Analyst

We are searching for…
MBA talent passionate about making lives better. Axxess is a leading technology innovator for healthcare at home focused on solving the most complex industry challenges. As a member of our team, you will collaborate and present innovative health solutions that have a global impact. As an emerging leader you will be exposed to Axxess’ business processes on teams such as Product, Marketing, Finance, Engineering and Client Experience to name a few. You deliver creative solutions, while leading challenging projects connected to our Axxess’ business objectives. This opportunity is for MBA professionals with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, build professional skills and advance a global career. Join us as a Associate Business Analyst.

What you will experience...
A one-year program, designed to provide professional development for career growth and advancement
Mentorship and engagement with senior leadership across the business
Global experience, to include a two-week residency in global markets
Deployment to an Axxess team upon successful completion of the rotational program
A fast-paced, collaborative team-oriented environment that encourages everyone to bring their authentic self to work every day
Competitive compensation with full selection of benefits, including company-matching 401k contributions and 20 days of paid time off + holidays + birthdays
Who we are…
It’s simple. We do business differently, by empowering our team to create fresh ideas which impact lives everywhere. We don’t just dream it; we do it every day at Axxess, we bring life-changing technology to healthcare impacting the way people work, learn, and grow their business. Our edge does not come from our technology, it comes from our people. We work as one team with a common goal to create shared success benefiting everyone.

What you will do…
Develop creative solutions to challenging issues
Gain knowledge and understanding of industry trends, KPI’s and analysis and the overall competitive landscape
Engage with our partners and clients to identify challenges and develop marketing strategies, adoption and of solutions
Develop partnerships in emerging markets
Manage project schedules and communicate risk to stakeholders

What do you bring...
Currently, pursuing an MBA from a college or university, with a graduation date in 2023 or May 2024
Undergraduate degree from an accredited college or university (3.3 minimum GPA, preferred)
Demonstrated success with a minimum of two years of post-baccalaureate professional work experience
High level of business and global acumen
Ability to travel domestically and internationally
Exemplified leadership on previous projects
Collaborative with a learning mindset and desire for continuous improvement

You are better prepared if you…
Possess passion about increasing access to quality healthcare globally
Have contributed to high-performing teams or organizations
Lead strategic planning and implementation
Desire an exciting experience in a rapidly growing privately held company

MBA Timeline:
Apply - November 2023 - January 2024
Interview -
February 2024
Final selection -
March 2024
Axxess orientation -
June 5, 2024
Global office visit -
Spring 2025
Deployment to Axxess team -
June 2025
Axxess is an equal opportunity employer and drug-free workplace. All applicants must be authorized to work in and currently reside in the United States. We offer a competitive compensation package (DOE), benefits and growth opportunities for everyone who joins Axxess!

#LI-CK1

Sr. Manager, Global Customer Success




Your role

We are searching for a Continuous Improvement Manager to deliver business performance improvement opportunities for our organization. In this role, you will analyze customer feedback, current practices and develop business process improvements as well as recommend workflow, system, and process changes to ensure continuous company performance.

As a continuous improvement manager, you should be a skilled communicator, experienced in business analysis, project and solution implementation. Candidates must have technical knowledge, effective communication, and training experience. Must be able to work with technical development teams and end-users to support process, system, and data requirements. Ability to comprehend, analyze and interpret data, system integrations, and external applications. Position involves participation in complex global technical projects, including but not limited to ERP implementation, Global Customer Portal launch, Global Service Management process and system change management.

This position reports to Global Customer Insights, a function of Global Customer Success, and works closely with Global Operations, Information Technology, Customer Care, and Customer Success Manager communities in North American, EMEA, and APAC Regions.

Continuous Improvement Manager Responsibilities:

Analyzing customer experience feedback.
Analyzing company processes and procedures.
Developing process enhancement strategies.
Investigating gaps, issues, and complaints in current business processes.
Collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders to enhance processes and systems.
Communicating ideas and opinions to cross-functional management.
Training, mentoring, and guiding team members in new processes.



Continuous Improvement Manager Requirements:

A bachelor's degree in business administration, process management, or operations.
A graduate degree in business or MBA would be beneficial.
Five years' experience in process optimization, operations, or business management.
Knowledge of Lean Six Sigma principles and methodologies. Certification Preferred.
Proficiency in data analytics tools and modeling.
High degree of ownership over work and ability to work independently.
Clear communicator with excellent written, verbal, and listening skills.
Familiarity with Agile SDLC and Project management experience helpful.
A sharp eye for identifying weak points in processes and organizational structures.
A thorough understanding of the latest process enhancement strategies.
Dynamic thinking and problem-solving abilities.
Confidence in your abilities to lead organizational change.

Continuous Improvement Manager Job Description:

The primary focus of this role is analysis of customer and internal feedback to develop organizational performance insights that aim to improve people, process, and systems as part of our global customer experience program. Part of this role includes oversight and management of our Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Customer Experience (CX) Management software applications. Software application requirements include system administration, user support, trouble shooting, and issue resolution. The Global Continuous Improvement Lead is also responsible for identification and implementation of process improvements, solution development, system, process training, change enablement, and oversight of technical support resources.

Continuous Improvement Manager Technical Skill Requirements:

To qualify for this position, candidates must have knowledge and hands on experience with data tools and models, system integrations and APIs, Salesforce.com, and PowerBI. ERP, ServiceNow, Gainsight CRM, and Qualtrics knowledge preferred.

Ability to collaborate with internal stakeholders to define business requirements using various skills, such as critical thinking, process development, and latest management methodologies.
Maintain, review, and analyze organizational performance levering customer and internal feedback from software applications and data analytics tools.
Capture and use customer feedback and internal business requirements to enhance systems, process improvements, and develop end-user reporting and data visualizations for consumption and analysis.
Conduct research and analysis of business situations to contextualize and summarize solutions for end users.
Extensive data analysis experience to ensure accurate data for business consumption using a combination of manual and automated data cleansing and migration solutions.
Work with Global cross-functional teams to develop, evaluate, and execute system enhancement and process improvement roadmaps.

A bit about us

Digital Realty brings companies and data together by delivering the full spectrum of data center, colocation and interconnection solutions. PlatformDIGITAL®, the company’s global data center platform, provides customers with a secure data meeting place and a proven Pervasive Datacenter Architecture (PDx®) solution methodology for powering innovation and efficiently managing Data Gravity challenges. Digital Realty gives its customers access to the connected data communities that matter to them with a global data center footprint of 300+ facilities in 50+ metros across 28 countries on six continents.




A bit about our Digital team

Our Operations team keeps our customers’ infrastructure running safely and securely. We get plenty of opportunities to take on a variety of tasks and develop our technical skills. From overseeing electrical power to cooling and fire suppression systems, our team plays a vital role in making sure everything in our data centers operates as it should.




What we can offer you

Our rapidly evolving business sector offers the opportunity to be part of a courageous and passionate team who work together to understand and meet the changing needs of our global customers.




Join us and you’ll be part of a supportive and inclusive environment where you can bring your whole self to work. As part of our team, you’ll get to work with people from different business areas, challenge the way we do things and put your ideas into action. We’ll also give you plenty of development opportunities so you can build a rewarding and successful career with us.




Our Compensation Philosophy

Digital Realty offers its employees a highly competitive compensation package, excellent benefits, and an environment that recognizes and rewards your contributions. Central to our compensation philosophy is rewarding our employees for achieving the values and objectives aligned to the company's overall goals and values.




This is an exciting time to join our business so apply now and make your mark on our future.

Title: IT Business Systems Analyst


Reports to: IT Director


Position Overview:


The IT Business Systems Analyst is responsible for planning, designing, and implementing databases for Center programs. Activities involve interaction with various departments and end-user personnel to determine all pertinent data required to develop and maintain systems. The IT Business Systems Analyst will also focus on the strategic development, optimization, & maintenance of the organization’s IT systems. This individual will be a technical specialist collaborating with various departments to understand data needs, process efficiencies, & ensure optimal system operations.


Job Duties & Responsibilities:


Strategic Systems Management: Provide expert recommendations & strategic input to optimize IT systems, ensuring alignment with organizational needs & goals.
Systems Maintenance & Optimization: Oversee & maintain key organizational databases, ensuring operational excellence & advanced troubleshooting of issues.
Advanced Troubleshooting: Diagnose & resolve intricate system issues, going beyond typical user support to ensure uninterrupted system operations.
Interdepartmental Collaboration: Collaborate closely with different departments to understand & meet their data & process requirements.
Report & Query Management: Build & maintain intricate reports & queries as needed, to ensure the availability of essential data for organizational processes & decision-making.
Data Management & Security: Safely import mass data between systems, ensuring data integrity, security, & compliance with relevant policies & regulations.
Project Management: Lead & oversee IT-related projects, ensuring they are completed on time, within scope, & meet organizational goals.
Training: Lead & coordinate training sessions & creating manuals, ensuring team members are proficient & up to date with the latest system standards & best practices.
Continuous Learning: Stay abreast of the latest industry trends, tools, & best practices, ensuring the organization’s IT systems are cutting-edge & efficient.
Analyze existing tools and databases and provide software solution recommendations.


Job Requirements & Qualifications:


degree or equivalent experience, with preference for additional specialized certifications
Minimum 3 years of experience in IT systems management or a related role.
Experience in project management, ensuring the successful execution of IT initiatives.
Proficiency in CRM & EMR systems such as ClientTrack, TakeChargeTexas, eClinicalWorks, & E2Dallas or experience with similar database/software systems.
Ability to provide strategic input, troubleshoot advanced issues, & lead IT projects.
Strong verbal & written communication skills, with a detail-oriented & analytical mindset.
Familiarity with industry-specific software solutions & the ability to adapt to new tools.

You will play an integral part in executing JSX's aggressive growth strategy by providing Commercial teams with the data and insights necessary to make an informed business decision. Why join Stryker?
We are proud to be named one of the World’s Best Workplaces and a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune Magazine! Learn more about our award-winning organization by visiting stryker.com


As the Senior Business Analyst - CPQ, you will form partnerships with business users across departments and build expertise that will help you prioritize, gather, and document Oracle CPQ requirements related to new configurable product launches, current configurable product updates, continuous improvement initiatives, and clarifying requirements to implement bug fixes.

Who We Want

Collaborative partners. People who build and leverage cross-functional relationships to bring together ideas, data and insights to drive continuous improvement in functions.

Analytical problem solvers. People who go beyond just fixing to identify root causes, evaluate optimal solutions, and recommend comprehensive upgrades to prevent future issues.

Effective communicators. People who can interpret information clearly and accurately to concisely communicate results and recommendations to stakeholders, senior management, and their teams.

What You Will Do

Requirements gathering, testing, and documentation of Oracle CPQ Product Configuration, Commerce, Document Designer, and Pricing Functions focusing on the addition of new product lines to an existing Oracle CPQ Cloud implementation, documenting Sales Bill of Material requirements and Manufacturing Bill of Material requirements.
Work with business department stakeholders, prioritizes enhancement requests related to Oracle CPQ and SAP Variant Configurator.
Consult with Sales, Marketing, Production, and R&D Project managers on specific product line needs.
Learn Stryker’s implementation of Oracle CPQ and becomes a subject matter expert of CPQ end user functionality.
Review upcoming Oracle CPQ Cloud version release notices and collaborates with the CPQ development team to document the required changes.
Collaborate with internal developers and external consultants to create project plans and participate in unit testing and End User Testing.
Lead business process mapping and requirements gathering sessions with business stakeholders.
Work with middleware teams to document interfaces in and out of CPQ in clear and concise business language.
Track CPQ project progress and reports status, issues, and roadblocks to the responsible R&D project manager for a new product launch.
Share industry best practices around Configure-to-Order systems and business processes.
Drive continuous process improvement activities and initiatives.

What You Need

Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Information Systems, or equivalent required.
2+ years of relevant experience.
Knowledge of Product Configuration & Rules, Commerce Process, Document Designer and Pricing functionality of Oracle CPQ Cloud or other CPQ systems required.
Experience developing Oracle CPQ Configurators is preferred but not required.
Experience administering Oracle CPQ (formerly BigMachines) preferred.
Experience building manufacturing bills of material using SAP Variant Configurator preferred.
Demonstrated understanding of commercial processes and manufacturing processes including Assemble-to-Order and the differentiation between Sales BOMs and Manufacturing BOMs preferred.
Knowledge of Oracle CPQ integrations with Salesforce.com, Model N and SAP S/4 preferred.

Financial benefits include Health Savings Account (HSA), Flexible Spending Accounts (FSAs), 401(k) plan, Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP), basic life and AD&D insurance, and short-term disability insurance.

Job Title: Analyst II, Business (226 Days) BOND FUNDED
Job Description:
Analyst II, Business (226 Days) BOND FUNDED -(RTP20231002-021)
Description
Prepare high-impact charts, data visualization, PowerPoint presentations and other types of quality reports and presentations suitable to communicate results to a variety of audiences.
Must be able to analyze complex processes, identify areas for improvement and recommend solutions.
Provides knowledge in the following ServiceNow areas: solutions scoping, requirements analysis, gap analysis, feasibility, functional design, application configuration, integration testing, user acceptance testing, production deployment, change management, support and training.
Elicit requirements using interviews, document analysis, requirements workshops, surveys, site visits, business process descriptions, use cases, scenarios, business analysis, tasks and workflow analysis.
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.
Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: Functional requirements, Business Requirements Document, and Use Cases.
Investigates reported application problems and works with system administartor to test, diagnose and isolate the root cause of problems. Prepares incident reports for further investigation by technical operations and development experts.
Keep abreast of technical, legislative, and professional trends and developments affecting the department's operations and programs and disseminate this information to appropriate personnel.
Successfully engage in multiple initiatives simultaneously.
Be the liaison between the business units, technology teams and support teams.
Work independently with users to define concepts and under the direction of project manager.
Maintains confidentiality of sensitive data request.
Performs all other tasks and duties as assigned.

All federally funded incumbents of this position must comply with time and effort reporting requirements through personnel activity reports or periodic certification, as appropriate.



Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Computer Science or related field.
5 or more years of specific job experience related to business analysis in complex environments with a Customer Relationship. Management, IT Operations focus. Analytical and research experience required.
Strong analytical skills required, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into application and operational requirements.
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding, and distinguish user requests from the underlying true needs.
Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements and deliver the following artifacts as needed: Functional requirements, Business Requirements Document, and Use Cases.
Demonstrated ability to supervise, delegate, direct, and provide constructive input to staff in a way that maximizes efficiency and productivity.
Demonstrated coaching, counseling, and conflict-resolution skills.
Demonstrated ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form.

Position: Senior Technical Business Analyst

Job Description:

Forward Air is seeking a Senior Technical Business Analyst to work in the IT department as part of our Corporate Systems Agile teams. This position will be responsible for corporate systems portfolios including Driver Compliance and Safety. The Senior Technical Business Analyst will be responsible for owning the overall design of assigned technical projects (custom or product strategy), as well as recommending best practices for solutions based on client business needs. This role will require strategic design and mapping of business user stories and solutions to system/technical requirements. The Senior Technical Business Analyst will be responsible for creating/documenting process maps and writing technical specifications for custom development or system integration. These specifications will need to be precise and clear, as the work will often be delegated to fellow team members such as developers, consultants, or used for product support/documentation. This position will require ad-hoc data analysis for analyzing existing integration and/or system issues. This position should engage in the best practice development initiatives, provide thoughtful leadership and thorough understanding of business processes integration with available technology for the most efficient use of corporate systems software.

Core Responsibilities & Duties:

Works effectively and individually with technical and non-technical team members and customers
Map business processes as integrated with technical solutions, both current and future states
Works with other value stream Agile teams to determine interdependencies
Committed to team collaboration, customer satisfaction, and success
Able to exercise independent judgment and take the lead role on enterprise level projects with minimal direction
Able to effectively facilitate meetings, demonstrate brainstorming/consensus building skills, and interact with executive level project sponsors
Use critical thinking to understand data and draw reasonable conclusions
Other duties as assigned

Qualifications:

A Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Technology, Engineering or equivalent experience. Industrial engineers with the desire and experience to work in IT and software development a plus
Prefer experience and/or understanding of their common processes for any of the following: Accounting, HR, Safety, Sales, Customer Service or Marketing
4-5 years of experience in business analysis, solutions development, creating business requirements, documenting process flows, and delivering business capabilities
Prefer professional certificate in Agile development (Scrum, Kanban, LEAN)
Prefer 2 years of experience as part of a team using Agile methodology
Strong math, statistical, analytical, database/computer science skills with ability to drive to conclusions

Skills:

The ideal candidate will possess a “can do” attitude with a “will do” work ethic
Must be a self-starter that does not require constant direction
Strong team player that thrives in a fast-paced environment
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills with ability to communicate effectively across all levels of operations/users, including translating between technical and functional teams
Ability to drive forward with proactive behavior and taker ownership
Efficiently handling multiple IT projects simultaneously
Strong computer skills with working knowledge of MS Office products (Excel, Word, PowerPoint), MS Visio or other graphical flow chart programs, Jira

Forward Air is an Equal Opportunity employer.




Since 1990, Forward Air has been a leading provider of ground transportation and related logistics services to the North American air freight and expedited LTL market. We offer surface shipping on an accelerated “time-definite” basis, delivering cargo at a specific time, but under less time-sensitive situations – supplying you with a cost effective, reliable alternative to air transportation. We work with companies of all sizes to develop tangible advantages and build the best products to meet your specific needs. Forward Air presents to the wholesale transportation community (logistics companies, freight forwarders, integrated air cargo carriers, passenger/ cargo airlines, and non-traditional shippers), a single-source provider that can deliver more supply chain services and a superior menu of choices. Throughout the years we have added supplementary lines to our linehaul service, such as full truckload operations (Truckload Services), final-mile coverage (Complete® Cartage), and an Airline Logistics program, and we will continue to expand our services to meet the changing needs and growth of our customer base.

Forward Air is structured to optimize both savings and service to our customers. Direct partnerships with owner-operators and other surface transportation providers, enable us to remain cost-competitive. The Forward Air network is designed with over 90 facilities located at or near major U.S. and Canadian airports, 12 regional sort centers and over 300 beyond points (secondary airports provided through our Complete Cartage service), creating one of the most comprehensive linehaul networks in the industry.

Overview:

Morgan Advanced Materials is a business rich in history and innovation. Founded in the UK in 1856, we have grown into a global organisation with 70 sites in 18 countries. Our model to serve our customers where they need us has led to a diversified product range using our unparalleled expertise in ceramic and carbon materials, which we exploit to solve difficult problems for our customers across a diverse range of markets.


We are a purpose driven organisation. Our purpose is to use advanced materials to make the world more sustainable and to improve the quality of life. We deliver on that purpose through the products that we make, and the way that we make them.


We help our customers push the limits of their processes and products to meet the demanding requirements they face, from higher process temperatures to higher product performance to increasing miniaturisation.

Key Figures: Revenue £1,112m (2022), ~8,500 employees, manufacturing in 30+ countries, and a global customer portfolio. A UK PLC with head office located in Windsor, Berkshire UK. Listed on London Stock Exchange; Member of the FTSE 250 Index.


Responsibilities:

OVERVIEW & SCOPE OF ROLE:

Morgan IT is on a mission to enable and drive the Morgan goals by being a valuable business partner to all Global Business Units and Functions by:

Running Effective and Efficient IT
Delivering Solid Business Foundations
Extracting Maximum Business Value from IT
Driving disruptive innovation

To do so, the OneIT team is currently executing on a strategic roadmap to make significant step changes in IT performance and business value from IT.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES & REPONSIBILITIES:
The D365 IT Business Analyst will ensure the line of business applications, primarily Dynamics 365 (D365), can sustain current and future business needs for our businesses. This role is responsible for providing D365 technical and functional expertise, ensuring business requirements are gathered and subsequent technical/functional resolutions are implemented appropriately. In addition, the role will ensure efficient and effective business as usual operation of D365, including remediation of issues.

The D365 IT Business Analyst understands both technology as well as business and is responsible to capture all business requirements in order to ensure proper IT solutions are delivered. The key focus is mapping functional requirements of the Finance & Supply Chain modules in D365, data and processes.

Serves as liaison to business and IT teams to understand business requirements and create and implement solutions as well as understanding root causes of current issues.

Supports designing business solutions that ensure alignment with the architecture principles and standards.
Documents and provides training for newly implemented systems and/or processes using Click Learn
Resolving incidents/issues, with root cause analysis and fix where appropriate, for D365 applications.
Applying functional and technical understanding of D365 to develop new functionality and integrations/interfaces with other systems as required, to support business growth.
Ensuring all aspects of the D365 development lifecycle are completed successfully, incorporating ISV solutions.
Assuring quality of releases (fixes/upgrades/enhancements etc) into production, through thorough testing and first-class environment management.
Ensuring vendor relationships remain transparent and with clearly understood outcomes
Supports Business Information Managers, Project Managers and Solution Architects in writing program / project proposals
Work with business end users to ensure the project meets business needs
Assumes ownership of the process, system, and expands skill base.
Interacts frequently with business process owners.
Conduct unit testing for project deliverables and facilitate user acceptance testing
Engage in efforts to establish scope and business case for new programs and initiatives.
Collaborate with team members to collect and analyse data

Job Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst/Product Owner - Workday Integrations
Job Description:
Senior Business Systems Analyst/Product Owner - Workday Integrations

Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 240+ data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed.

At Equinix, we help the world’s digital leaders scale with agility, speed the launch of digital services, deliver world-class experiences, and transform people’s lives. Our culture is based on collaboration and the growth and development of our teams.

We hire hardworking people who thrive on solving challenging problems and give them opportunities to hone new skills, and try new approaches, as we grow our product portfolio with new software and network architecture solutions. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment. that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.

Job Summary
Analyzes business requirements/functional designs to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraints. Designs software systems.


Responsibilities




Work closely with Human Resources and other Equinix stakeholders to understand business requirements related to integration requests and execute them through successful implementation and testing
Design and develop integration between Workday, Payroll, Benefits provides and various HR Boundary systems
Participate in projects and ensure coverage of all facets of design, development, testing, and a successful end-user experience
Build productive relationships with the IT Global team, including BSAs, developers, and infrastructure
Build productive relationships with the HR Global organization
Build and manage productive relationships with the various systems vendors and customer representatives
Analyze and determine application and interface solutions, understand application functionality
Perform system set-up, configuration, testing, and support day-to-day systems and interfaces issues

Stay current with industry and Equinix best practices and promotes opportunities for improvement through automation
Utilize IT Software Development Life Cycle methodology and Agile as they fit the initiative
Support internal and external systems audit initiatives
Manages enhancement and project releases for Workday
Triages and troubleshoots issues
Provides status against plans and escalates issues
Training and Change Management
May conduct research, pilot features and document and prepare recommendations for review
Documents configurations for future use and training Day to Day Support (Production Support)


Qualifications

Minimum of 4 years of Workday technical experience developing integrations using Workday Studio, Core Connectors, XSLT and EIBs
Minimum of 2 years of Workday functional experience in configuring and debugging business processes, validation rules, calc fields, report writing and system security
Minimum of 1 years of Project lead experience
7+ years of work experience

Acute understanding of business systems analysis and how to apply it to complex solutions
Good understanding of HR, Payroll and related Finance business processes, systems and their inter-dependencies
Bachelors Degree in Information Systems or related area
Ability to balance business requirements, compliance regulations, and technology capabilities for global projects
Ability to provide leadership on projects to other Business Analysts
Outstanding communication skills

Preferably knowledge of Anaplan

Company Overview:

Hillwood, a Perot company, is a full-service industrial real estate developer, investor and advisor, focusing on institutional-grade industrial properties. From acquisitions and joint ventures to development, property management and fund/asset management, Hillwood provides creative solutions for its customers and long-term value for its partners. Hillwood has experience in 63 markets across North America and Europe and has developed and acquired 270.3 million square feet (Q3-2023). For additional information, visit www.hillwood.com.

Position Summary:

Hillwood IT is looking for a Vice President, Enterprise Applications and Strategy to join our growing organization. The Vice President, Enterprise Applications (EA) and Strategy will be responsible for leading the Enterprise Applications team and driving the execution of our strategic technology priorities through the development and realization of our enterprise application roadmap. The ideal candidate will possess a successful track record in leading technology and/or product teams through transformational change. He or she will have a strategic mindset, ability to develop trusting relationships, and expertise to drive technology results aligned to our overall business objectives.

Responsibilities:

Primary Job Duties:

Drive alignment across a federalized IT landscape, between our various businesses and corporate departments.
Effectively communicate the value of enterprise architecture and technology service portfolios to Hillwood, and drive improvements to service performance, costs, and business impacts.
Lead, mentor, and refine the enterprise applications team (architects, analysts, business and technology owners, managers & staff) working across Project / PMO and product teams. Instill architectural design precepts into everyday team practices.
Engage business and technology stakeholders to build and maintain relationships across various operating models. Adapt to different and changing business and operating models.
Evaluate trends & disruptions; incorporate emerging technologies into new company capabilities.
Evolve the Enterprise Applications teams’ services and operating model as capabilities improve.

Primary Job Functions:

Formulate Strategy and Guide Requirements:

Work with business and technology leaders to develop applications and service portfolio strategy.
Use plans, designs and capability-maturity approaches to construct and ‘sell’ future-state process & technology models.
Lead the development of an enterprise architecture roadmap with the internal capability to analyze current business processes vs. future capabilities and recommend potential solutions.
Translate & connect strategy to execution of targeted business outcomes, through collaborative and supportive approach, balancing operational excellence with growth and innovation.

Builds and Maintains Relationships

Continually assess stakeholder relationships to identify strengths and opportunities.
Lead technology teams to inform, advise, & improve the use of technology throughout enterprise.
Leverage enterprise architecture and project management capabilities to enhance stakeholder satisfaction with technology initiatives.
Advise strategic/portfolio committee(s) to guide project consideration & execution of transformational decisions and resolve conflicts between technology delivery and desired business outcomes.
Develop team capabilities both in technical skills and knowledge, but also in business awareness.

Guide Execution & Delivery of Business Outcomes:

Assess & drive operating technology services delivery to meet and exceed stakeholder expectations.
Lead team to drive understanding of business requirements, clarify project plans & expectations, and drive team to meet the desired outcomes.
Coordinate with peer leaders to facilitate proper priorities, decisions, and risk / issue resolution.
Conquer obstacles and risks to team project delivery with determination, ingenuity, and focus.
Ensure project / product delivery regularly incorporate ‘lessons learned’ and value realization.

Facilitate Innovation:

Assess disruptive forces affecting the organization and identifies technology-enabled innovation opportunities that enables business strategy.
Scan emerging technologies and the business ecosystem for major disruptive technology and nontechnology trends (trendspotting) that affect business.
Provide practical advice and best practices to take advantage of new, or emerging, opportunities and successfully deliver the expected business outcomes.

Required Skills/Abilities:

Strong leader, with exceptional soft and interpersonal skills including teamwork, conflict resolution, and negotiation.
Exceptional communication skills and stakeholder engagement capabilities.
Ability to interface with internal & external parties to achieve company goals, including challenging technology teams and business operations to achieve ‘stretch’ outcome.
Mastery of ERP, point-solution, and cloud-based applications – including integrated systems – to facilitate design and implementation of enterprise, cross-functional solutions.
Strong understanding of “off the shelf” software; judicious use of (minimal) customizations.
Comfortable navigating technology and learning, optimizing, and deploying multiple platforms.
Very strong analytical and problem-solving ability.

Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Finance, Business, Computer Engineering, or related field; Master’s degree preferred.
Minimum of 15 years of relevant business experience in strategic and operations planning and/ or business analysis or experience as an enterprise architecture consultation required.
Minimum of 10 years’ experience managing and leading technology and/or product teams.
Minimum of 10 years of experience managing ERPs and affiliated application or SaaS products.
Hands-on experience with JD Edwards, Salesforce, and modern BI/Reporting solutions is a plus.
Experience cultivating innovation and enhancing processes with continuous improvement.

Overview:
At Raising Cane’s Chicken Fingers® we serve only the best tasting and most craveable chicken finger meals. It’s our ONE LOVE®. Our Crew makes it happen, our Culture makes it unique and the Community makes it all worthwhile.
Every talented Crewmember in our Restaurant Support Office (RSO) is important to our success and a value to our rapidly growing company. We all work with a sense of purpose and focus on our chicken finger meals, Customers, Crew, Communities and Company Culture. We are constantly striving to Raise The Bar. The future for Raising Cane’s is growth focused and we’re on the path to being one of the top ten restaurant companies in the United States.
Responsibilities:
Your Role at Raising Cane’s:

The Senior Analyst is responsible for supporting the Restaurants within their geographical division and providing actionable financial analysis using strong business acumen and communication skills. This role will be tasked with defining and implementing key systems and processes to drive scalable growth to achieve the company’s long-term goals.
The Senior Analyst will be tasked with owning and assisting with reporting and analysis, budgeting and forecasting, and strategic planning. This role will also be responsible for collaborating cross-functionally across the organization and with the senior leadership team to perform ad hoc analyses, prepare and deliver presentations.

Your Impact and Responsibilities:
Primary Responsibility - Restaurant Support
Provides timely, clear, and actionable commentary on financial results, key trends in the business, and forecasts to drive sales, profitability and operational improvements. Actionable reporting includes:
Granular restaurant-level sales and traffic analysis highlighting opportunities to the restaurants
Granular restaurant-level sales & traffic forecast reviews
Key restaurant-level expense analysis specifically for Cost of Goods Sold, Labor, and Operating Expense
Hours of operation analysis and other traffic opportunities within the restaurant
New restaurant reporting and analytics
Identifies financial and operational business opportunities within individual restaurants
Supports the financial and operational reporting analysis of restaurant operations for daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual sales
Specializes in one functional area of the restaurant business (sales, operations, staffing, etc.) and provides regular reporting and analyses to restaurants on that subject
Secondary Responsibility - Cross-Functional Business Support
Develops financial models and tools to identify trends, analyze results, and optimize profit to enhance reporting efficiencies at the restaurant and company levels
Prepares and provides the marketing team with actionable commentary on financial results, key trends in the business, and forecasts to drive sales, profitability, and departmental improvements. Actionable reporting and support includes:
Monthly and quarterly departmental business reporting
Promotional and discount reporting
Marketing activation and post-campaign impact / ROI analyses
Marketing spend and expense analysis
Tool development to support field marketing initiatives
System-wide donation tracking
Assists in implementing and supporting key technology enhancements that will allow the FP&A, and business intelligence departments to continue to meet the expectations of the growing organization including data warehouse and reporting tool capabilities, and IT systems including Hot Schedules, Great Plains, Aloha, and proprietary technology
Assists FP&A team and company leaders to build and prepare financial performance presentations
Supports all other system-wide analysis needs that do not fall under the scope of the individual Restaurant FP&A team(s)
Qualifications:
Requirements for Success:
3+ years multi-unit retail or restaurant industry financial analysis required (or equivalent experience)
Self-driven, flexible, and highly energetic with strong analytical, written, and verbal communication skills
Ability to work effectively and efficiently both independently and collaboratively
Proficient in various technology systems and able to adapt to new systems quickly, i.e. business intelligence and planning software
Demonstrated competence in the use of software tools for data extraction, manipulation, analysis, and presentation
Microsoft Proficient: Excel, PowerPoint, and Word
Able to work out of the Dallas Restaurant Support Office located in Plano, TX
Able to travel as required
Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting or related field / MBA or CPA preferred

PFSW Company Statement:

PFS is the premier eCommerce order fulfillment provider. In short, we provide the behind-the-scenes operations for brand’s online stores. We pick, pack, and ship our clients’ products around the world – with a bunch of added flair. We personalize our packages, we help our clients’ customers with phone, email, and chat support, and we have a strong fraud team who ensure secure payment processing. Not to mention, a technology system that facilitates making orders, returns, and everything in-between.




Company Vision:

We will engage with our clients as a strategic partner.
We will provide a premier commerce order fulfillment solution.
We will be world-class at every service we offer.



Client Services Sr. Analyst

PFS' Business Management department is made up of a team of client services professionals that act as the liaison between our clients and PFS operations. We work with world-renowned brands to help them manage their eCommerce operations. This includes monitoring daily business activities and managing operational projects for order fulfillment, order management, and contact center clients. The Client Services Sr. Analyst is responsible for interfacing with the client and functional areas, acting as the primary tactical day to day relationship owner.




Responsibilities

Engage with client in a timely and efficient manner by serving as the day to day contact ensuring all contractual elements of the SOW are being performed and if needed, as the escalation point/liaison within functional areas of company
Responsible for updating client data and providing data functional areas by presenting data that is usable, accurate, descriptive and timely so that it may be most efficiently utilized
Responsible for management of financial performance by updating the P&L, creating and submitting invoices to Accounts Payable monthly, managing Accounts Receivable with the client, and communicating projected revenue shifts internally
Exhibit leadership throughout issue management by employing patience, understanding best business practices and balancing client expectations with available options for resolution
Running standalone projects by working with the client and functional areas to gather scope, delegate project tasks, communicate project statuses internally and externally, and execute on deliverables within client approved timeline
Perform difficult and complex work assignments involving independent judgment
Leads a work stream or elements of a project
Identify and solve operational gaps and owns financials and monthly invoicing
Manage client expectations through proactive communication
Lead, trains, and coaches others through the recognition of expertise within the area of practice



Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree, required
3-5 years relevant working experience interfacing with internal/external clients, preferably with direct to consumer ecommerce; Required



Personal Characteristics




Strong work ethic
Sound problem-solving skills, business analysis skills
Capability to understand basic financials (i.e. costs vs. revenue)
Strong interpersonal relationship skills
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Computer literacy skills (including Microsoft Excel, Word and Powerpoint)



Pre-employment background screening will be conducted.

Job Summary
Reporting to the Assistant Director for Systems Operations, the 3rd Party Systems Administrator is responsible for third-party system configuration and maintenance. This includes enabling and setting up system configurations, evaluating integrations, supporting system upgrades, optimizing existing configurations, troubleshooting issues, and producing system configuration documentation.
Minimum Education and Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in related field
Three (3) years or more experience working as an application administrator to maintain configurations, understand integrations, configure new features, review system upgrade information, and optimize system configurations.
Three (3) years or more experience providing customer service to troubleshoot issues and assist with system configuration changes.
Six (6) months or more experience working as a business analyst, financial analyst, data analyst, or in a comparable role within a business unit utilizing an ERP or third-party application.
Equivalent combination of experience/education may be considered.
Preferred Education and Experience
Five to seven years of experience working as an application administrator to maintain configurations, understand integrations, configure new features, review system upgrade information, and optimize system configurations
Five to seven years in customer service to troubleshoot issues and assist with system configuration changes
One year to three years of experience working as a business analyst, financial analyst, data analyst, or in a comparable role within a business unit
Master’s degree in a related field
Essential Duties and Responsibilities
Provide administrative support and system maintenance for third-party applications (configurations, access updates, data issues, workflow updates, liaison with third-party applications contacts)
Analyze and review system data to maintain timeliness of system operations and identify any possible issues or areas of improvement
Troubleshoot production data and configuration issues related to third party applications
Provide third-party system data and configuration support during system upgrades
Produce job aids and training documentation for third-party systems
Work with stakeholders and module owners to optimize and troubleshoot third-party system configurations
Assist stakeholders, module owners, and business process analysts with understanding integrations between the third-party applications and the ERP system
Generate reports from third-party applications to provide data to functional areas
Participate in enhancement projects involving third-party systems

Job Title: Business Analyst - SAP MM/OpenText - Early Career to Lead
Job Description:
Are you interested in joining our team? Chat with our digital assistant to learn more about our company and apply right from your mobile device!

Text ETP to 25000 to get started or apply through this web posting if you prefer.

Energy Transfer, a Fortune 50 organization, recognized by Forbes as one of America's best large employers, is dedicated to responsibly and safely delivering America’s energy. We are driven to inspire our employees to create superior value for our customers, our investors, a sustainable future and giving back to the community where we have long-standing commitments to causes including MD Anderson Children’s Cancer Hospital, The Salvation Army, American Heart Association, Ronald McDonald House and many more. Come join our award winning 10,000 strong organization as we fuel the world and each other!

This position comes with world class compensation, benefits, 401(k) match, profit sharing, and PTO.

Summary:

Energy Transfer, is currently seeking an SAP MM/Opentext to support their business system. This position is part of the Accounting and Finance organization and supports the Entergy Transfer core business processes . The position will involve working closely with AP and procurement. Looking for an early career to Lead level in this area to support Energy Transfer growing business needs.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Overall responsibility to deliver support services, and support business initiatives for all aspects of SAP with a strong focus on SAP MM and IM Modules
Excellent business process analysis and redesign experience; business analytical problem solving skills as well as the ability to quickly identify problems and recommend solutions
Gather and facilitate business process discussions, solution design and documentation, testing, and end-user support
Be a trusted advisor, helping the business make better, informed decisions by presenting relevant SAP solution alternatives for key challenges; evaluate business and system impact of proposed changes
Confidently and assertively liaison with business users and management
Partner with multiple business units in an environment of continuous change
Develop documentation that effectively feeds training and change management activities
Engage in other assignments as requested by management



Requirements:
Education and/or Experience, Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential job duty satisfactorily. The requirements for this position are listed below:
Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience required lieu of degree.
Relevant years of experience per requirements below
Working knowledge of OpenText so will be able to gather requirements and trouble shoot issue
Strong SAP Materials Management (MM), SAP Inventory Management (IM) skills are required, as is understanding serialization and equipment management
SAP Warehouse Management (WM) skills a plus
Strong communication and collaboration skills are a must, understanding and writing business requirements documents are core to the position
Required experience is commensurate with the selected job level:
The Specialist/Analyst level requires a Bachelor’s degree and 2-5 years of relevant job related experience
The Senior Specialist/Analyst level requires a Bachelor’s degree and 5-8 years of relevant job related experience
The Lead Specialist/Analyst level requires a Bachelor’s degree and 8+ years of relevant job related experience

Usually, normal office working conditions.
