Job Title: Senior Procurement Business Analyst - IT Vendor Management
Job Description:
Senior Procurement Business Analyst - IT Vendor Management

Equinix is the world’s digital infrastructure company, operating 240+ data centers across the globe and providing interconnections to all the key clouds and networks. Businesses need one place to simplify and bring together fragmented, complex infrastructure that spans private and public cloud environments. Our global platform allows customers to place infrastructure wherever they need it and connect it to everything they need to succeed.

We are a fast-growing global company with 20 years of continuous growth. Through our innovative portfolio of high-performance products and services, we have created the largest, most active global ecosystem of 10,000+ companies, including 2,100 networks and 3,000+ cloud and IT service providers in 32 countries spanning six continents.

A career at Equinix means you will collaborate on work that impacts the world and be surrounded by endless opportunities to learn new skills and grow in varied directions. We embrace diversity in thought and contribution and are committed to providing an equitable work environment. that is foundational to our core values as a company and is vital to our success.

Job Summary

Join the IT Strategy Planning and Operations team and help us build efficient processes for the Business of IT and optimize our investments, and Vendor Management strategy. The IT Strategic Vendor Manager is responsible for driving synergies and building relationships with Global IT leaders at Equinix and their strategic vendors, specifically for software, professional services, and hardware categories. This role involves driving IT vendor operations within the entire contract lifecycle; from competitive bidding, selection and negotiation support, in collaboration with Procurement and Legal.

Responsibilities

Support Vendor Selection and Consolidation with Procurement: Manage IT Vendor Portfolio to align with the company's goals and compliance requirements. This involves tracking performance, cost-savings opportunities, and service alignment

Support Strategic Negotiations: Facilitating the contract negotiation process with procurement to establish favorable terms and conditions for IT. This may involve forecasting, service level agreements (SLAs), delivery schedules, and other contractual elements and leveraging cross-functional synergies for negotiation

Contract Lifecycle Management: Ensuring that software, professional services and hardware vendor contracts are accurately processed through our CLM tool, documented, up to date and compliant. This involves tracking contract expiration dates, renewals, and any amendments

Relationship Building: Developing and nurturing strong relationships with IT stakeholders, as well as FP&A, Procurement and Legal partners. This involves effective problem-solving and maintaining a constructive dialogue

Financial Insights for Strategic Investments: Applying financial analytics to drive optimization and cost-effective vendor strategy

Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborating with various internal departments with the same categories and/or vendors to drive cost optimization, increase negotiation leverage, and share best practices and lessons learnt. Manages stakeholder escalations, supplier QBRs (Quarterly Business Reviews) and leads collaboration with other teams to meet Service Level Objectives

Manages IT Contracts Pipeline proactively across all three categories to ensure adequate runway for innovation, market analysis, proof of concept, etc., within our contract lifecycle and our partner’s SLAs for optimal technology investment for Equinix

Own IT Vendor Operational excellence by identifying process gaps or issues through flowcharts / process maps and evaluate automation opportunities. Updates process and procedural documentation, obtains, creates and documents business requirements engaging multiple partners

Leadership Reporting: Creates dashboards and complex ad hoc reports, using insights from data exploration to build comprehensive reports with visualizations and insights

Qualifications

7+ year’s experience in related field preferred

Bachelor's degree preferred

Strong Financial Acumen

Detailed knowledge of software, hardware and professional services categories’ Vendor Management processes and strategy

Capacity to solves complex problems outside of own domain expertise and analyses root causes using multiple sources of information

Stakeholder-focused, able to collaborate and influence others to drive actions to meet business needs while maintaining a positive, professional outlook

Ability to work and interact with departments throughout the organization with minimal supervision

Ability to deal effectively with pressure, multiple tasks, deadlines, and rapidly changing priorities

Knowledge of data analysis and forecasting methods

Excellent Problem solving, analytical mind, attention to detail and investigative skills

Proficient in MS Office and databases;

Outstanding communication skills (verbal and written)

Project management skills

BS/MBA in finance, vendor/supplier management, business, or relevant field

Bring your heart to CVS Health. Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand — with heart at its center — our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver.

Our Heart At Work Behaviors™ support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable.

Summary:

As a Senior Analyst, Data Governance Operations you will play a pivotal role in driving our data governance initiatives forward. Leveraging your excellent communication skills, you will lead meaningful conversations, host trainings, and foster relationships with various teams across the organization. This role offers the chance to work closely with a diverse set of stakeholders, influencing the way data is viewed, managed, and leveraged across the organization. If you're passionate about data and its potential to drive business success, this could be the perfect role for you.

Responsibilities:
Engage with stakeholders across different functions to understand and address data-related needs and challenges.
Serve as a key point of contact for data stewards and owners across different domains, assisting with onboarding, addressing queries, and ensuring they have the resources and support needed to effectively manage their domains.
Develop and nurture relationships with various teams, positioning the data governance unit as a reliable partner in all data matters.
Assist in the development and updating of training content and materials; host and facilitate training sessions to enhance the organization's understanding and implementation of data governance practices.
Support ongoing data governance projects, ensuring timely execution and alignment with the company's strategic goals.
Assist in maintaining governance documentation, ensuring all processes, policies, and standards are up-to-date and easily accessible for internal teams.
Address data governance related issues, escalating where necessary and ensuring timely resolution.
Support the collection and reporting of data governance metrics, helping to showcase the progress and impact of governance initiatives.

Education: Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Information Systems, Business Administration) or equivalent experience.


Required qualifications:
Minimum one year of experience supporting data governance operations, data policy, data management, or a related field.

Preferred qualifications:

Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to facilitate meetings and training sessions effectively.
Knowledge of data governance best practices and principles.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Team player with the ability to work independently.
Strong interpersonal skills and a keen ability to build and nurture relationships.
Organized, detail-oriented, and able to juggle multiple priorities simultaneously.

Pay Range

The typical pay range for this role is:

$70,000.00 - $140,000.00

This pay range represents the base hourly rate or base annual full-time salary for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual base salary offer will depend on a variety of factors including experience, education, geography and other relevant factors. This position is eligible for a CVS Health bonus, commission or short-term incentive program in addition to the base pay range listed above.

Job Title: SAP Sales and Distribution Functional Analyst
Job Description:
it’s what’s inside that counts

_______________________________


There’s more to CMC than our steel products and the buildings, structures, and roads they go into. At CMC, it’s the people inside our recycling centers, fabrication plants, steel mills and offices that make us who we are as a company. Our success comes from finding, retaining, and supporting the highest quality talent by offering:

Day 1 benefits coverage with low cost medical, vision, dental
Paid-time off and vacation starting Day 1
Competitive compensation and bonuses
Company-paid Lifestyle fund, life and disability insurance
Company matching 401(k) plan
Employee stock purchase plan
Training and advancement opportunities
Why This Job

CMC provides an excellent opportunity to learn the steel industry and grow in your career. Whether you will spend your day in an office cubicle, operating a crane or running the melt shop at one of our mills, at CMC, you’ll get the training and support from your team that you need to excel in your role and reach your full potential.


Responsible for defi ning, designing, governing, delivering, and supporting SAP centric solutions that enable and enhance the CMCOrder to Cash Process. Build and maintain eff ective relationships with key business stakeholders by off ering guidance andrecommendations as needed to ensure clarity of understanding and alignment of company goals. Partner with various IT teammembers to ensure feasibility, comprehension, and successful delivery of business requirement best practice solutions. Eff ectivelycommunicate and properly manage time providing on-going SAP Sales and Logistics support, including development of business cases,business requirement and process documentation, test scenarios, and training materials. Actively multitask and collaborate within ahigh performing team that values your insight, encourages you to take on new responsibility, and promotes continuous learning.

What You'll Do
Analyze and design new business processes for Sales and Logistics business units for a multi-faceted manufacturing industry
Apply technical and functional knowledge to create world-class solution architecture that effectively integrates with the business units’ operations
Build and maintain effective relationships with key business and IT stakeholders
Understand current and future business requirements and strategies for information technology services and systems
Document business needs, distinguish between needs and wants, identify gaps between business needs and standard application functionality
Design and document solutions that fill the gaps, and provide detailed business requirements specifications for developers
Develop, document, and execute test plans to assess the integrity and accuracy of business processes, functional modifications/enhancements, etc
Maintain business process and end user training documentation and deliver training as required
Support, analyze, and resolve production application issues as required
What You'll Need
Five or more years of work experience within the SAP ECC standard Sales, Distribution, and Logistics space
Five or more years of experience as an SAP business or functional analyst
Advanced time management and analytical skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Motivated self-starter that can work effectively with minimal supervision
Ability to multitask and collaborate in a functional, technical, multidiscipline, high performing team to plan and meet aggressive deadlines
Experience with and knowledgeable of Transportation and Fleet Management
Experience with TMW, SQL, and Microsoft Applications preferred
Experience delivering projects in an agile environment preferred
Experience in the industrial manufacturing and/or process industry preferred
Strong quantitative, analytical and problem solving skills, with an ability to use appropriate analysis and logic when solving problems
Ability to maintain awareness and knowledge of relevant, existing and emerging technologies and the impact they have on CMC business operations
Results oriented with focus on achieving both short and long term goals in fluid environment
Your Education
A Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, or related discipline with an IT focus is preferred
An advanced degree is preferred

We are Commercial Metals Company, a Fortune 500 company with a family feel that’s already part of your life. Our steel products have been supporting structures in more than 20 countries for over 100 years. And the secret to our success? We’ve built our legacy by assembling a team of innovators and doers to tackle some of the most challenging problems facing our world over the last 100 years — but we’re just getting started.


If you’re ready to reimagine ways to make the steel industry more sustainable, reinforce the bridges and roadways connecting our communities, and do meaningful work, you’re ready to join CMC. Apply today and start moving your career — and our world — forward.

Description:

MISSION

Our mission is to enhance well-being by connecting individuals with vital health resources through a compassionate workforce that embodies the spirit of neighbors helping neighbors.

VALUES

HealthOne is guided by a cultural framework that embodies our values and drives our decisions.

Our PURPOSE is to care for people by connecting them to resources that help protect them in health related situations. To fulfill our purpose, we align our PRIORITIES to ensure each decision we make is ethical, empathetic, economical, and efficient. We care for PEOPLE by being welcoming, authentic, truthful, consistent and humble. We are continuously looking for ways to improve our PROCESS and how we get things done.

HealthOne seeks individuals with integrity and heart to embody our values. Whether you’re starting your career or looking to develop additional skills to reach your full potential, HealthOne provides the means to help you achieve your goals.

JOB PURPOSE

The IT Business Analyst will be a vital link between our information technology capacity and our business objectives by supporting and ensuring the successful completion of analytical, building, testing and deployment tasks of our software product’s features. The IT Business Analyst reviews, analyzes, and evaluates user needs to create systems solutions that support overall business strategies. The incumbent also documents system requirements, defines scope and objectives, and assists in the creation of system specifications that drive system development and implementation. This position is a liaison between IT and users and have both business and technical expertise.

Requirements:

ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES

Understands business requirements and produces requirement specification documents
Creates application design documents
Understands and follows the company’s software development life cycle process
Reports on common sources of technical issues or questions and makes recommendations to product team
Works closely with project team to maintain a continuous knowledge of project status in order to identify potential issues and/or opportunities
Ensures client issues are dealt with in an efficient manner, informing all parties of any outstanding issues or problems
Communicates client's goals and represents client's interests to the team
Continuously finds ways to improve monitoring, discover issues and deliver better value to the customer
Performs quality assurance
Defines reporting and alerting requirements
Owns and develops relationships with partners, working with them to optimize and enhance our solutions
Works closely with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locates and defines new process improvement opportunities
Maintains documentation in CRM tool
Regular and predictable attendance
Consistently demonstrates compliance with HIPAA regulations, professional conduct, and ethical practice
Works to encourage and promote Company culture throughout the organization
Other duties as may be assigned

QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college in related field or commensurate work experience
Previous experience in Business/Systems Analysis or Quality Assurance
Proven experience in eliciting requirements and testing
Ability to work under pressure and meet project deliver dates
Experience in analyzing data to draw business-related conclusions and in data visualization techniques and tools
Basic knowledge in writing SQL queries
Solid experience in generating process and screen design documentation
Strong written and verbal communication skills including technical writing skills
Strong knowledge of and experience with Microsoft Word and Excel

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer. Moderate to significant amount of stress in meeting deadlines and dealing with day-to-day responsibilities. Must be able to drive a vehicle and daytime/overnight travel as required.

BENEFITS

401K (4% Match, Immediate Vesting)

Accident insurance

Competitive salary

Critical Illness Insurance

Dental Insurance

Employee Assistance Program

Flexible Spending Account

Health & Wellness Program

Health Savings Account

Life & AD&D Insurance

Long Term Disability

Medical Insurance

Paid Time Off

Pet Insurance

Short Term Disability

Vision Insurance

PRE-EMPLOYMENT SCREENING

Drug Screen and Background Check Required

Overview:

The primary focus of this role would be to support Team Lead and Sr. Manager in all activities related to device deployments and operations of the Deployment and Repair Centers in US and Canada. This is an analyst role that is dual in nature. It consists of responsibilities related to site operations that are physical in nature as well as responsibilities related to Life Cycle Management projects, processes and support.




The Analyst would support all Life Cycle Processes related to assets (existing and new) in purview of the Mobility and End User Devices Group. This includes but is not limited to iOS devices, rugged devices, mobile printers, laptops and desktops, warehouse scanners and other assets. The analyst would be accountable to assist driving successful delivery from MSP Contractors and other stakeholders related to device repair, business as usual device request and project deployments. They would need to maintain site operations while also being a key deployment project, inventory and device management contributor.


The role would support their Team Lead and Sr, Manager by participating in and driving seamless device deployments, tracking all cost, working with all stakeholders to handle project and site billing, cost and cross charges. The role would also be responsible for development and updating project files and trackers using Excel and other project management and metric capturing tools. This Analyst would work with additional departments and vendors included but not limited to Facilities, disposal partners, repair vendors, third party vendors, accessory and supply vendors, Telecom Expense Management Team, Finance, business stakeholders, IT and other functional partners.




The selected candidate would be required to be on-site mainly at the Carrollton Deployment & Repair Center (CDRC) at 2853 Eisenhower St. Ste. 200 Carrollton, TX 75007 but will also be required to periodically work at Plano HQ.




We are expecting eleven major projects in 2024 in addition to baseline responsibilities. These projects are steady and will continue yearly. This Analyst would be key support in enduring success.



Responsibilities:
Own end to end operations and support of Carrollton and Canada Deployment and repair facilities
Drive deployment work intake, prioritization and release timing; balancing demand and available resources
Ensure adherence to Finance, Procurement, Legal and other functional rules and guidance related to life cycle management
Work with vendors and partners driving repair, operations and continuous improvement
Support delivery of SOW and Contracts
Support development and delivery of continuously improving KPIs, Metrics, other reporting
Key project stakeholder and contributor working with business partners and other functional stakeholders
Support and drive “warehouse activities” including but not limited to site upkeep, repairs, and proper inventory and operations processes
Maintain stellar, positive and collaborative work environment
Leverage onshore and offshore resources for efforts related to repair and Mobile Device Life Cycle Management
Qualifications:
1-2 Years Project Delivery
1-2 Years in Asset Life Cycle Support
1-2 Working with physical (warehouse) as well as project/business related deliverables
Non Tech Skills
Proven track record working with multiple internal and external stakeholders
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Collaboration and listening skills.
Ability to lead and drive discussions managing upward
Ability to manage highly visible competing priorities
Competencies
Key project contributor
Exceptional MS Office Skills a must!
Excel Pivot Tables, VLOOKUPS, Basic Graphs

Job Title: Solution Owner (Irving, TX or Tampa, FL)
Job Description:
SEIZE THE OPPORTUNITY TO BE A PART OF SOMETHING GREAT!

Presidio is on the leading edge of a technology-driven movement to transform the way business is done, for our customers and our customers' customers. Joining Presidio means immersing yourself in a culture of self-starters, collaborators and innovators who make real, lasting change in the marketplace via cutting-edge technology and business solutions. At Presidio, we know that it’s our people that make the connections happen.

WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN US? You will set your career on track for outstanding achievement with a company that knows no limits. Presidio is a leading a global digital services and solutions provider focused on Digital Infrastructure, Business Analytics, Cloud, Security & Emerging solutions.

THE ROLE: Solution Owner

Presidio is looking for a seasoned Solution Owner with experience working directly with customers and stakeholders to understand, document and manage requirements relating to technical development projects. Presidio Solution Owners work directly with the project team, clients, and partners to lead the requirements gathering and management process plus ensure the client requests are translated into technical requirements the development team can deliver against. This is a customer-centered and product-centered role, ultimately owning the results of the product delivery.

Job Summary:

As a Solution Owner, you will play a key leadership role within a product delivery team, as the main contact to the customer to understand their business needs and goals for the product. You will collaborate with the customer and work closely with the delivery team to ensure the delivered product meets the desired customer outcome.

Travel Requirements:

In this role you will be expected to travel up to 25%. This role will be a remote work situation.

Job Responsibilities:

Conduct interviews to gather customer requirements via workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods as appropriate given customer and project factors
Take information gathered from interviews and other methods and translate into technical requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to developers/project team, creating Epics and Stories
Manage requirements and associated expectations of project stakeholders (to include internal, partner and customer sponsors and stakeholders)
Identify and establish scope and parameters for a project based on requirements analysis to define project impact, outcome criteria, and metrics
Work with stakeholders and project team to prioritize collected requirements
Lead and provide guidance to the entire project team as needed regarding the developed application to ensure features and functions are enabled to meet customer requirements
Lead and guide team to execute on shared vision, outlining a plan for achieving success
Analyze and verify requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards
Develop and conduct peer reviews of the requirements to ensure that documented requirements are correctly interpreted, with team and business stakeholders
Assist with the interpretation of customer requirements into feasible options, and communicate these back to the business stakeholders
Manage and track the status of requirements throughout the project lifecycle; enforce and redefine as necessary
Communicate changes, enhancements, and modifications of business requirements — verbally or through written documentation — to project managers, customers, and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood. When needed, solicit approval by the customer or stakeholder on affected requirements
Partners with stakeholders and customers across the organization to carry forward and communicate the product vision, strategy, features, and prioritization
Develops, owns, and executes product roadmap
Translates product roadmap features into well-defined product requirements including epics, user stories, features, and acceptance criteria
Prioritize and maintain the Sprint backlog for assigned products, balancing the requirements of customers and stakeholders
Lead the planning of product release plans and set the expectation for delivery of new functionality
Provide an active role in mitigating impediments impacting successful team completion of Release/Sprint Goals
Perform research to understand the latest changes in the market and the business and determine potential impact on current strategy and requirements, sharing any pertinent findings with the customer
Quickly assimilate into the client team, project team and culture, becoming a valuable contributor

Required Skills:

Excellent client-facing communication skills both written and oral, along with strong listening, interpersonal and relationship-building skills
Proven experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification, and methodology development
Demonstrable skills across project development methodologies (Agile, SCRUM, Kanban, Waterfall)
Proficient in Confluence, Jira or other similar tools
Experience with Cloud / Azure / Microsoft O365 suite of tools
Outstanding overall communication, presentation, and leadership skills with the ability to engage, influence, and inspire partners and stakeholders to drive collaboration and alignment
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Sharp analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills with keen attention to detail
Creative thinker with a vision

Additional Desired Skills:

Strong thought leadership, team building, motivational and customer service skills
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks while under pressure
Highly self-motivated and directed, a self-starter
Put people before technology. Ask great questions. Always think ahead. Turn data into useful information. Passion to deliver results and exceed expectations
Ability to learn quickly, adapt to change and have ownership of learning new tools as applicable to help in the requirements gathering, refinement and management process
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment
Works as a team player, willing to perform other tasks as needed to help the team, even if not part of their defined role and responsibilities
Passion, creativity, energy, and enthusiasm towards collaborating on the exciting growth and development of our customers and our company
A desire to learn new technologies, methodologies, solutions and understand the business objectives and needs of our customers
Adaptability to our overall vision, goals and dynamic culture and environment.
Elicit, analyze, specify, document, and validate the business needs and requirements of stakeholders, be they customers or end users

Education and Experience:

BA in Computer Science, Engineering, or similar relevant field
A minimum of 5-8 years of experience in a Solution Owner or Product Owner role, technology Project Manager, Program Manager, Senior Business Analyst or related work experience

*****

Presidio is committed to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at the highest levels and has strengthened its drive to build and drive systemic DEI change process across all levels of the organization. Cultivating a culture of inclusion where the expression of all our differences are valued, celebrated, and add to our collective achievements.

Presidio is a global digital services and solutions provider accelerating business transformation through secured technology modernization. Highly skilled teams of engineers and solutions architects with deep expertise across cloud, security, networking and modern data center infrastructure help customers acquire, deploy and operate technology that delivers impactful business outcomes. Presidio is a trusted strategic advisor with a flexible full life cycle model of professional, managed, and support and staffing services to help execute, secure, operationalize and maintain technology solutions. We serve as an extension of our clients' IT teams, providing deep expertise and letting them focus on their core business. Presidio operates in 40+ US offices and offices in Ireland, London, Singapore, and India.

At Moss Adams, we champion authenticity. For us, that means fostering a culture of talented people who care—about you, about our clients, and about our communities. Here, you’ll work towards our mission of empowering others to embrace opportunity, growing as a leader along the way. Our firm’s size, middle-market clients, customized career paths, and supportive culture make this a reality. Join a values-driven firm where you’ll have fun while solving complex and interesting business challenges.

Introduction to the team

The Senior Business Analyst brings best practices and strong analytical expertise to projects and product work to elicit business needs from the customer to help determine solutions to complex business problems. They can tackle projects and product work across multiple domains and handle new business domains with confidence. They are responsible for the development and management of business and technical requirements. They will assist with product assessments, business process documentation and analysis, testing, training, and communication. The senior business analyst resides in the IT Business Product Group and acts as a liaison between IT and various teams across the firm.

Individuals who thrive at Moss Adams exhibit the following success skills – Collaboration, Critical Thinking, Emotional Intelligence, Executive Presence, Growth Mindset, Intellectual Curiosity, and Results Focus.


Responsibilities:
Utilize strong analytical and product management skills, including a thorough understanding of how to interpret customer business needs and translate them into business and technical requirements
Critically evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconcile conflicts, decompose high-level information into details, abstract up from low-level information to a general understanding
Serve as the conduit between the customer community (including internal and external customers), users, business teams, and technical teams to establish the business and technical vision; analyze and document tradeoffs between complexity, usability and performance needs
Assist with testing by owning the User Acceptance Testing process (UAT) and contributing to the testing phase of a project by supporting the Quality Assurance (QA) team for various testing activities
Assist with training and communication activities such as developing and delivering end user documentation, quick guides, training plans, training materials, and communication media; serve as a liaison between Corporate Communications, Learning and Development, and project teams


Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required
Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience required; experience within IT organizations with exposure to the full system implementation life cycle preferred; experience in a professional services environment preferred
Must be legally authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis upon hire. Moss Adams will not consider candidates for this position who require sponsorship for employment visa status now or in the future (e.g., H-1B status)
Experience leading requirements identification and prioritization efforts for mid-large scale business or technology projects
Demonstrated ability to collect and interpret business data and assess for trends, patterns and correlations
Experience in system design, functional specification development, and test requirement documentation
Experience with developing training plans and conducting training
Proven ability to effectively manage time, prioritize work, multi-task across many assignments, and create deliverables with little direction
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (MS Project, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Visio); familiarity with OneNote and SharePoint required; familiarity with a requirement management system preferred
Strong verbal and written communication skills including the ability to articulate complex issues to others at all levels of the organization; the ability to interact professionally with a multi-disciplinary groups
Ability to travel as needed, approximately 5%

Compensation Range: Compensation range for California: $105,000 - $144,000 Compensation range for Colorado: $98,000 - $120,000 Compensation range for Washington: 98,000 - $126,000 Compensation range for Remote: $$98,000 - $120,000

Who We Are

Verily is a subsidiary of Alphabet that is using a data-driven approach to change the way people manage their health and the way healthcare is delivered. Launched from Google X in 2015, our purpose is to bring the promise of precision health to everyone, every day. We are focused on generating and activating data from a variety of sources, including clinical, social, behavioral and the real world, to arrive at the best solutions for a person based on a comprehensive view of the evidence. Our unique expertise and capabilities in technology, data science and healthcare enable the entire healthcare ecosystem to drive better health outcomes.

Description

As a Senior IT Business Analyst, you will partner with engineering resources and Verily internal business clients to design, develop, and maintain Verily's broad range of systems and tools. You will manage the customer side of complex, multi-disciplinary engineering projects using your excellent collaboration and communication skills. You will develop a deep understanding of the business requirements and priorities with Verily stakeholders and act as their advocate through the entire IT project lifecycle, assuring our technology projects are optimally aligned to those business needs. This includes helping clients define their needs, gathering/documenting requirements and user stories, providing technical advisory and consulting, identifying risks and clearly communicating them to project stakeholders, designing and implementing new processes, and supporting clients through Verily-facing & internally-facing rollouts. You will help strategically prioritize technical needs into a comprehensive project pipeline.

You need to be equally comfortable describing analyses and recommendations to customers and executives as you are discussing the technical trade-offs in product development with engineers. You have a passion for excellent customer service and thrive in a fast-paced, change-oriented business environment that requires collaboration with a global team. You must be an independent worker with the ability to understand multiple business lines and systems down to small details while still keeping the big picture in focus.

With your technical expertise, you build and integrate business applications and influence the design of features that improve the reliability of our applications and systems. You also define the scope of technical projects and manage execution. You work closely with technical teams to implement scalable, reusable solutions.

Responsibilities
Partner with business group(s) to understand and anticipate in-depth business requirements, priorities, and processes; be an advocate in conversations with technical partners and negotiate best outcomes balancing both specific business needs and broader organizational priorities.
Partner with internal and external technology and business teams to translate business needs into technical terms, including business cases, business requirements, functional requirements, user journeys, and business process flow charts.
Work with engineering team to maintain and coordinate communication with business stakeholders throughout each project.
Support testing cycles (UAT, regression, system) and/or Training/Training Materials.
Think holistically and work cross-functionally to design and improve processes and tools, work with both highly technical and non-technical disciplines to ensure that program inputs and requirements are translated to achieve the desired results.
Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in business or technology, or equivalent practical experience.
10 years of experience in business analysis, technology development, or a related field.
Experience in Salesforce (SFDC) CRM (Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Service Cloud voice and Marketing Cloud) with end to end implementation experience.

Preferred Qualifications:

Familiarity with Agile or other development methodologies and experience in operating as part of a product/project team.
Working knowledge of database and system architecture concepts & functionality.
Excellent interpersonal skills, with a track record of building meaningful relationships and cross-functional connections.
Experience with Quote to cash and Contact to service business processes is a plus.
Experience with healthcare & life sciences, human resources, compliance & legal, supply chain, or manufacturing is a plus.
Knowledge of GDPR, HIPAA and related regulations would be a plus.

The Publisher Technical Operations (PTO) Analyst Job requires individuals with exceptional analytical focus, attention to detail, and technical curiosity. This role is key to the continued successful integration between LocaliQ’s proprietary platform and well-established internet ad networks. PTO Analysts are expected to work effectively in a group setting and are measured on both the performance of the team and their impact within the team. PTO Analysts must be flexible and be able to multitask across a large scope of duties and activities:

Manage, document, troubleshoot, and resolve issues related to advertising efforts between LocaliQ platforms and the publishers with which LocaliQ partners
Identification and communication of publisher and platform issues to the sales and campaign services groups
Publisher policy, process, and procedure expert with heavy focus in all publisher verifications and certifications to ensure minimal revenue impact
Assessing and documenting publisher editorial requirements to prevent and resolve editorial issues directly or by communicating the proper editorial standards to the advertiser and/or sales and campaign professional teams
Daily Monitoring and analysis of platform and publisher performance to determine trends, opportunities, and problems
Analyze changing guidelines and API messages to maintain internal consistency with publisher requirements
Communicate directly with Google, Bing, Yahoo, and other publishers when an error on their part is found, or when day to day operations deem it necessary
Create reports that drive needed changes in the product and engineering org
Participate in semiweekly trainings that grow knowledge of web publishers as well as more in depth looks into database structure, software tools, etc
Key Skills

Proficient use of Microsoft Office applications including Microsoft Excel and Word
Basic understanding of web technologies (html, css, js) recommended
Some MySQL experience recommended
Minimum 2 years of experience working in major internet advertising publisher platforms including, but not limited to, Google Ads and Microsoft Ads
Minimum 2 years of experience with LocaliQ’s proprietary “Admin” platforms for better job assimilation
Quickly and accurately scope work to determine cost benefit
Competencies

Advanced Problem Solving
The ability to not only resolve the symptoms of an issue, but to identify the source of the issue (root cause analysis) and prevent future incidents
Applying knowledge about current standards, policies, and processes to resolve new issues that arise as a result of new & current publisher relationships.

Priority setting
Able to quickly identify those issues whose resolution will have the maximum positive impact on the advertising effort for our advertisers.
Use available evidence and applied knowledge to identify patterns in issues that may point to a larger issues whose resolution would improve overall campaign performance.
The ability to monitor budgets, understand return-on-investment (ROI) as a decision making tool, and select and analyze relevant data to determine and prioritize resolution.

Technical learning
Can learn new skills and knowledge quickly
Good understanding of technical tools used, like ticketing systems, CRM software, and survey methods.

Problem solving
Spots hidden problems and possesses effective analytical skills
Looks beyond symptoms –works to determine root/cause of problem
Uses applied knowledge, available evidence, logical means and processes to investigate and resolve problems with a high degree of accuracy

Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree
3+ years of experience in Marketing, Advertising, Public Relations, Customer Service or related field
Minimum of 24 months with LocaliQ

Job Title: Senior Associate, Cyber Security Operations Center (CSOC) Fusion Analyst
Job Description:
Center 3 (19075), United States of America, McLean, Virginia

Senior Associate, Cyber Security Operations Center (CSOC) Fusion Analyst

The Cyber Security Operation Center Fusion team synthesizes multi-source security alerting, intrusion investigations, cyber intelligence, and business information into actionable analysis. The Fusion team provides this time-sensitive analysis to empower fellow CSOC operators defending the network and to empower leadership to make informed decisions confronting cyber threats. The associate in this role acts as a Cyber Security Operation Center aggregator, collecting and compiling internal information to communicate “So what does this mean to Capital One?” They accomplish this by proactively identifying threats to Capital One, supporting CSOC operations with contextualized tactical intelligence, driving cross-team initiatives to improve detection and security, conducting internal threat landscape analysis, and finding innovative new ways to automate analysis. The associate in this role will also mentor and train associates to execute fusion analysis responsibilities.

General Responsibilities:

Support day-to-day cybersecurity threat detection and incident response operations through indicator pivoting, campaign analysis, and tactical intelligence

Identify and enhance processes where automation has the potential to improve efficiencies, provide actionable data, and facilitate collaboration across CSOC

Leverage Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) or Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools to identify threat patterns, enrich investigations, and build automation-supported workflows

Deconstruct multi-source reporting into actionable intelligence including Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures TTPs data objects, campaign analysis, and threat patterns.

Regularly analyze malware reports to track adversary behaviors and support the construction of a TTP repository

Develop expertise on the Capital One threat landscape using internal data, threat trends, and operational metrics to clearly communicate the Capital One threat landscape to senior executives, to include the Chief Information Security Officer and Chief Information Officer.

Proactively build and maintain relationships with partner teams, including but not limited to Cyber Intelligence, Red Team, Insider Threat, and Hunt teams.

Conduct time-sensitive analysis during cyber investigations, including active threat hunting, malware analysis, and campaign enrichment

Routinely identify gaps in detection and collaborate with teams across the Cyber organization to mitigate risk, including blocking of malicious indicators, tuning vendor signatures, and instrumenting custom detection rules

Support the tactical intelligence-to-detection pipeline, to include malware reverse engineering, TTP analysis, and association mapping in a TIP (threat intelligence platform) for future pivoting

Attend conferences and briefings to stay current on threats against both COF and the Financial Services sector

Mentor other CSOC analysts in project execution and tactical upskilling; conduct brown bag lunches to teach specialized skill sets

Basic Qualifications:

High School Diploma, GED or Equivalent Certification

At least 2 years of experience in cyber security or information technology

At least 2 years of experience working in a Security Operations Center (SOC)

At least 1 year of experience analyzing and tracking Advanced Persistent Threats (APT) groups

Preferred Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree

3+ years of experience in a cloud environment (Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform or Microsoft Azure)

3+ years of experience conducting fusion intelligence analysis

3+ years of experience in written and verbal briefings

3+ years of experience with cyber threat intelligence analysis and tactical analysts

3+ years of experience with curating Threat Intelligence Platforms (TIPs) and integration with Security Orchestration, Automation, and Response (SOAR) or Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) tools

3+ years of experience utilizing the MITRE ATT&CK framework, Diamond Model, or Cyber Kill Chain

3+ year of malware analysis (static or dynamic) and Tactics, Techniques, and Procedures (TTP) analysis

The Operational Risk Officer is a strategic professional who stays abreast of developments within own field and contributes to directional strategy by considering their application in own job and the business. Recognized technical authority for an area within the business. Requires basic commercial awareness. There are typically multiple people within the business that provide the same level of subject matter expertise. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers. Significant impact on the area through complex deliverables. Provides advice and counsel related to the technology or operations of the business. Work impacts an entire area, which eventually affects the overall performance and effectiveness of the sub-function/job family.


Responsibilities:

Establishes and oversees the application of operational risk policies, technology and tools, and governance processes to create lasting solutions for minimizing losses from failed internal processes, inadequate controls, and emerging risks.
Independently assess’ risks and drive actions to address the root causes that persistently lead to operational risk losses by challenging both historical and proposed practices
Define and manage Operational Risk Management Products, liaise with stakeholders and technology partners
Responsible for oversight and execution of critical ORM Initiatives as a Program/Project manager, with required SME input
Define and manage Operational Risk Data Strategy including but not limited to performing data analysis to derive insights that can be used for effective identification and management of Operational Risk
Develop and maintain strong relationships with senior stakeholders across multiple organizations (internal and external)
Define Scope, Strategy and Success criteria for Operational Risk Transformation Programs
Identify risks, issues and critical interdependencies across programs/initiatives
Define requirements and manage Book of Work execution for Operational Risk Applications in the capacity of Product Owner
Manage adherence with all Citi Internal Processes including but not limited to creating and managing documentation that can evidence adherence
Provide Execution and Oversight support for Transformation Programs including effective Independent Challenge
Manage all program/project execution artifacts required for Business Completion and IA Validation of regulatory milestones and deliverables
Governance and oversight may include (not limited to) technology operational risk, risk for example.
Execution ownership of ORM assigned Consent Order RBCM (Regulatory Business Milestones)
Ownership, Execution, Delivery or ORM owned Programs/ Projects
Resolves transactional level escalations coming from the vendor or internal partners
Analyzes a multitude of scorecards/performance management tools in an attempt to mitigate exposure (risk/financial/regulatory)
Monitors goals are met through performance, risk and relationship oversight of our extended supply chain
Collaborates to resolve any issues which fall within the terms of the contract.
Develops and maintains relationships across the business users and Lines of Defense to better understand and deliver customer requirements by responding to changes in the internal and external business environment
Has the ability to operate with a limited level of direct supervision.
Can exercise independence of judgement and autonomy.
Acts as SME to senior stakeholders and /or other team members.
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

Qualifications:

6-10 years experience in product program governance and risk management framework.
Skills in risk management, business analysis, data, analytics, databases, data quality are desired; experience in database tools, Tableau, Power BI, visualization is preferred
Strong team player with excellent work ethics, attention to details and accuracy
Quick learner with strong communication, organizational & interpersonal skills with the ability to work with counterparts in various areas in the organization.
Should have Excellent proficiency in Microsoft Office – particularly Excel (metrics and data analysis), PowerPoint (presentation decks), and Word (writing and editing procedural and technical documentation).
Good understanding of Risk Management and Operational Risk Management with some basic understanding of Financial Models
Knowledge of Data Governance and Strategy a plus

Bachelor’s/University degree required, Master’s degree preferred

Analyst II, Business Systems (226 Days) -(RTP20230908-002)
Description
Perform application testing for internal and external stakeholders. Regularly analyze data and provide solutions based on business need and requirements.
Collaborate with business users to understand and design solutions based on their business processes and requirements.
Configure, test, and deploy changes and enhancements to existing production applications and dashboards.
Work with business users to understand business reporting needs, gather and document requirements and functional specifications.
Analyze and perform tests (work with development team) on all software development life cycle for Oracle and Salesforce applications according to business requirements and prepare solutions to provide end user support.
Maintain and update knowledge articles on Oracle/Salesforce applications, installations and perform tests on all new releases and patches and assist in recovery of validation processes.
Develop and maintain professional relationships with all managers and end users and provide support to all IT functions on rotational basis to resolve complex production issues.
Maintain documentation for change control management and prepare records for software development cycle and prepare solutions for all enhancements.
Perform gap analysis to determine E-Business suite system configuration and development changes.
Perform research and evaluate all functions to develop efficient processes and ensure compliance to all standards.
Build use case requirements for data, data quality management, business data glossary management.
Collaborate with developers and project team to ensure optimal transition of user requirements into functional ones.
Design prototypes and prepare reports for all findings and prepare various models and diagrams with solution options.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university in Business or Computer Science, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Minimum 3-5 years' directly related experience.
Experience working with Oracle Apex and Salesforce Lightning platforms, and data visualization tools experience (Power BI, Tableau).
Experience prioritizing competing demands, scoping large efforts, and negotiating timelines are necessary skills.
Experience in engaging Oracle and Salesforce Support to research and resolve issues, in addition to low-level ad-hoc query tools (SQLPlus) and a working knowledge of PL-SQL and SOQL queries.
Experience analyzing data and translating business requirements into technical specifications.
Experience with data modeling tools.
Root cause analysis and complex problem-solving skills are important.
Functional knowledge of Oracle database environment and the underlying Oracle tables, integration points and business processes are critical for success in this role.
Strong knowledge and working experience of data governance concepts and frameworks.
Knowledge of data protection and data encryption techniques.
Knowledge of data archival and data retention policies.
General knowledge of security principles.

Company Overview
Fanatics is building a leading global digital sports platform. The company ignites the passions of global sports fans and maximizes the presence and reach for hundreds of sports partners globally by offering innovative products and services across Fanatics Commerce, Fanatics Collectibles, and Fanatics Betting & Gaming, allowing sports fans to Buy, Collect and Bet. Through the Fanatics platform, sports fans can buy licensed fan gear, jerseys, lifestyle and streetwear products, headwear, and hardgoods; collect physical and digital trading cards, sports memorabilia, and other digital assets; and bet as the company builds its Sportsbook and iGaming platform. Fanatics has an established database of over 100 million global sports fans, a global partner network with over 900 sports properties, including major national and international professional sports leagues, teams, players associations, athletes, celebrities, colleges, and college conferences, and over 2,000 retail locations, including its Lids retail business stores.
As a market leader with more than 18,000 employees, and hundreds of partners, suppliers, and vendors worldwide, we take responsibility for driving toward more ethical and sustainable practices. We are committed to building an inclusive Fanatics community, reflecting and representing society at every level of the business, including our employees, vendors, partners and fans. Fanatics is also dedicated to making a positive impact in the communities where we all live, work, and play through strategic philanthropic initiatives.

We are looking for is looking for a Data Analyst to help evaluate our company’s manufacturing processes, identify opportunities for improvement, and develop and implement new projects to improve organizational efficiency, performance, and output. The Analyst will join the newly formed Manufacturing Ops team. The ideal candidate is a self-starter with top-notch analytical skills, a demonstrated propensity for solving difficult problems, experience driving end-to-end transformational change, and a clear team-first mindset. Candidates with a passion for sports, culture, & entertainment will find themselves a strong cultural fit.
Within the first 6 moths, you will:
Structure solutions to operational challenges by documenting processes, defining new KPIs and metrics, and creating data workflows
Help define the long-term data and analytics requirements and capabilities with the Manufacturing team
Collaborate with cross functional teams to understand business processes and use that business insight to brainstorm and identify reporting and process improvement needs
Collate & summarize business reports and create presentations to effectively communicate with a variety of audiences (peers, Ops leadership, external partners)
The ideal candidate:
2+ years of experience in strategy and/or data analytics
Bachelor’s degree in finance, business, computer science, mathematics or similar preferred
Strong experience in drilling into large datasets, utilizing Excel and BI tools (Power BI, Alteryx)
Comfortable working cross-functionally to brainstorm, collaborate, and influence decisions
Strong interpersonal and communication skills (written/oral) with proven ability to succeed in a team environment and work collaboratively with internal/external stakeholders
Strong attention to detail, and the ability manage multiple priorities and communicate status
Experience with SQL, querying languages, and coding are a plus

Job title: Serialization Lead Business Analyst

Current Need

We are searching for a DSCSA Serialization Lead Business Analyst in Irving, TX to join the team.

Position Description

McKesson SAP Distribution Center Technologies - ATTP Center of Expertise team is leading the Technology Implementation of the Drug Supply Chain Security Act (DSCSA) across all the Business Units in the US. We are looking for a Serialization Lead Business Analyst to be part of our team. This is a Techno-functional role that will have responsibility to lead the implementation, support and evolution of Technology solutions of DSCSA implementation guidelines for McKesson Business Units. This role will work both with our different stakeholders as well as on the technical aspects of DSCSA implementation guidelines and impact to our core Serialization System (ATTP) and WMS/ ERP/Analytics and Customer Facing applications. Configure ATTP software and participate in on-boarding initiatives with suppliers and customers.

This position reports to the Senior Director of SAP Distribution Center Technologies.

Key Responsibilities:

Leads the implementation of DSCSA regulations for McKesson Business Units.
This role is considered the technological DSCSA expert for one of the McKesson Business Units
Drives alignment on key project activities, metrics as well as roadmap for each BU
Works with Development and support teams to address Business Unit needs
Gathers and translates requirements from DSCSA guidelines and our DSCA implementation team to define, design and develop solutions for our ATTP Team that meet business requirements.
Collaborates and supports WMS / ERP / Analytics and Customer Facing application teams in the adoption of new DSCSA regulations.
Design, configure and maintain programs related to SAP ATTP
Collaborates with suppliers and Customers for specific BU to drive adoption of DSCSA regulation
Participates on industry's technical forums related to DSCSA Implementation
Documents, Recommends, and Presents systems enhancements and alternatives to meet business requirements.
Drives continuous improvement activities for this area: Leads Root Cause Analysis of major incidents, provides solutions that will increase systems availability and customer satisfaction.
Be part of an on-call rotation schedule for after-hours escalations from support teams.
Works on Agile/Waterfall methodologies to Configure solutions in the space like SAP and related technologies as well as to test development/customizations in this area.

Minimum Requirements Typically requires 7+ years of relevant experience

Critical Skills

Working Experience with DSCSA Serialization solutions (SAP ATTP) including configuration of those solutions
Understanding of GS1 (EPCIS) Standards as well as master data requirements for serialization
Implementation of DSCSA regulations
Functional background in Logistics and WMS Processes
Communication to multiple levels of the organization
Ability to work with both Business Users as well as technical aspects including understanding of programming code.
The ideal candidate is a self-starter
Understands processes and procedures associated with enterprise applications.

Preferred Skills

Experience with SAP HANA Studio, ABAP, and SAP ECC
Understanding of Distribution Center operations
Experience working in an Agile / SAFe Lean environment using Jira preferred

Education: Degree or equivalent experience

Physical Requirements : General Office Demands

Job Title: Manager of Business Intelligence and Data Analytics
Job Description:
Make an Impact as the Manager of Business Intelligence and Data Analytics

As the Manager of Business Intelligence and Data Analytics, you will be responsible for overseeing the development, management, and operation of Business Intelligence platforms, including the build of data collection capabilities, communication automations, and data visualizations. You will work closely with ChildCareGroup management to identify, recommend, develop, implement, and support analytics solutions to satisfy needs for ChildCareGroup and will assist in developing and implementing Business Intelligence and Data Analytics policy-procedure.


Why work for ChildCareGroup?

Founded in 1901, ChildCareGroup’s (CCG) mission is to champion a strong early childhood system that teaches children and parents, trains early childhood professionals, and assists families. ChildCareGroup believes that children do better as their parents do better. When families thrive, communities succeed.

ChildCareGroup offers a generous benefits package including Paid Parental Leave, (12) Company Holidays, 401(k) match, Paid Time Off, Medical, Dental, Vision and more!


Responsibilities and Essential Job Functions


Supervise Business Intelligence Engineer.
Work closely with the CFO to develop business intelligence and data analytics priorities and build/deployment timelines.
Lead collaboration with leadership and teams across the organization, identifying opportunities for process digitization, communication automation, and data analysis.
Lead digitization and automation initiatives through the development of process mapping and detailed written documentation of all designs and automations.
Oversee and execute the design, build, testing and management of data collection, business intelligence, and communication automation solutions.
Oversee and execute the design, build, and management of compelling reports and dashboards in Tableau, Smartsheet, ERP, and CRM platforms for internal and external deployment.
Provide end-user trainings on use of business intelligence tools.
Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

Education and Experience


Bachelor’s Degree with 5 years’ experience in platform development, implementation, automations, data visualization, and data analysis; + supervisory experience.
Experience building advanced-level Smartsheets with automations and dashboards .
Experience building advanced-level Tableau visualizations.
Experience with CRM implementation.
Outstanding computer skills with high level expertise in CRM and Microsoft applications.
High level of attention to detail and ability to meet tight deadlines.
Excellent verbal and written communication, problem solving, and analytical skills.
Ability to work well with people.
Prompt and regular attendance required.

Travel and Compliance


Must have a valid driver's license if applicable
Driving record must comply with CCG's automobile insurance carrier requirements
Must have liability insurance coverage and reliable transportation
Ability to travel locally or out of town as required
Mileage reimbursement is offered when applicable
Must successfully meet all compliance background check requirements for federal funding throughout employment. These include credit, FBI fingerprinting, child abuse and neglect, federal, state, local, and sex offender background checks. Background check requirements may be expanded at the discretion of ChildCareGroup and Partner Programs.

Physical Demands


Normal physical effort with minimal lifting requirements of less than 50 pounds
Visual attention
Manual dexterity/coordination


ChildCareGroup's Generous Health and Wellness Benefits

Paid Parental Leave
Short-Term, Long-Term Disability and Basic Life Insurance at no cost
Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
Telemedicine at no cost
401(k) with a company match
Paid Time Off
12 Paid Company Holidays
And more!


Become a part of the team that supports the education and assistance of over 50,000 lives per year in Texas!


ChildCareGroup is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer.

The SAP FICO Analyst will directly support the IT related needs of the Finance and Accounting processes. The successful candidate will have experience in assistance with SAP business processes design, configuration, and testing within the context of both project and production support efforts. The resource will be responsible to support, investigate, and analyze enhancements to SAP modules – Finance and Controlling. Troubleshoot system issues, interfaces, and develop new systems capabilities, while supporting integration between SAP ERP and other systems. Should be a team player with excellent organizational and communication skills. Requires the ability to plan, design, configure, and troubleshoot issues. The role requires a high level of cross-functional communication and coordination amongst different groups supporting other SAP modules, and all departments and levels of management. The candidate must be detail oriented with adherence to company processes and procedures.

Requirements:
At least 5 + years of experience in SAP FICO Module including 1-2 full life cycle project implementations for these modules
Solid understanding of FICO modules - AP, AR, GL, Fixed Assets; Controlling – Cost Center Accounting, Profit Center Accounting, Profitability Analysis, Month End Processes
Design, customize, configure and testing of FI/CO modules. Understanding of Integration between SD and MM with FI.
Configure and Enhance SAP FICO Configurations & standard functionalities with a proven track record in architecting solutions in an integrated environment in SAP ECC 6.0
Should have experience with configurations, testing, developing functional specifications for developers
Bring in best practices in architecting, designing & supporting FICO Sub modules and other integrated processes
Perform detailed analysis of complex business process requirements and provide appropriate system solutions; identify, interpret, validate and document customer requirements
Develop functional specifications, solution designs, test plans, review technical specs in collaboration with customers, developers and technical architects.
Monitor and resolve production issues and requests submitted by users through ticketing and service requests.
Responsible to drive changes and enhancements through the change management process, including project management, communication with stakeholders, users and developers, performing functional unit tests, coordinating user acceptance testing, cutover tasks and ongoing support.
Configure and Enhance Configured various components in the SAP FI/CO like Accounts Receivable (AR), Accounts Payable (AP) and General Ledger Accounts; Configured the Automatic payment program for Intercompany automatic account posting, running program for Check management, open item clearing and down payments
Knowledge of User Exits and solid understanding of Configuration of Enterprise Structure, containing Company Code, Chart of Accounts, controlling area, Business area, Valuation area and Credit Control area
Competencies:
Action Oriented: Taking on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and Enthusiasm.
Ensures Accountability: Holding self and others accountable to meet commitments.
Collaborates: Building partnerships and working collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives.
Decision Quality: Making good and timely decisions that keep the organization moving forward.
Customer Focus: Building strong customer relationships and delivering customer-centric solutions.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Sciences (CS) or Management Information Systems (MIS) or Industrial Engineering or Related Fields
Minimum 5 years of SAP Implementation & Configuration experience in areas such as SAP FI AP, FI AR, FI Financial Accounting, FI GL/New GL, FI SPL, FI Fixed Asset, Treasury, CO CCA, CO Product Costing, CO-PCA, CO-PA, CO-Internal Orders
Minimum 5 years of SAP Experience with Integration of SAP FICO with MM, SD, FSCM, and other integrated Modules. Experience with FSCM Dispute management, Collections and Credit management modules.
Must have 5 years of experience leading SAP system solutions implementation including design, configuration, development, testing, and Implementation
Experience in working with interfaces and integration with third party systems
Experience in conduction workshops and freeze the requirements
Experience in preparation of blueprints and solution documents; Experience in writing functional specifications
Performs functional / analysis, requirements definition, and system configuration.
Previous experience in identifying the impact on existing configuration and determining the technical requirements to support the organization**s business processes within the SAP system.
Strong SAP support application process knowledge in Finance modules, GL, AR – OTC, AP – PTP, AA, CO – CCA and PCA.
Knowledge and experience working with SAP tables, sets, validations, and substitution rules.
Business process analysis and redesign experience: strong business analysis skills; process mapping; business process redesign and support design implementation.
Experience with SAP custom solutions and RICEF knowledge preferred.
Systems implementation skills: requirements/process analysis, conceptual and detailed design, configuration, testing, training, change management, support.

Sales Planning Analyst: This position is responsible for all forecasting activities associated with assigned customers and products. Support the Sales team by preparing customer forecasts and analyzing data to meet current sales goals.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:


Initiate the forecast planning process working directly with each sales manager
Review and revise sales forecasts and monitor forecast accuracy
Develop metrics, analysis and recommendations to support strategic decisions related to sales, products, and monthly forecasts
Evaluate POS and customer trends for market and product opportunities
Using data from the Insights team, review trends based on channel or customer group and make recommendations
Recommends changes to current sales techniques, procedures or promotional efforts based on information from the Insights team
Create a tactical execution plan for marketing and customer special projects (allocation, NFD, excess)
Develop and maintain standardized reports to track performance against KPI’s, scorecards, budgets, and forecasts
Evaluate business trends and communicate actionable recommendations for improvement; promotional calendar and seasonal trends
Present data and insights directly to customers during Sales calls and support the Sales team with follow-ups as needed
Review customer scorecards and fill rate; make recommendations on substitute items
Develop and maintain a standardized selling template updated with annual objectives, key insights, and trend analysis
Weekly customer communication on POS, available to buy, and out of stock
IBP communication as related to forecast to update Sales team
Continuously evaluate what is important to the customer and develop solutions that align with business objectives
Anticipates business opportunities and challenges; drive long-term strategy while maintaining a focus on short-term objectives
Works collaboratively and effectively with key stakeholders throughout the organization
Other duties as assigned

Competencies: To perform the job successfully, the candidate must:


Possess strong written and oral communication
Intermediate Excel skill set with working experience using V/X Lookup formulas
Demonstrate initiative and problem-solving skills
Ability to manage a project from start to finish, owning deadlines, being resourceful and working cross functionally.
Have a Customer Focused approach to problem solving
Be flexible to change and learn new processes quickly
Ability to work on a variety of tasks simultaneously. Strong time management skills
Have strong analytical skills and detail oriented
Be resourceful and have a positive work ethic
Must be able to collaborate and contribute in an in-office team environment
Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations and other employees of the organization

Education and/or Experience: BA/BS required and minimum of 1-3+ years related experience and/or training: or equivalent combination of education and experience.

Physical Demands: Ability to sit for long periods of time in front of a computer screen in an office environment. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit; reach with hands and arms and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, and pack out small parcel packages. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision and ability to adjust focus.

The Senior Sales Strategy & Operations Analyst will be part of a high-performance and collaborative sales operations and enablement team. This role will encompass many aspects of operating a best in class sales organization including Go-to-market (GTM) planning, sales forecasting, business operations, and data analytics. This individual will have a deep understanding of our sales process, business initiatives, sales drivers, and our growth targets. A successful candidate in this role will be a key player in collaborating with Sales and Business leaders to identify and activate opportunities for improvement to achieve growth in each market segment.

Example projects include identifying business whitespace, building reporting infrastructure and executive dashboards, supporting pipe review cadences and business growth initiatives, and assisting in annual planning and monthly forecasting.




Your impact

Partner with sales segment leaders to support performance reporting, KPI tracking, forecasting, and overall business performance

Derive meaningful, actionable insights and specific recommendations from sophisticated business analyses and advanced modeling to improve GTM effectiveness

Create and deliver presentations with data-driven insights and a strategic narrative for senior executives

Work cross-functionally with other business units teams including Marketing, Business Systems, and Finance
