At Jack Henry, we deliver technology solutions that are digitally transforming and empowering community banks and credit unions to provide enhanced and streamlined user experiences to their customers and members. Our best-in-class products are just the start as we lay the groundwork for the future of digital banking and payments. We hope you’ll join us. We can’t do it without you.

A Supervisor of the Salesforce Business Analysis (BA) team will be joining our leadership team. This team is a transformative unit that supports the transition to the Salesforce platform. In this people leader role, you will lead, coach, and manage the Business Analyst team. You will work with the team by coaching and mentoring the Business Analyst while also helping to identify business value that can be attained within the Salesforce platform. You will lead by example to capture understand and explain business process details in order to achieve a shared understanding between the business, product, and technical teams for a successful delivery of MVP. The successful candidate has previous leadership experience as well as in-depth knowledge of CRM platforms, mainly Salesforce, along with an extensive background in business analytics and customer relationship management.

This position will be filled to work Remotely within the U.S.

The target salary range for this position is $76,296 – $140,000, based on location and experience.

What you’ll be responsible for:
Leading a team of Business Analysts, coaching, mentoring, and supporting their development while ensuring a successful delivery of business requirements.
Partnering with the Product Owner (PO) to ensure BA resources are aligned to support project needs.
Working closely with the Solution Architects and Quality Assurance (QA) team members to write test scripts and resolve bugs as needed.
Serving as a resource and/or participant in business process re-design activities. Assisting the customer in determining if and how system enhancements may improve process flow and business function.
Leading requirement gathering sessions with internal/external Salesforce stakeholders.
May perform other job duties as assigned.
What you’ll need to have:
A minimum of 6 years of experience as a business analyst working within the CRM ecosystem writing test scripts and bugs in a standardized format and creating process maps (current and future state).
A minimum of 3 years of experience leading and supporting a team.
A minimum of 3 years of experience with Salesforce Sales, Service, and/or Experience Cloud.
A minimum of 3 years of experience working in an Agile environment at all levels including stakeholder management, with a considerate ability to take ownership of tasks and complete them with minimal direct supervision.
Ability to multitask, meet deadlines, and stay calm under pressure.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to develop deep business and application domain knowledge for an assigned workstream to aid in critically evaluating the balance of both business needs and user requests.
Ability to travel up to 5% to attend JH meetings, trainings, and/or professional conferences.
What would be nice for you to have:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, IT, Management, or Business.
Salesforce certifications.
Salesforce Experience Cloud experience.
Financial industry experience.
Systems integration experience (APIs).

What We Do
CarParts.com is the go-to eCommerce platform for auto care and maintenance. We offer drivers quality parts at competitive prices and allow customers to schedule an appointment with a trusted mechanic directly from our website. We use world-class design principles and the latest technologies to deliver a fast, easy-to-use, and mobile-intuitive website. And with our company-owned national distribution network, we bring the best brands and manufacturers directly to consumers, cutting out the costs associated with brick-and-mortar retailers. Our more than 1,700 team members worldwide are dedicated to Empowering Drivers Along Their Journey.

Our Culture
At CarParts.com, we’re DRIVEN by our core values: Safety First, Customer Focused, and a Commitment to Excellence. These values guide us in everything we do and push us further in our growth both as a company and as people. They cultivate an environment where employees are inspired and empowered as we build and thrive together. All the hard work of our entire team has resulted in back-to-back record-breaking quarters since Q1 of 2020, as well as our inclusion in the Los Angeles Business Journal’s top 100 Best Places to Work in Los Angeles list for three years in a row (2020, 2021, & 2022). Join us!

Summary of Role/Position
We are seeking an experienced Business Intelligence Engineer with expertise in SQL, Tableau, and DataBricks to join our dynamic team at Carparts.com. As a Business Intelligence Engineer, you will play a vital role in driving data-driven decision-making and providing actionable insights to propel our business forward. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining scalable data solutions, integrating disparate systems, and enabling the analysis of complex data sets. This role requires a minimum of 5 years of relevant experience and the ability to effectively communicate with C-suite executives.

Responsibilities:
Collaborate with stakeholders, including C-suite executives, to understand business requirements and translate them into technical specifications for data solutions.
Extract, transform, and load (ETL) data from various sources, including disparate and legacy systems, into new databases and cloud platforms.
Develop and optimize SQL queries to extract and analyze data effectively.
Utilize Tableau and other data visualization tools to create insightful and interactive dashboards and reports for business users.
Build scalable ETL processes to integrate and transform data from disparate systems, ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and integrity.
Identify data quality issues, design and implement data governance strategies, and drive data quality improvements.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support ad-hoc data analysis requests and provide actionable insights.
Stay updated with the latest industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analytics and business intelligence.

Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a related field (e.g., Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Analytics) or equivalent work experience.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in business analysis, data analysis, or a related role.
Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes.
Hands-on experience with Tableau or similar data visualization tools.
Familiarity with DataBricks or other cloud-based data processing platforms.
Proven track record of successfully integrating and transforming data from disparate and legacy systems.
Strong analytical skills and ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Solution Architect (Supply Chain Management)
Job Title
Solutions Architect


Job Responsibilities
Pre-Sales Activities
Run discovery sessions with prospect to understand key objectives, issues, requirements, value propositions, and decision processes
Develop solution proposals designing a profitable plan to deliver value, meet requirements, define future processes, and data integration to deliver customer requirements
Support other pre-sales activities including technical RFI/RFP response includes systems architecture, data integration, demand and supply mathematical models, inventory optimization models, and network optimization design
Configure and deliver customer demos and onsite customer workshops
Implementation Activities
Participate as a member of the One Network’s supply chain solutions implementation team in discovery sessions to understand the client’s detailed business objectives, value analysis process models, and data integration needs
Design and Architect supply chain solutions that best meets the client’s requirements based on ONE RTVN application with inventory, supply, and demand models and value analysis
Perform hands-on modeling and implementation of the supply chain solutions including data modeling, IXM engine algorithm tuning, forecast modeling, inventory modeling, integration development, java development, and business workflow configuration
Perform testing and analysis to ensure the solutions perform as designed
Perform training sessions for clients and partners and support through go-live process, and play a key role in promoting solutions adoption
Work with Project Leaders to understand assigned project responsibilities and keep the projects on schedule
Coordinate implementation activities across multiple team members.
Other Activities
Provide solution direction, needs, and customer feedback to product management and engineering on future direction of the core components
Travel to trade shows, marketing events
Support White Paper and marketing collateral development
Participate in discussion with marketing and engineering teams on new product introduction and provide feedback


Job Requirements
Understand supply chain management concepts and mathematical models, including forecast, replenishment, inventory management, etc.
Have strong general consulting skills including skills in business analysis, process mapping, and problem solving
Information systems implementation skills including requirements / process analysis, conceptual and detailed design, Java development, SQL coding, configuration, testing, data analysis and integration, training and support
Ability to analyze product functional issues and come up with feasible resolutions with corresponding mathematical models of demand and supply with financial impacts
Ability to learn and master new technologies with a technical and math aptitude
Strong interpersonal skills with good written and verbal communication
Extremely detail oriented and customer focused


Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Supply Chain, or another appropriate field. Master’s degree is a plus.
6-8 year’s work experience selling, building, or implementing Java enterprise applications.
Functional knowledge of supply chains, logistics, order management, etc. is required
Strong analytical problem-solving skills
Business process analysis and redesign experience: business analysis skills; process mapping; business process redesign and implementation.
Excellent communication (verbal and written) and interpersonal skills
General consulting skills, including: team facilitation and business case development
Understanding of software design patterns, J2EE components (EJB, JSP, Servlets), and XML
Systems implementation skills: requirements/process analysis, conceptual and detailed design, configuration, testing, training, change management, support
Prior experience in sales or consulting with an enterprise software vendor is a plus.



About Us:
One Network Enterprises (ONE) based in Dallas, Texas offers a disruptive supply chain technology, business and partner model that are unique to the market. One Network’s real-time multi-party platform is the only technology that enables true, many-to-many multi-party transactions and workflows spanning all trading partners. Our platform is powered by NEO, One Network’s patented machine learning and intelligent agent technology (AI) that enables the autonomous supply chain. NEO runs across the network in the background, continually scanning for potential issues and optimizing supply chain operations.

Job Title: Mid- Level Business/Quality Analyst- Core Director
Job Description:
At Jack Henry, we deliver technology solutions that are digitally transforming and empowering community banks and credit unions to provide enhanced and streamlined user experiences to their customers and members. Our best-in-class products are just the start as we lay the groundwork for the future of digital banking and payments. We hope you’ll join us. We can’t do it without you.

JHA Banking Core Director Development team is seeking to hire a motivated individual to work as a Business/Quality Analyst. Candidates for this position will be responsible to work in an agile development process for software development. This includes working collaboratively within the development team to develop software requirements, research, testing, and solutions as a self-organizing and cross-functional team. This position can be worked remotely and may have occasional travel up to 5%.

Working with the development team to help define requirements which include scoping, developing, and testing enhancements to support core functionality.
Working with the development team for testing enhancements and defects to ensure an accurate, quality product and ensure changes are migrated into production correctly for our Core banking product.

Executing and creating test plans and clear, concise test scripts for new products or enhancements to existing Core banking products.

Reviewing and providing feedback on requirements, design, and scope documents.
May perform other job duties as assigned.
What you’ll need to have:
A minimum of 6 years of experience in software development, software support or related banking experience.
An attention to detail and the ability to find a problem with the software before it goes live to the financial institutions.

Strong knowledge of banking daily functions, including Deposits, General Ledger and Teller processing
Strong knowledge of software testing lifecycle
A background working with Core Director product.
Experience working with Azure DevOps or other software tracking software.
Experience with or knowledge of Automation software
Experience with business requirements documentation, technical/functional specifications, use cases, test cases.

Job Title: Corporate Planning Specialist- (Must be Korean Bilingual)
Job Description:
JOB SUMMARY:

The Corporate Planning Specialist for the Strategy Department will be engaged in the analysis, research, and business case creation that will drive Hyosung’s strategic planning. The successful candidate must be able to document evaluate, and translate business needs into applications. An understanding of consulting methodologies within the financial services (strategy work, business case development, process mapping, the lifecycle of project implementation, requirements gathering, and competitive assessment) is an essential factor for success in this role.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

Evaluating corporate performance business processes, anticipating requirements, uncovering areas for improvement, and developing and implementing solutions.
Analytics and reporting for company performance
Conducting market, competitor and consumer research
Business portfolio management
Conducting meetings and presentations to share ideas and findings.
Performing requirements analysis.
Documenting and communicating the results of your efforts.
Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management.
Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports.
Ensuring solutions meet business needs and requirements.
Managing projects, developing project plans, and monitoring performance.
Updating, implementing and maintaining procedures.
Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements.
Serving as a liaison between stakeholders and users.
Managing competing resources and priorities.
Monitoring deliverables and ensuring timely completion of projects.


EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:

Bachelor’s Degree in finance or business-related field required (MBA preferred)
A minimum of 2 years’ experience in business analysis or a related field with Bachelor’s Degree.
Bi-lingual in Korean/English strongly preferred.
Financial Services background strongly preferred.
Exceptional analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
The ability to influence stakeholders and work closely with them to determine acceptable solutions.
Excellent documentation skills.
Fundamental analytical and conceptual thinking skills.
Experience creating detailed reports and giving presentations.
Competency in Microsoft applications including Word, Excel, and Outlook.
A track record of following through on commitments.
Excellent planning, organizational, and time management skills.
Excellent presentation skills; will be called on frequently to present strategic plans to highest levels of company and customer management teams
Ability to foster close, cooperative relationships with peer leaders, sales leadership and team, and third-party leadership


PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

The individual must be highly self-motivated, responsive, with excellent leadership, interpersonal, written and oral communications skills, with a proven track record of leadership, and have the ability to:

Manage varying degrees of priorities and demands, both internal and partner driven
Create an environment conducive to contribution, growth and achievement with an emphasis on win-win behaviors
Take ownership of issues and drive solutions
Act in an autonomous role with little, if any, management direction
Establish relationships, network and collaborate with other teams to achieve desired results
Work in both a pro-active and re-active manner concurrently
Listen, evaluate and communicate to management on direction, recommendations, status, and critical success factors

These physical demands are representative of the physical requirements necessary for an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of the job. Reasonable accommodation can be made to enable people with disabilities to perform the described essential functions.

The Credit Bureau Operations Furnishing Lead supports the credit reporting/monitoring of auto loan information to the nationwide consumer reporting agencies (CRA). This role will support Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA) and Unfair, Deceptive or Abusive Acts or Practices (UDAAP) compliance, and is also responsible for issue tracking, managing issue resolution and ensuring proper closure of issues. The position includes project management of updates impacting credit reporting. Extensive interaction with Legal, Compliance and Operations is required.

This is a hybrid position located in Chadds Ford, PA / Coppell, TX / or Tempe, AZ
What is a day in the life at Flagship as a Credit Bureau Furnishing Lead?

Provides direct oversight and establishes controls related to furnishing of account information to credit bureaus to ensure accuracy, integrity, and timeliness in accordance with company, regulatory and industry requirements.
Monitoring Metro2 data furnishing format from Flagship's servicing system.
Testing of file layout to ensure the desired reporting.
Responsible for data clean up as required compiling data into Metro2.
Monitoring, testing, and executing monthly quality reviews.
Identifying areas for improvement with leadership and consultation with 3rd party provider
Building and maintaining good relationships with multiple operating groups, including Collections, Credit, Fraud, Customer Delivery, Technology, Customer Experience, Legal, Compliance, etc. as well as service providers who support credit reporting processes
Understanding processes of the multiple operating groups and how those processes will impact reporting.
Reviewing processes and output that drive reporting, recognizing the drivers, testing their effectiveness, and recommending change when they are not effective.
About you:

Preferred: Working knowledge of the auto finance industry, Metro2 Reporting and Consumer Data Industry Association (CDIA) regulations and industry compliance.
Preferred: 3+ years of experience performing business analysis and/or process design and analysis.
Required: 2-5+ years of credit bureau reporting experience in a bank or financial institution, direct experience interfacing with credit reporting agencies.
Preferred: Familiarity or experience with SAS/SQL.
Required: Fluent with Microsoft Office suite.
Working understanding of the FCRA, Regulation V, UDAAP and applicable consumer finance laws.
Knowledge and understanding of e-Oscar dispute processing.
Preferred: MS Power BI, Tableau, Oracle BI, Google Analytics.
Preferred: MS SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle PL/SQL, MariaDB, DBeaver, SAP, Hyperion Financial Management, Essbase, financial reporting, and statement analysis.
Preferred: Windows, iOS, Linux, Chrome OS.
Excellent organizational and time management skills, with the ability to multi-task, maintain accuracy, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced, high-volume environment.
Strong written and verbal communication skills with an ability to effectively interact with all levels within the organization and the ability to create and summarize detailed written reports.
Strong interpersonal, listening, and interviewing skills with the ability to confront and address sensitive topics while maintaining a high degree of professionalism, confidentiality, diplomacy, and tact.
Strong analytical, decision making and problem-solving skills.
Self-starter possessing the ability to work independently while supporting a team environment while still being able to collaborate with others to achieve company objectives.
Demonstrate sound business judgment in applying proper policies, procedures, and guidelines.
Strong attention to detail and high concern for data accuracy with the ability to objectively identify, assess, resolve, and mitigate risk.
Education requirements:

Required: High School Diploma or Equivalent.
Preferred: Bachelor’s degree in finance, Accounting or Business Administration or equivalent work-related experience.
Preferred: FCRA Certified.

Background with salesforce.com reporting tools

Position Summary
McCarthy is seeking a full-time Payroll Business Analyst located in St. Louis, MO who, as part of the IT Applications team, will lead the analysis, design, implementation, and support of our payroll applications and related systems. We are embarking on a financial transformation, which includes design and implementation of full payroll cycle on SAP EC Payroll platform. The primary focus of this role is being a strategic partner with our payroll stakeholder group, help lead the implementation of SAP EC Payroll and provide on-going maintenance and support of our new SAP payroll environment.


Primary Responsibilities

Business Analysis and Solution Design

Develop a strong understanding of key operational processes and workflows including the key business drivers behind those processes.
Partner closely with key stakeholders to consider new and better ways to apply technology to drive greater business outcomes (improved collaboration, efficiency, quality, etc.). Facilitate effective discovery sessions and techniques to uncover specific business needs and requirements.
Establish a future state vision and lead approach to designing, developing, implementing, and supporting future state use cases.
Employ a disciplined approach to designing, developing, and validating future state technology use cases that deliver value. Solutions can represent new or existing technology platforms and tools, critical enhancements or changes to existing technologies, systems integration efforts, or custom technology solutions.

Internal and External Relationship Management

Build strong partnerships with internal business leaders, influencers, project teams, and users serving as the technology and business enablement advocate too advise and direct the best practice methods.
Act as liaison to other IT teams and be a focal point for cross-application integration opportunities.
Develop partnerships with key stakeholders within external technology vendors, including implementation resources, customer success representatives, and product teams.

Project Planning, Execution, and Change Management

Execute mindful project planning for each technology initiative, including resource planning, schedule, key milestones, risk mitigation, issue management and ongoing communication.
Seek to execute projects in an agile, highly collaborative manner with a goal of delivering value for McCarthy throughout project execution.
Plan, develop and execute testing, communication, and change management activities.
Develop training content based on best practices established for application capabilities.
Facilitate communications and interactions between functional groups, team members, strategic partners, and vendors.


Qualifications

Bachelor’s Degree (preferred)
3+ years of experience in systems analysis, delivery, and support preferred
3+ years of experience with ERP Payroll application implementation/configuration required
SAP S4/EC Payroll application including EC core HR and US Payroll preferred
Experience with functional and technical design of integrations is desired
Clear and effective communication skills (verbal and written)
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with aptitude for acquiring new skills
Highly motivated team player with passion for delivering value to the organization
Strong organizational and project management capabilities with a drive for continuous improvement

Job Title: Senior Finance Analyst, Hospital Financial Operations
Job Description:
The Senior Analyst, reporting to the VP of Hospital Financial Operations, provides analytical support to the Revenue Integrity and Health Plan Contracting functions through project management, data and financial analyses, health plan contract process management, and assistance with chargemaster, charge capture and pricing projects. Will support both the Vice President of Revenue Integrity, Vice President of Health Plan Contracting, and other assignments as directed by the VP Hospital Financial Operations.

Community Hospital Corporation (CHC) is a 5-Time Winner in the Dallas Morning News’ Top Workplaces DFW 2023 competition and Top 150 Great Places to Work in Healthcare by Becker’s Hospital Review. This is an exciting onsite role at our beautiful corporate offices located in Plano between Legacy West and the Grandscape. At CHC we enjoy an outstanding work environment, covered parking, comprehensive health and welfare benefits including paid fitness facility membership, tuition reimbursement, a generous PTO allowance, and a great company culture.

Major Responsibilities

Health Plan Contracting:
Serve as a resource on managed care matters to hospital personnel
Model the impact of proposed rates and terms and present to hospital and corporate management prior to contract finalization
Assist in negotiations with payers regarding terms and rates and prepare contracts for final signature
Periodically review hospitals monthly contractual adjustment computations for accuracy and compliance with policies
Audit payments received from managed care companies to ensure accuracy at each hospital against contract terms
Complete credentialing and re-credentialing applications for client hospitals
Assist in the maintenance of various databases of contract information
Revenue Integrity
Serve as a resource to research charge compliance related from hospital personnel.
Assist on chargemaster code compliance review projects by preparing and analyzing data, conducting meetings with hospital department managers and creating final work products.
Perform data analyses and manipulation related to strategic pricing projects.
Assist in conducting current state charge capture assessments and documenting accordingly.
Perform the research and functions necessary to assist hospitals in maintaining compliance with quarterly and annual code updates.
Financial Analysis
Support for maintenance and ad hoc analysis using the CHC Productivity Tool.
Periodic support for CHC client hospitals with financial analytical needs.
Other data and analytical tasks as assigned by the VP of Hospital Financial Operations.
General Duties
Perform other miscellaneous job-related duties as assigned by the Vice President of Revenue Integrity and the Vice President of Health Plan Contracting.

Requirements

Experience/Education

BBA or BS Degree
Five or more years of experience in healthcare financial operations.
Health plan contracting and chargemaster and/or coding experience preferred.
Experience in completing moderately complex data analyses required.

Skills and Knowledge

Ability to define and prioritize specific realistic, goals and objectives
Ability to identify, analyze and effectively resolve operational and administrative problems
Ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously
Ability to be trustworthy
Ability to professionally and successfully interact with a variety of internal and external parties
Communicates openly and in a timely way
Shares information appropriately
Keeps others well informed
Encourages others to share contrary views
Responds in a timely manner to messages/requests
Possesses a core set of ethical values
Negotiation skills
Knowledge of hospital revenue cycle and the impact of such operations on hospital reimbursement
Knowledge of hospital and physician health plan contracts, and the impact of such contracts on hospital operations
Knowledge of all types of healthcare payer sources such as commercial, governmental, workers compensation and others.
Proficient understanding and application of the concepts and terminology unique to the healthcare industry.
Proficient PC skills, including Microsoft Word and Excel.

Benefits

At CHC we enjoy an outstanding work environment, covered parking, comprehensive health and welfare benefits including paid fitness facility membership, tuition reimbursement, a generous PTO allowance, and a great company culture.

Comprehensive health and welfare benefits package is offered as part of total compensation.



Health Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)
Retirement Plan (401k, IRA)
Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)
Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)
Wellness Resources and other benefits

CHC is a tobacco and drug free workplace. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

JOB SUMMARY

Reporting to the Head of Business Applications, the Oracle ERP Cloud Business Analyst works closely with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to gather requirements, configure Oracle ERP Cloud modules, and ensure the system effectively meets business needs. The Oracle ERP Cloud Business Analyst is instrumental in bridging the gap between IT and business units, ensuring the successful translation of business objectives into Oracle ERP Cloud solutions.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities

Collaborate with business units to gather, document, and prioritize requirements for the Oracle ERP Cloud system.
Configure Oracle ERP Cloud modules, such as Financials and Procurement, to meet defined business requirements.
Create and execute test plans to validate configurations and ensure system accuracy and reliability.
Gather reporting requirements and provide specifications for technical team to develop custom reports.
Collaborate with software engineering and integration teams to ensure seamless integration of Oracle ERP Cloud with other business systems and applications.
Provide training, support, and documentation to end-users to foster successful system adoption.
Monitor and troubleshoot system issues, working closely with Oracle support to resolve them in a timely manner.
Stay updated with Oracle ERP Cloud updates, patches, and best practices, ensuring the organization is leveraging the full potential of the system.
Participate in business process improvement initiatives, recommending enhancements to optimize the use of Oracle ERP Cloud.

Education and/or Experience

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Systems, or a related field.
Minimum 3 years of experience with Oracle ERP Cloud, including hands-on configuration.
Proven track record of successful Oracle ERP Cloud projects, from requirements gathering to deployment and support.
Familiarity with multiple Oracle ERP Cloud modules and their functionalities.
Proficient with the Oracle Analytic reporting tools.

Skills and Abilities

In-depth knowledge of Oracle ERP Cloud applications and best practices.
Strong understanding of business processes, particularly in areas like finance and procurement.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate complex business

requirements into Oracle ERP Cloud solutions.

Effective communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to engage and collaborate

with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.

Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously, managing priorities and deadlines

effectively.

Strong commitment to continuous learning, staying current with Oracle ERP Cloud updates,

and industry trends.

Physical Demands The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be

met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable

accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential

functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit; use hands,

fingers, to handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally

required to stand or walk. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds.

Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision,

peripheral vision, and depth perception.

Work Environment The work environment characteristics described here are representative of

those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable

accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential

functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet.

This position is for a Temporary/Contractor

Why Us

NewRocket, a global, full-service Elite ServiceNow partner, helps top enterprise leaders solve their toughest business problems and navigate change with confidence. The go-to ServiceNow guide, NewRocket was recently awarded the "2023 ServiceNow Worldwide Customer Workflow Partner of the Year" and "2023 ServiceNow Creator Workflow Partner of the Year".

We work with some of the world's biggest brands, bridging the gap between what customers expect and what their technology can deliver. We #GoBeyondWorkflows to create new kinds of experiences for our customers. Come join our Crew!

Why You

You are a Contract Senior UX Content Strategist who can manage end-to-end content strategy for service portal projects, from discovery to go-live. You have a strong, successful background providing professional services to client organizations with complex needs. You have developed and applied expertise defining, implementing, and validating improvements in organizational knowledge bases, service catalogs, and other pertinent content that produce extraordinary user experiences. You want to join a vibrant, growing team that is changing how businesses enable efficiency and productivity and the way employees find, read, request, and track information and services.

The Role

The Contractor, Senior UX Content Strategist will provide expert consulting to optimize ServiceNow content (including service catalogs and knowledge bases), taxonomy, and supporting information architecture to both NewRocket and customers. They will facilitate workshops with clients, end users and project teams to define system requirements, problems, and goals. The UX Content Strategist will partner with UX/UI Designers, project managers and technical teams to demonstrate how their content strategy will produce extraordinary user experiences and measurable impact.

What You Will Be Doing

Defining user needs, determining strategies, developing plans and proposals, and making recommendations around customers' content for improved efficiency and effectiveness
Providing expert consulting to optimize ServiceNow content (including service catalogs and knowledge bases), taxonomy, and supporting information architecture to both NewRocket and customers
Facilitating workshops with clients, end users and project teams to define system requirements, problems, and goals
Exercising independent judgment in methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results
Developing and adapting principles and best practices that shape the practice and provide a consistent, repeatable process
Improving content discoverability through search optimization, navigation, personalization, automation, and other strategies
Creating personas, journey maps, authoring templates, playbooks, and other strategy artifacts to document your content strategy
Managing multiple projects and priorities simultaneously
Delivering measurable, positive results within the client and team's timeline, budget, and scope
Effectively communicating with key stakeholders when either scope or timeline of projects require modification
Helping to create conceptual prototypes and mock-ups
Partnering with UX/UI Designers, project managers and technical teams to conduct demonstrations for clients and end users
Interacting with the pre-sales department to inform and influence the sales strategy and to help grow the capability
Providing thought leadership on how the capability could be leveraged by the broader organization
Supporting training for NewRocket employees and customers
Expanding your ServiceNow knowledge and expertise
Staying current on content industry certifications and knowledge

What You Bring Along

8+ years related work experience in information architecture, business analysis, content strategy or UX strategy
6+ years working with enterprise knowledge and service catalog management
4+ years working with ServiceNow or a similar SAAS platform
Proven critical thinking with demonstrated ability to ingest and analyze complex ideas and/or problems
Keen attention to detail
Understanding of the best practices of content architecture, optimization, and management
Excellent communication skills to convey the results of such analyses in simple, succinct, and understandable verbal, written, and/or presentation methods
Excellent time management and organizational capabilities
Excellent listening skills
Excellent Office 365 skills
Commitment to being an engaged team player
Proven success building stakeholder relationships

We Take Care of Our People

NewRocket is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. We value and celebrate diversity, believing that every employee matters and should be respected and heard. We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and affirmative action employer, committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, citizenship, military, or Veteran status. Job Title: Tax Analyst - Commercial Banking Sales and Use Tax
Job Description:
At Wells Fargo, we are looking for talented people who will put our customers at the center of everything we do. We are seeking candidates who embrace diversity, equity, and inclusion in a workplace where everyone feels valued and inspired.

Help us build a better Wells Fargo. It all begins with outstanding talent. It all begins with you.

About this role:

Wells Fargo is seeking a Tax Analyst as part of the Wholesale Lending Operations division. Learn more about the career areas and lines of business at wellsfargojobs.com

In this role, you will:
Perform moderately complex to complex tax accounting activities related to the preparation of federal, state and local income tax returns or the financial statement accounting for income taxes.
Prepare comprehensive tax work papers, perform account analysis, and prepare responses to audit requests.
Research memos or correspondence and embody and model compliance and risk management requirements for supported area.
Exercise proficiency in accounting and multi-jurisdictional income tax laws, rules and regulations
Develop knowledge of federal and state income tax laws, rulings, regulations and judicial decisions
Perform basic income tax research.
Maintain records related to income tax returns and reports.
Work with moderate to minimal supervision
Provide functional advice to less experienced staff.
Consult on income tax related matters with lines of business and other control functions.
Develop relationships with assigned business units related to the collection and analysis of information important to income tax accounting or compliance
Work with business partners to collect internal financial or tax data, perform data analysis, test for accuracy, identify and resolve data problems
Participate in projects
Communicate and provide consultation regularly with mid-level stakeholders companywide
Required Qualification:
2+ years of Corporate Tax, Finance, Accounting, Analytics, Reporting experience, or equivalent demonstrated through one or a combination of the following: work experience, training, military experience, education.
Desired Qualifications:
2+ years of multistate transaction tax consulting experience
2+ years of sales and use tax research and administration experience
Certified Public Accountant (CPA) or Juris Doctor (JD) degree
Familiarity with Vertex sale tax solutions
Transaction tax experience in the leasing industry preferred
Advanced Excel skills to perform technical analysis of large volumes of data
Equipment finance or commercial leasing experience
Strong analytical skills with high attentional to detail and accuracy
Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills
Strong collaboration and partnering skills
Ability to take initiative and work independently with minimal supervision in a structured environment.
Strong project management skills
Job Expectations:
Ability to work at one of our approved job posting locations
Ability to work a hybrid schedule, at least 3 days a week working in office.
Posting Locations:

10 S Wacker Dr, Chicago, IL 60606
800 Walnut St, Des Moines, IA 50309
5000 Riverside Dr, Irving, TX 75039

Avetta's SaaS platform connects the world's leading organizations with qualified suppliers, contractors, and vendors. We bring unmatched visibility to companies through cloud-based technology and human insights. As a result, we foster sustainable growth for businesses and their supply chains. Our SaaS subscription software is used by 85k+ active customers in over 100 countries.

SUMMARY

The Sales Commissions Analyst will provide support for administering the monthly sales commission process. This includes partnering closely with other department stakeholders and the Sales Operations team to support the processing of monthly sales commissions for a variety of sales commission eligible positions at Avetta. This will include the review, calculation, and approval of allocated commissions for payroll processing to ensure accurate and timely monthly/quarterly commission payments. The Sales Commission Analyst should be detail oriented with strong financial and analytics capabilities.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Process monthly/quarterly commissions payouts in Spiff for Payroll processing and payment.
Provide ad-hoc support for internal Sales Operations deliverables, pertaining to Sales Compensation, CRM/Sales data maintenance and/or Sales Reporting.
Demonstrate strong collaboration skills to partner with key cross-functional partners, notably Finance, HR and key Sales stakeholders.
Must demonstrate immaculate attention to detail and advanced data management and analytical skills, strong Excel and other financial software skills.

EDUCATION, TRAINING AND EXPERIENCE:

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics or a technical or business discipline.
5+ years of Finance, Accounting or Sales Compensation experience preferred.
Ability to synthesize and aggregate large amounts of data, and subsequently summarize the data for executive consumption.
Experience with Salesforce and Commissions Software.
Strong Excel for financial analytics.

Base Pay

This role has a minimum base pay from $15.24 per hour with higher starting pay available based on experience.

Purpose

This position is responsible for the accuracy and integrity of the store’s inventory. Full-Time and Part-Time Positions Available.

Minimum Eligibility Requirements

One year of inventory control experience in a “big box” retail company or an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to perform the essential functions of the job, as determined by the company.
Demonstrated point of sale analysis and reporting experience.
Business analysis experience is a plus.
Intermediate computer skills including Microsoft Office Suite.
Must be detail-oriented and highly organized.
Must possess excellent customer service skills and work well under pressure.
Ability to multi-task, meet deadlines, and work in a fast-paced environment.

Essential Functions

Demonstrate a thorough understanding and compliance with the company’s safe lifting practices standard operating procedures.
Follow the daily cycle count and category review calendar.
Research all inventory-related discrepancies and make appropriate adjustments in the inventory system.
Review shipping and receiving documents for accuracy.
Bring to the attention of the department managers immediately any discrepancies noticed in tagging or SKUing of merchandise.
Audit the BFR daily in accordance with the Inventory Control SOP.
Audit incoming and outgoing trucks randomly.
Audit the SOR process in accordance with the Return of Sale SOP.
Audit the SRR process in accordance with the Return of Sale SOP for Voids and Partial voids.
Audit the RTV process to ensure RTV’s are being processed per SOP.
Audit to ensure the security of the facility by notifying management of any issues.
Audit the customer merchandise storage area weekly in accordance with the Customer Storage SOP and timely resolve any issues with the CEM and Operations Manager.
Provide assistance to the Operations Manager during any physical inventory period.
Ensure that the “Sample” tape is applied to all wood boxes that have been written off to “Sam”. If not, notify the department manager to immediately address.
Run the OSDR Report for DMG, RTV, VA, DIS, WO, CHR, PRV, USE, LF, STL, WEB and SAM monthly to ensure correct movement of merchandise was done and correct any discrepancies. Document report of findings/corrections, submit to the Operations manager for review, both initial and archive monthly in the cycle count drawer.
Check a minimum of 10 customer receipts daily and randomly. Either “Pickup” and or “Take With” Tickets. Any discrepancies adjust immediately and notify CEM/Operations Manager of mistake(s).
Communicate to Store Management Team the discrepancies found in the day’s CCYL and propose solutions to fix the issues which may have caused and or potential may cause shrink via e-mail. Failure to fix the outstanding issues upon your follow-up, you will need to notify the CEM/Operations manager immediately.
Maintain all cycle count paperwork per SOP.
Follow-up to ensure that all changes were implemented.

Working Conditions (travel, hours, environment)

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently exposed to a warehouse environment and moving vehicles. The noise level in the work environment is typically moderate to noisy.

Physical/Sensory Requirements

Medium Work – Ability to exert 20-50 pounds of force occasionally, and/or 10-25 pounds of force frequently, and/or greater than negligible up to 10 pounds of force constantly to lift, carry, push, pull, or otherwise move objects. The employee is often required to use their hands and fingers, to handle or feel. The employee is occasionally required to stand, walk, reach with arms and hands, climb or balance, and to stoop, kneel, crouch or crawl.

Store Hours

Monday - Friday 7:00 AM - 7:00 PM

Saturday 8:00 AM - 7:00 PM

Sunday 10:00 AM - 6:00 PM

Benefits & Rewards

Bonus opportunities at every level

Career advancement opportunities

Relocation opportunities across the country

401k with discretionary company match

Employee Stock Purchase Plan

Referral Bonus Program

A personal holiday and Volunteer Time Off program

Medical, Dental, Vision, Life and other Insurance Plans (subject to eligibility criteria)

Equal Employment Opportunity

This policy applies to all areas of employment, including recruitment, testing, screening, hiring, selection for training, upgrading, transfer, demotion, layoff, discipline, termination, compensation, benefits and all other privileges, terms and conditions of employment. This policy and the law prohibit employment discrimination against any associate or applicant on the basis of any legally protected status outlined above.

Job Title: Manager, Sales Vertical Accounts, Spectrum Enterprise
Job Description:
At a glance:
Are you a client-focused and growth-motivated sales expert skilled in outlining unique combinations of telecommunication solutions for Government and Education clients?
Can you commit to a leadership sales role guiding a team of high-performing sales managers and representatives to exceed revenue goals?
Do you desire a competitive salary with an uncapped sales commission and a focus on professional development?
Our Company:

At Spectrum Enterprise, our goal is to foster an engaging work environment that encourages our team members to reach their full potential. We promote a culture of excellence that celebrates diversity, innovative thinking and dedication to consistently exceeding client expectations.
Spectrum Enterprise, a part of Charter Communications, Inc., is a national provider of scalable, fiber technology solutions serving America's largest businesses and communications service providers. The broad Spectrum Enterprise portfolio includes networking and managed services solutions: Internet access, Ethernet access and networks, Voice and TV solutions. Spectrum Enterprises industry-leading team of experts works closely with clients to achieve greater business success by providing solutions designed to meet their evolving needs. More information about Spectrum Enterprise can be found at enterprise.spectrum.com.

Highlights:

You drive revenue generation through the decisive leadership, supervision and direction of the Government and Education vertical sales program. As the Manager of Sales Vertical Accounts Government and Education, you excel at guiding a team of Major Account Executives, Vertical Account Managers and Vertical Account Representatives to exceed targeted revenue goals. With a sharp focus on consultative selling techniques, you support your team as they outline unique combinations of Ethernet, cloud services, high-speed data, fiber services, business class phone and session initiation protocol (SIP) to Government and Education providers. You maximize sales efforts by developing key internal relationships with Market Development, Construction, Sales Support and Marketing. You are passionate about proactively developing extensive contacts within the healthcare business community. You have an aptitude for identifying roadblocks and overcoming obstacles with the ability to share this knowledge with your team. You thrive with regular travel to capture new business accounts and support your sales team within a specified footprint. You report directly to the Director, Sales Vertical Accounts for goals, guidance and assistance.

Position benefits:
Competitive salary with sales incentives.
Health, vision and dental insurance.
100% company match 401(k) up to 6%.
Company funded retirement accumulation plan for an additional 3%.
Education assistance.
Pretax childcare spending account.
Paid holidays, vacation days, personal days and sick days.
Employee discount on Spectrum services where available.

What you will do:
Be a motivating leader of the Government and Education sales team by recruiting, training and guiding the team into a productive, cohesive unit that exceeds monthly revenue goals.
Drive the sales process by conducting weekly sales team meetings and one-on-one reviews of activity and performance.
Improve revenue by monitoring the sales team in both maintenance and acquisition of accounts and making constructive and supportive recommendations.
Maximize the sales cycle by attending sales calls with representatives.
Provide weekly sales forecasts and summaries for operational executive teams to leverage.
Maintain quality and encourage long-term client retention by assigning high priority clients or business development with significant long-term potential to qualified sales members.
Mitigate risks by conducting sales and team activity within compliance of our policies and procedures.
Enhance the sales process by performing special projects and acting on long-term business building opportunities as assigned.
Develop team sales skills by providing regular coaching and mentoring to team members.
Perform additional duties related to the position as assigned.

Required keys for success:
Three or more years of leadership experience in a competitive telecommunications sales environment.
Five or more years of Enterprise level account sales experience in the telecommunications industry.
Track record of success managing assigned territory to achieve or exceed quota.
Familiar with Ethernet, cloud services, high-speed data, fiber services and fiber connected networks.
History of developing and executing a strategic plan customized for key prospects and clients.
Experience supervising teams and managing office procedures while organizing, implementing and maintaining sales goals.
Previous leadership or team lead experience in a high-volume, fast-paced environment requiring teamwork, flexibility and change management.
Solid organizational development and business skills.
Conversant with telecommunications and networking technologies.
Intermediate business analysis skills using Microsoft Office tools and Salesforce or similar client relationship management tool.
Valid drivers license, a safe driving record and availability for frequent travel.
Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook and Visio.
Effective written and spoken English communication skills with all levels of an organization.
How you will stand out:
Previous experience in the Government and Education industry.
Your education:
Bachelors degree in a business-related field or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience (required).

Description

At Shutterfly, we make life’s experiences unforgettable. We believe there is extraordinary power in the self-expression. That’s why our family of brands helps customers create products and capture moments that reflect who they uniquely are.

Sr. Financial Analyst – Operations & Manufacturing will be filling in as a key member of the Shutterfly Financial Planning & Analysis team supporting Manufacturing Operations. This role will support manufacturing costs reporting and analysis for all brands. A successful candidate will be highly analytical with the ability to work with complex models. This position will be based in Fort Mill, SC and reports to the Finance Manager – FP&A Operations.

Key Responsibilities include:

Primary support for cost analysis across all brands.
Ability to manipulate and analyze large transactional data sets, interpret, and summarize the data for metrics reporting and business insights highlighting trends and anomalies to management.
Primary support for consolidations and summary reporting during month-end. This includes use of SAP, EPM, PowerBI softwares.
Prepare monthly budget vs actual margin analysis to explain variance impacts.
Support close analysis; including accrual and forecast vs actual cost variance analysis.
Support Operation’s weekly analysis and reporting
Collaborate with the Company’s Accounting team on month end and quarter end close, reclasses/accruals and reporting to ensure accuracy and completeness of financial results.
Support ad hoc financial analysis in support of Corporate FP&A requests, as needed.

Experience & Requirements

Bachelor’s Degree in finance, accounting or economics
5 -7 years of financial planning and analysis experience in a large growth company
Strong communication and relationship building skills, with the ability to interpret and summarize data to aid management in achieving strategic and operational goals
Ability to comfortably work with Senior level management (VP’s and Site Leaders)
Excellent Excel skills; PowerPivot, Access or PowerBI skills a plus
Experience with Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems, such as SAP
Experience should include reporting responsibilities and analytical projects
Supply Chain or Manufacturing plant experience preferred
Ability to work in a fast pace, high growth environment

#SFLYCorporate

Position: Product Owner

Location: Remote - We’re hiring residents from New York and Texas.

How to apply

Please apply with your up to date Word or PDF resume.
Do not use the Indeed formatted resume to apply. Resumes parsed by Indeed are de-formatted, look generic, and can delete information from your original resume.

What we do

Transfinder is a leading provider of transportation management and communication solutions, delivering faster, safer, and smarter technology for school districts and municipal governments. With a focus on client satisfaction, the company combines its cutting-edge solutions with award-winning customer service, fostering long-term relationships based on respect, confidence, integrity, and trust. Widely used by over 2,200 School Districts nationwide and in Canada, Transfinder is dedicated to ensuring their clients have the best possible transportation experience.

What you’ll love about Transfinder

Cutting-Edge Technology: Work with the latest technology built upon Esri's industry-leading mapping and GIS technology.
Collaborative Environment: Join a team-focused workplace with an open-door management style and an entrepreneurial spirit.
Client-Centric Culture: Experience a strong culture that encourages employees to anticipate and meet client needs, fosters ownership of support and service issues, and builds long-term relationships based on respect, confidence, integrity, and trust.
Award-Winning: We've earned multiple "Best Places to Work" awards for our exceptional workplace.
Work from Home: Enjoy the opportunity to work 100% remotely in Texas or New York State.
Diverse Challenges: You'll work on all aspects and levels of complexity to support our product suite. 90% of development is for new products and features vs bug fixes.

What will you do?

Transfinder, a leading software provider for Transportation Management Systems, is looking for an

enthusiastic and motivated Product Owner to join our growing team. This individual will work closely with the development teams, scrum masters and internal stakeholders. The Product

Owner will be responsible for gathering requirements and working with the UI/UX Designers to design

new features and products. They will prioritize items within the backlog, sprints, and releases and

participate in refinement, planning and review meetings with the Development teams.

This role is a blending of Product Owner, Product Manager, Business Analyst, and Designer.

Promote an atmosphere that encourages collaboration, optimism and dedication
Conduct requirements gathering
Rapid prototyping of design solutions for our current and future product line (web, and mobile applications)
Write and maintain specifications for developer consumption
Lead the effort of story decomposition and prioritization
Participate in backlog refinement, sprint planning and sprint retrospective meetings
Present work in a group setting
Drive the pace of development projects

Must have experience.

3+ years of product experience.
Experience with Agile methodologies, Scrum, and Jira
Detail oriented, highly motivated and self-directed
Ability to present complex designs across technical and non-technical teams
Strong collaborative and communication skills
Responsive to feedback
Experience working directly with Development teams
Experience working as a Product Owner, Product Manager or Business Analyst
Experience in Product development, Requirements gathering, writing user stories, backlog management and prioritization and release management

Nice to have experience

Public/municipality or public safety/law enforcement industry experience as a product owner, manager, or business analyst

Join Transfinder and help us deliver faster, safer, and smarter technology for school districts and municipal governments. Apply now to become part of our dedicated and client-focused team!

More about Crowe:

Crowe (www.crowe.com) is one of the largest public accounting, consulting and technology firms in the United States. Crowe is recognized by many organizations as one of the country's best places to work. Crowe serves clients worldwide as an independent member of Crowe Global, one of the largest global accounting networks in the world. Sage Intacct Implementation Consultant
Full Time/Permanent
Location: Open, East Coast North America

Vision33 is a global IT professional services consultancy that solves customer business challenges through the promise of technology and the value it delivers. We partner with growing organizations in both the public and private sectors to understand their vision and help them reach it with the right blend of strategy, consulting, and technology. Vision33’s global team of results-driven resources provide world-class experience through our office locations in North America and Europe.

Our firm has previously been recognized as a Sage Diamond Partner and as one of the top global partners by Sage through the CEO Circle program.

Due to the continued growth of our Sage Intacct practice, Vision33 is currently looking to hire a Sage Intacct Implementation Consultant to join our Cloud Accounting consulting team. Given the location of our clients, and the remote nature of the work required, we are flexible on location.

In this hands-on role, you will be responsible for:
Providing consulting, training, and support to deliver successful implementations of native cloud accounting software solutions for customers.
Working directly with CFO’s, CIO’s and end users to shape solutions that access and report on business information and deliver results that impact corporate performance.
Performing analysis and systems documentation, creation of financial reports and product configuration and roll out.
Advising and guiding customers on their journey from system selection to go-live and post implementation support and beyond.
Supporting internal and external sales efforts as required.

We are seeking candidates that will bring the following skills and experience:
Post-secondary education in Finance/Accounting, Business and/or Information Systems.
Knowledge or direct experience in native cloud accounting/ERP products (eg. Sage Intacct, Netsuite) and industry trends.
Minimum of 5 years’ industry experience.
Excellent analytical, problem solving and troubleshooting skills.
Strong business analysis skills and technology/cloud awareness.
Ability to effectively manage project deliverables to meet client expectations.
Superior written and communication skills.
Experience providing training to customers.
Commitment to personal continuous learning and creating exceptional customer experiences.

Preference may be given to candidates working towards or holding a professional accounting designation
